choices: look at the note again upstairs
1.content:
Today was September 10, your 15th birthday. Everyone came over to celebrate it, including all of your friends.

After many hours, your friends go home. After that, your mom, Lynda, comes in with the mail and says, "Nate, package for you". You tear it open after your mom leaves. From inside the package, you pick out a jar of candies. "What are these?" you ask in confusion, You see that there is a note with them. It says:

"These are magic candies that will grant your every wish. Wish wisely and Happy Fifteenth!"

"It must be a joke" you think. For the heck of it, you decide to give it a try.You pop one of them in your mouth, noticing that they have a fruity taste to them. "I wish I had 30 dollars" you wish. Nothing happens. "Figures" you say. You place them down on the dining room table and start to go upstairs. Then, you suddenly felt something in your pocket. You pull it out to reveal 30 dollars.
1.title: The Beginning

a strange man appears in your room

"Some wishes may take more time to work."

What do you do?

1111.content:
"What the? Where are they?" you say as the candies are gone. Suddenly, you see Erin, your sister, walk up to you. You see that she is sucking on a candy.

What should you do?
1111.title: missing

11111.content:
Erin stands there, sucking on a candy rather nonchalantly. She remarks, "Wow! These candies are like, really good!"

Thinking for a short while, she says, "I wish we could eat candy more often."

You sympathize with her plea, as your Mom is a health freak and usually never allows anything in the house that contains high fructose corn syrup or whatever the hell makes good food unhealthy.

Suddenly, speaking of your mom, Lynda walks right in the front door with a bag under her arm, trying to conceal a grin. Erin immediately begins pestering her - "What's in the bag Mom?! Huh?"

Lynda smiles coyly. "I got... Candy!!" She dumps the contents of her bag on the kitchen table. Snickers, Reese's, Twix, M and M's... The whole lot.

"But... Why?" You wonder. Suddenly, you realize. Erin's wish came true...
You glance over and realize that she has come to the same conclusion as you. Uh-oh.

She has a smirk on her face, which you know is bad. What is she up to? As she strolls up the stairs to her room, the jar of wishing candies in hand, you can't help but feel nervous. Maybe your friend Josh can cheer you up when he comes over later...
11111.title: hope she doesn't realize

choices: Check on Erin and the candies
111112.content:
It's 3:30, and you decide to text Josh. You say, "Hey man, want to come over?"

As you wait for his reply, you think about your friend Josh Howards. He's a little bit older than you, 17, but still enjoys spending time with you. He loves to mess with you every once in a while and he's a really funny guy. You know that a few of his jokes will be enough to lighten the ominous mood that comes from knowing that Erin could make a wish on you at any given time.

Josh is also a pretty good-looking guy, and he's got a girlfriend to show for it. Her name's Anna, and she's 16. You find her super attractive and you've had a crush on her since middle school, but there's no way anything would ever happen between you two. After all, she's way out of your league and you'd never do anything to hurt Josh. Still, you can fantasize.

However, you've noticed that Josh and Anna have been fighting lately. You think they might break up soon, and this might impact Josh's mood.

"Hey," he responds. "I'm kinda busy at the moment... how about tomorrow night we hang out. Deal?"

"Sure thing," you say.

Well, now what?
111112.title: Josh cancels

choices: You start thinking of her as your older sister
1111121.content:
He walked upstairs and entered his room when he noticed that the room was big. Abnormally big. It took a few moments before he realised what happened. I’ve shrunk! It must be Erin! Grr…

He turned around to find her when he felt a big itchy sensation in his chest, went back and tried to make it stop. Whether rubbing, scratching or applying ointments, it was all powerless before the omnipotent itch. What the hell is going on?! Was it something in the food? Urggg!

He collapsed onto the bed as the horrible sensation continued, and as it gave signs of letting up he felt the painful sensation of his bones shifting and rearranging themselves. Unlike the itch, this pain passed quickly and he looked down only to find that his arms were extremely skinny. I doubt food poisoning could cause something like this, it must be the candy!

He went towards the door once more to interrogate Erin, but he lost his balance and tripped, not realising the full extent of the changes to his body. He attempted to get up from the ground when suddenly his lower body got extremely hot. What’s happening now?!

He lost all sensation of his lower body, and the heat disappeared as quickly as it came. Little did he know that Erin’s figure was peeking through the door and watching. He panted from the exhausting ordeal and hoped this would be the end of it. Alas, it was not.

He felt a strange sensation go down his back, but he ignored it as it was insignificant compared to everything else. He walked over to the door again, but as he did so, he passed a mirror, glanced at it, walked forward, and then he turned around to look at it again. What in the world?! What have you done, Erin?!

Reflected in the mirror was an adorable twelve-year-old girl wearing a black blouse, skirt, and legwear. Her developing chest poking at her clothes. A terrifying possibility passed through his mind as the missing sensation below came to mind, and he went to check. Nooooooooooooooooo!!!!!

Why did this happen? Erin had been dissatisfied with being below him in the family totem pole for years, and decided that she would make her way up by turning him into her new little sister. As insurance, she made a wish that he would never make a wish to turn back.
1111121.title: Erin's New Little Sister

11111211.content:
He, or should I say she was absolutely distraught at her transformation, and started to feel extremely self-conscious about the outfit she was wearing. She went to change her outfit, but she found that most of the outfits were as girly as that one or more so. Sighing, she gave up on changing her outfit and went out to find Erin. Why…?

A couple of tears even poured down her face, the transformation apparently effecting more than just her appearance, but also making her extremely emotional. She ran past a couple of family members, but they acted as if it was perfectly normal for her to be like that which made a disturbing thought rise up in her mind. It couldn’t be that powerful, could it?

She ran to Erin’s Room, and caught sight of Erin grinning on her bed, “Hey, little sis. Like my present to you? You get to live as Anna, my little sister.”

A thought went through her head saying that being her little sister might not be too bad, and that he’d live a much better life than as a man, but he quickly discarded those thoughts. What the hell am I thinking?!

“Change me back! Where are the candies?” she demanded.

“No. You will be my little sister forever, ehehe,” her sister replied. She was about to reply to her sister when she started talking again, “These candies are great. Look”

Her sister hovers above the ground as if gravity doesn’t even exist and flies around freely, “I’ve always wanted to be a magical girl! And I get a little sister too, this is great, ehehe”

“Please change me back,” she politely asked. Why won’t she change me back? She’s never been like this. Is this that important to her?

“Sorry, little sis. Relax, we’ll have lots of fun together,” her sister giggled.

New memories from this reality started to sprout one by one next to her old ones, and as she compared them she began having thoughts that being her little sister might not be all that bad. When I think about it, my old life was really dull and boring. No, I’m a boy! I can’t do this…

“I don’t want… To be,” she started replying before she stopped. Why change back? It’s so much better like this, stinking male pride. I’ll just get rid of it. The last vestiges of her manhood gradually slipped away, until she completely accepted her new identity.

“Y…Yeah… You might be right, Big Sis. Wanting to go back is a stupid idea, I don’t know what I was thinking,” she replied.

“Ehehe, I understand, why don’t we play tonight and have some fun?” her sister suggested.

“O…Okay…” she replied.
11111211.title: You start thinking of her as your older sister

111121112111.content:
You look up at the collar in Kate's hand then into her eyes. You're confused at her change in attitude.

"You just told me that you love me and always will. Why are you making me be seen as this catgirl?"

Kate sighs and shakes her head. "Yes, I told you that I loved you and gave you these candies as well as the card I signed confessing my love. The least you could do is prove that you love me, too, by being a catgirl for a little while. Am I asking too much, or do you not really feel the same about me?"

Suddenly, you feel like all jackass instead of part cat. Or maybe it's because you're a 'fraidy-cat. She did wish that the collar will make everyone think your new form is normal. That means no one will tease you and you don't have to be embarrassed. Only you and Kate will know the truth. What do you have to worry about? Is her request really too much to ask to prove your love?

"Kate, I'm sorrrrrry. You'rrrrrrrrrrrright." you say as you wipe the tears from your eyes and stand back up. Your tail swings around involuntarily and brushes against Kate's leg as you take the collar and tell her, "Forrrrr you I prrrrrove my love." With that you fasten the pink collar on your neck listening to the bell jingle as you do.

Kate smiles, or is it a smirk, then leans down and tenderly kisses you on the forehead. "That's my cute little catgirl."

That comment doesn't sit well with you, but you push it aside as she gently scratches behind your ears then strokes your hair. It feels so good that your tail swings merrily by itself and you find yourself actually purring even after she stops. You sit back on your haunches and timidly smile while you wait to find out what Kate is going to make you do next.

As you sat on the floor waiting for Kate, you reached up and touched your new pink collar. You could feel the bell and gave it a pat with your fingers so it tinkled. Then you did it again. For some reason, you found the sound and sensation funny and giggled while hitting it again until you heard Kate move and turned quickly to her.

One thought seemed to be coming to mind. Just one thought process. One thing you noticed was how much taller the adults were. You were just a teenager after all, and the adults were pretty tall and towered over you. Even the women, with their high heels, looked taller than you. You didn't have anything like that on your feet. You just had your socks, that looked very ill-fitting for this occasion.

"I wish I was taller."

The words came right out of your lips; right as you thought about how tall everyone was. Part of you wanted to fit in here, so you had to fit in some how. Perhaps you could gain a few inches or something...

"Ouch." You winced to yourself as you almost one-hopped for a second. You suddenly felt a little bit of squishing on your feet. Luckily, no one noticed you acting weird, or maybe they were just used to it. After you got your foot back down, you looked down at your feet, your eyes widening a bit as they did. Your socks seemed to be morphing right before your eyes, shifting and twisting around your feet. As they did, they seemed to be pressing more around your feet, making them feel a bit squished. First of you, you noticed how the hem of the socks on your ankles began shrinking, showing more of your ankles as they did. In addition, you saw the socks beginning to divide down the middle; the smooth upsides of your feet beginning to be shown.

"Excuse me." You heard a voice from behind you; seeing some random guy behind you.

"Oh sorry."

You spun around a bit to let him through as it caught you a bit off-guard. Right as you spun around to let him by, you heard a *CLANK* *CLANK* on the ground, right near where you were judging by the sound. You looked back down, seeing the tops of your feet totally exposed. However, underneath your socks, a solid footing had formed, giving you that sound from earlier. Before you could think about it, the socks as a whole began hardening, squishing your feet even more as they solidified. A solid black coloring washed over the socks, taking away their former grey look. To be honest, they almost looked like ballet flats.

"What are these doing on my feet?" You asked yourself. Still, you had to admit.....they were a bit cute. You shook your head a bit as you thought that, wondering where it came from. Right after that, the front of both shoes, as you could call them that, opened up, showing two pairs of toes. Both of them looked....how could you put it.....prettier than before. They were smooth and the nails were perfect.

"Just what is....WOAH!"

Suddenly, you felt yourself prop up, as you seemed to grow about a few inches. Almost immediately, you seemed level with most of the people, although you had trouble trying to remain balanced for some reason. You looked down again, and you saw that at least 3 inch heels had sprouted beneath your newly-transformed socks; turning them into, frankly, into a cute pair of black high heels. Your feet twisted and ached a bit, as they gently curved into the heels, giving them a bit of a natural and feminine curve to them.

"Woah, these are like Mom's." You said agape, although you closed your mouth soon. "Still, they do make me taller. Perhaps I could actually talk with someone now."

Hearing your heels clack along the ground, you got more used to them with each step, although you had to move your legs in a certain way just to keep yourself from falling down. The fact that you were wearing women's shoes didn't seem to affect you at all.

"Looks like the party's still going strong..." You scratched the back of your head, noting that more people had definitely showed up to... Whatever this get-together was. As per the time you and Erin had been here, the party was filled with adults, most of whom you assumed to be men and women ranging from late 20's to, at least, mid-30's. Then again, this was only an assumption... Then you thought in a certain urgency.

"ERIN." You exclaimed, turning a few heads, viciously searching the room, completely struck with panic. "Erin?! You around?!" You called, now roaming the halls of this mystery house, checking every nook and cranny, every slightly open door... It was at this point when you realized just how many people were here. This only made you wonder what sort of event this was, relatively young men and women, all looking incredibly spiffy, formal, well-dressed. The women wore amazing looking dresses, the men donned suits, almost business like, and, you hated to admit it... But, they did look... Handsome... What sort of event was all this?

"I'm certain she walked this way..." you stopped in your tracks, in the middle of another packed hallway.

"Maybe you can help me out here... Take Erin and I home..." you sighed, opening the palm of your hand to reveal the last of the candies in your possession, seeing as Erin, wherever she went, had with her the remainder of the candies, leaving you with only one candy, to be used carefully.

Just as you were about to slip the candy in your mouth, without any warning whatsoever, you felt a hand grasp your shoulder.

"Hey, you!" The womanly voice chirped, looking into your eyes with big, blue eyes. You stood still, absolutely frightened. You scanned this mystery woman from head to toe... She looked to be in, more or less, her early 30's, strongly resembling the look of your mother when she was around that age.

The next thing to stick out was that long, blonde hair that seemed to be of a perfect shade, not too dark, but not overwhelmingly bright. As for the clothes she donned, she wore a somewhat tight maroon colored, sleeveless dress, a pair of flats on her feet and all put together by the perfect amount of makeup about her and a small, dark brown belt hugging her waist. Her lips were perfectly coated in a light-red lipstick, which looked to be an ideal, perfectly kissable size.

For one reason or another, you recognized her, and didn't recognize her, simultaneously. You knew for a fact that you had never known, or seen this woman, but, you felt as if you had seen her before, in a manner similar to deja-vu.

"Oh..." You started, speechless, looking down to her, despite the height difference of one inch, she looked to be about 5'5". "...Hi." you sheepishly greeted, extending your hand.

"Oh, come on! We've been looking for you all night long!" She laughed taking you into her embrace, leaving you awkwardly returning the hug.

"Where have you been, anyway?" The mystery woman asked.

"Ugh... Just... Around, Ma'am." You sighed.

"MA'AM?!" She questioned, wrapping an arm around you as she walked you off somewhere, effectively detouring you from your search for Erin.

"Please, we've known each other for, like, ever! Call me Liz, like you always have!"

"Okay, Liz..." you sighed.

"Good..." Liz laughed as she looked you over, you noticed that her eyes stopped on the candy held.

"Oh! You shouldn't have! How'd you know I've been craving something sweet!" Liz chirped, swiping the candy from your hand, the very last candy you had.

"Liz! NO!" You called, reaching for the candy as she unwrapped it and tossed it in her mouth.

"Calm down, girl!" She called, defensively. "It's just a little piece of candy!" She assured, finally stopping, leading you into a group of other women, three other women, excluding Liz.

"You have no idea..." you thought to yourself. Perhaps it was over for you... Maybe you were too far gone.

The other women looked to you, wide grins and twinkles about them.

"Oh, Hi!" One squeaked.

"Hey, girlfriend!" Another sung, walking over to you, handing you a peck on the cheek, a ritual among adult women that you noted among your mom and her friends.

The third and final woman looked to you, a gleam of light in her green eyes. "Good of you to join us!" She smiled a soft smile.

"...Hi..." You waved as Liz and this small group of women conversed about who knows what, paying you no mind. Why had they dragged you here in the first place? The three other women, too, looked to be in their early 30's...Though, again, for one reason or another, all of these women, not just Liz, looked familiar...

Despite their subtle familiarity, despite the fact that Liz continued to suck on the candy as she spoke with the other women, perhaps she'd never know that they're capable of wish-granting... Perhaps she'd just eat the candy like any other candy, without wishing... Since the women paid you no mind, perhaps you could silently slip away and find Erin, and put all this behind you.

As the women continued speaking, you backed away, slowly, thinking yourself to be a master of subtlety. Just then, Liz, continuing to suck on the candy looks your way, a twinkle in her eyes.

"Hey, Nat!" She called to you.

"Nat?" You asked yourself, muttering under your breath.

"Y'know..." Liz began, walking over to you, a sway about her hips. "You've been acting really weird all night, ever since we got here..." Liz sighed, continuing to suck on her candy, looking at you intently.

You gave a gulp before she began.

"I wish..."

11121111111221112211121211111111.content:
"I don't know where Mommy and Daddy are" Trevor said as he realized they were in the house along. "I don't want to be alone!"

"I wish we weren't alone!" Nicole exclaimed, tears forming in her eyes.

"Me too!" Trevor said as the candies started to do their thing....
11121111111221112211121211111111.title: All alone

111211111112211122111212112.content:
Without any knowledge of what had been going on at the party, Trevor and Nicole Wilson were just playing on their own, like any kids their age would be. Both were in the family room right now on their own; Trevor with his toys and Nicole with her doll. Both of them had no idea where their big siblings were, but they figured that they were fine.

"Where's Erin?" Nicole asked randomly.

"Not bothering us." Trevor shoved off. "Probably off with her friends. Nate must have gone out as well, now that I think about it."

"Feels like she's been gone a while though." said Nicole.

"Wanna look through her diary?" Trevor laughed.

Right as he said that though, he saw a brief flash out of the corner of his eyes. He turned to his left, seeing a jar of candies that weren't there before. Trevor remembered them from Nate's birthday, but he thought Nate had those with him. And what was that flash? Still, they were just sitting there unguarded, and Trevor didn't want something to go to waste.

"Hey, Nate's candies are here!!" he said quickly as he got up, completely forgetting his earlier mischievous plans. Nicole looked up and slowly followed him over.

"You probably shouldn't touch them. Those are Nate's." she said.

"Perhaps he shouldn't have left them here then." Trevor reasoned, making Nicole sigh.

"Besides, finder's keepers, as they say." Trevor continued, taking two candies out of the jar. Nicole wanted to sigh, but that was a little funny. What was he going to do though when Nate got back and found out Trevor ate all his candy? Still, she took the candy offered to her, putting it in her mouth like Trevor did. It had a nice sweet taste.

"Oh!! It's pretty good." said Nicole.

"You must have got a good piece then, because mine tasted like poo." whined Trevor.

"Must be one of those jars with the all sorts of flavors, I guess." quipped Nicole. "Just don't eat that color again." Nicole paused, then, "Wait... What do you know what poo tastes like?"

"Uhhhh... Alright!! It was only one time, and I thought the dog was making chocolate, okay!!" Trevor hastily admitted. Nicole snickered at her older brother's admission. Meanwhile, as the candies hit their gullets, something seemed to come to mind for both of them, like something on their mind was being brought out. Nicole went first.

"Our parents are no fun, ya know. Dad's always working, then he says he's too tired to play. Also, just what does a... "system analylist" do?" Nicole saying the last part with difficulty as the words were foreign to her vocabulary and hard for her to say. " I wish Daddy was around more, and doubled the fun!!

Trevor piped in saying, "Momma's sort of the same way. She's always focusing on the older kids, and whenever I tell jokes, she never seems interested, and we're always only doing boring things, like going shopping, and she won't let me have a dog either!! I kinda wish Momma was more exciting myself."

What they uttered and envisioned in their minds had set into a series of events they did not anticipate, and the wheels of fate were already at work... Speaking of work, the candies first take hold of Mike in his windowside office cubicle. He felt spacey for a moment, felt entranced to look out the window. "Wow, that looks amazing!!" he moaned, before coming to, feeling an odd tingle...

What had Mike looked at?
111211111112211122111212112.title: With Trevor and Nicole...

1112111111122111221112121121.content:
"That was odd. No one had said anything about an eclipse today. I wonder how the moon got there like that without anyone noticing." Mike's mind was constantly preoccupied by the odd sight he had witnessed, so much it was distracting him from his work. The eclipse soon ended, but the moon oddly held it's place in the heavens, never moving.

"Does kind of suck I have to work on my son's birthday... Man, I feel so sleepy all of a sudden." Mike yawns and stretches, the popping and closed eyes shielding him from his mass shifting and height reducing by a few inches.

"I got to finish this... finish this..." Mike repeated, growing bored with his work, staring at the screen. "Sometimes I feel like no one appreciates my wonderful coding." About this time, a powerful migraine grips him. "Been staring at this screen so long..." He opens a desk drawer to find a bottle of Tylenol, but found it empty.

"I... can't work like this..." He gets up, turning to his cubicle neighbor. "Justine, tell thine boss I am returning home. MY HEAD IS KILLING ME!!" The room shook with his booming voice. Mike picked up his suitcase and quickly made his escape. "It was like I couldn't control the volume of my voice... and 'thine?' Where did that come from? It's not like a 1000 years ago..." Mike's thoughts jostled a bit at his Freudian slip. "Wait, 1000 years ago? Why did I think that? I was trying to think of medieval times, but that exact number came up in my head instead. Odd."

Unbeknownst to Mike, his hair had been growing longer, and now possessed streaks of navy blue in it and his eyes were now a strange teal color. However, his head was hurting more and more. As Mike's head throbbed during a wait for an elevator that was taking it's sweet time, people outside watched the moon bob and weave the sky in odd trajectories. However, as he got into the elevator, after setting it to the 1st floor, he saw his reflection in the shiny polished elevator doors. From the center of his forehead and his hands Mike saw his skin turning...
1112111111122111221112121121.title: A sudden total solar eclipse...

choices: What's happening with Lynda right now?
11121111111221112211121211211.content:
Mike's skin was tanning before his eyes. "W... What is going..." Mike's sleepiness coupled from the pain in his head made him faint for a moment, falling back against the elevator wall. When he came to, his whole body was darkened from top to bottom. *DING* The elevator opened and Mike came to, the doors opening. "Must have just been a fever dream. I guess I'm more tired thanst thou first thought." Something in that statement bugged him, but this time he couldn't place his mind on it. "Thou must return home quickly for a brief respite."

Mike headed out to his car, only for head, and now his back to ache out doubly so. "Maybe I should not drive while like this. I may hurt someone. Besides, methinks thine automobile will be safe here until tomorrow." Mike puts away his keys, and begins hailing a taxi instead, wholly ignoring the fact his car now had diplomatic plates for some reason. Mike was also distracted too much by his aching back and head to notice two mounds growing on his chest, or that his hair was now mostly dark blue and down past his shoulders.

A taxi pulls up, finally, and Mike gets in, directing the driver to take him home. "So, calling it an early day there?" the taxi driver said.

"I believeth so..." Mike holds his head as another wave of pain rips him from the conscious world again.

"So glad you're not the chatty types. I hate the chatty types." the taxi driver says, putting earbuds into his ears.

As he slept, his facial features softened into a sensuous female visage, replete with small nose and larger eyes. His lips darkened, now appearing to be stained black. His hips flared under his suit as waist shrunk, and those orbs on his chest - they were nearing the D range now. An unnoticed pull in his groin as he flopped about in the seat, no thanks to the driver's bad driving, in the realm of slumber signaled an end to his manhood, replaced with something from the female persuasion.

Mike, now clearly a she, twitched and moaned, slumping over, draping her now waist-length hair over her face, hair that now was all midnight blue but had had a strange ethereal property to it, floating in parts like it was defying gravity and had sparkling twinkles in it that made it look like you could see the cosmos in it. Doubled over, drenched in sweat, Mike was now showing giant bulges on her back and rear, when about that time large midnight blue feathered wings tore out the back of the suit. The taxi driver was far too busy horribly butchering, "Rock the Casbah" to even notice. Another rip, and a long tail coated in the same ethereal hair as her head flooded out from her expanding rear. Mike's clothes then seemed to mend themselves and resized to fit her more petite frame. A black bra formed under her shirt as her underwear shifted to a lacy number.

It was that pain in the head though that made her shoot up, eyes wide open, as a navy blue horn broke out her forehead, possessing a counter-clockwise groove in it running from the base to the tip, said tip growing out some ten inches from her forehead, nearly puncturing the cab's roof. Like a vent blowing off steam, much of the pain Mike had been experiencing was now gone, thought she still felt sleepy, and her hearing seemed off. It faded out, then roared back to life, even sharper than before. She scratched her head, just missing the new horse-like ears poking out her hair, coated in navy blue fur. People who had been watching the moon's wild flight noticed its movements were beginning to stabilize.

The cab finally pulled up to Mike's house, the driver saying, "That'll be $16.73." Mike, now looking like some sort of humanized Princess Luna in a women's business suit, reached into her jacket pocket for what she had thought was going to be her wallet, but instead found a hefty coin purse. "When did I get this? Thy memory betwixts me." Fidgeting with the knot on the purse proved hard in her tired state, finding it too tight. "Open, why don't you..." Unconsciously, her horn began to glow, and like a third hand was helping, unraveled the knot with ease. "Alright then... That was..." She began to pull out the currency within, only to be a bit surprised as it was all solid gold coins that bared her likeness on one side, and the moon on the other. "Where is thy credit card...?" Then an idea hit her, "Maybe he will take these as reimbursement." Handing him 17 of the coins, the driver states, "Hold on there, you got to hand me real money..." About then, he shook his head, looked at the coins again, then turned back and saw his passenger. "Whoa, how did I forget who my fare was? Sorry about that, Princess!! That'll be no charge!! Wow, I have real life princess in my cab!!"

"Princess?" Mike thought, when she saw her reflection in the glass. Seeing herself changed so caused her mind to be overwhelmed by new thoughts and memories, as well as a sizable knowledge of the arcane, and video games for some reason. Mike tried to grasp at her own memories, but they were beginning to feel more and more like a dream. All she could seem to hold onto was that she lived here and had kids and... a wife!! Lynda!! With this, her old and new memories merged into a strange hodgepodge, merging her old identity with her new one. Upon this event, hidden below her pants legs black splotches grew on her outer thighs, like giant birthmarks, and a dull glow appeared in the middle of the sea of black, a white crescent moon appearing in each inky mark. "Nopony has called thee princess in a long time, not since thy abdication. You may call me Luna." Luna smiled as she left the cab and went to the front door.

Upon entering the door and walking in, she declared in her Royal Canterlot Voice, "THY PRINCESS HATH RETURN HOME!!" before passing out asleep on the floor, dead tired, snoring away.

Trevor and Nicole stand over her, puzzled. "Who is this, Nicole?"
11121111111221112211121211211.title: ...a dark tan.

111211111112211122111212112112.content:
‘I wish I knew what on earth was going on,’ Nicole thought. A huge surge of information poured into Nicole’s head as she finally understood what on earth was going on, ‘This will be fun’.

‘I wish Josh was my extremely girly 12-year-old sister, I wish Trevor loved cross-dressing and that everyone appreciates it.’

Nate, or as she’s called now, Anna woke up in a pink bed in a pink room under a pink frilly blanket. She gave out a cute yawn as she gracefully got out of bed in her pink pyjamas. She got dressed in one of her frilly pink dresses with pink tights accompanying it. There was likely more pink in this room than in any other room in the world, and even the wallpaper had frills along the edges.

The memories from the party suddenly struck her at once. Erin got turned, ehehe. I have to thank Nicole for saving me from there and showing me the true splendour of girlhood, ehehe.

Her small breasts were visible pushing against her dress, as she happily pranced out of her room. Her long ash blonde hair swaying back and forth. The return of her memories merely showed how vastly inferior her old life was to this one.

She gracefully walked downstairs as Luna began to wake up, and she could already guess that her sister either transformed Lynda or Mike, “Lynda or Mike?” she asked.

“Mike. How’s your new life, ehehe?” Nicole giggled.

“Great! Thanks so much!” Her melodious voice rang out, and she cheerfully smiled, the happiest she’s ever been. She walked over to the candies, swallowed one and made a wish. I wish Erin was here and back to normal. And I wish that we were extremely close sisters.

Erin materialised, ran to Anna, embraced her and started crying, “I thought I was going to be stuck like that forever”

“Where art Lynda?” Luna asked and Nicole had a cold chill go down her spine. Shortly afterwards, Trevor showed up in his dress and Erin gave Nicole a wry smile.
111211111112211122111212112112.title: Luna wakes up...

choices: Erin's presence snaps you back into reality
11121111111221112211121212.content:
When you left the bathroom, you saw Liz. She was worried about you. Liz had always been a worrier, you remembered how you could always expect Liz to be late because of her incessant worrying about this and that. Worrying about being late on the other hand never occurred to her. That made her endearing to you. When you assured her you was OK, she led you back to your group of friends.

You remembered them all now. You knew each of their names and the details of your friendship with them. You remembered how you met each and every one of them. You remembered the things you had in common with them and the secrets you shared. Your mind had been changed so that you now had several things in common with each one of the ladies and they were all now your dearest friends. There was no place else in this party that you would want to be than with the ladies and you now joined them willingly.

Your personality had changed to make talking with them completely natural and comfortable. You couldn't help to notice how each was dressed and you made sure to compliment them accordingly. This brought of the topic of fashion and you could talk about that like a pro. The topics drifted from fashion to relationships to politics to an event that had recently happened. You talked about people you hadn't actually met but thought that you had known for years. You were more expressive in your conversation using your hands to make a point or touching your friends to express an emotional but in no way sexual connection. You laughed at inside jokes that before tonight held no meaning for you. You was now just one of the ladies and this is where you absolutely belonged.

You was so comfortable that you didn't even think you had another life besides the one you was living now. These were your best friends and you loved them all to death and you knew they loved you. It was in the midst of this revelry that Erin finally found you.
11121111111221112211121212.title: Liz coming to check on you.

111211111112211122111212122.content:
"Nate, can I borrow you?" That particular voice seemed to bring something out of you, somewhat anyway. That was Erin. Your sister, right? Your head was still a bit woozy from everything that had happened so far.

Erin came right up to you as you were talking with Liz and the girls, grabbing your arm as she mouthed a "Sorry" to the other women. She immediately pulled you over to the side, stopping you abruptly and showing you a candy.

"Nate, are you in there?" she asked urgently.

"Um, I think I am...somewhat." You said with a little weariness. To be honest, there still was that female side of you. It was kind of mixed up with the male side right now, but you couldn't tell which was which in there.

"You better be, because we need to get out of here. This place is messing with us." Erin obviously wasn't in a waiting mood. Heck, she had already placed that candy in her mouth. You wanted to ask why she was so antsy, but there wasn't any time before her mouth began to move.

"I wish to undo all of the wishes of Nate and myselfl!"

As those words left her mouth, you immediately felt limp as darkness took your vision.

******

You felt the cold hard floor of your bedroom as your eyes slowly began to wake up. You felt someone shaking on you a bit, a bit urgently too. Slowly looking up, you could see Erin, in her usual teenage self, looking at you with worry.

"E...Erin?" You said in your male voice. Erin immediately sighed in relief.

"Oh good, you're back. I do NOT want to go through that again." Erin said with a small smile. Judging by the sunlight, it felt like it was morning right now. "Mom and Dad are out on some errands right now. I'm not too sure what happened, but I hope that the whole party thing was just our imagination now."

With that, Erin left the room, content for now. The jar of candies was left in your room, since they were YOUR present after all. However, even as you got up, you felt a bit odd. Your body seemed normal enough now, and you were indeed in your normal room. However, you still remembered Liz and the girls from before. You looked down at the gym shorts you were wearing, seeing the normal underwear underneath. However, one look underneath the underwear showed something else- a womanhood still there, even after everything that happened.

Still, that didn't feel odd to you. The only thing that did feel odd was that this normal pair of underwear was not properly suited for your current plumbing so to speak. You needed something more practical and suitable.
111211111112211122111212122.title: Erin's presence snaps you back into reality

choices: Erin joins you in the living room
1112111111122111221112121222.content:
Thinking about it for a while you decided it just didn't matter if your underwear had a hole in the front or not. But what did concern you was your sister's apparent distress. She seemed actually shaken by the "Candy's Experience." With a new found empathy you hadn't had before you decided to help your sister out. You took a new piece of candy in your mouth and said, "I wish Erin didn't remember anything about what happened last night." Then continuing, "I wish that Erin would never eat another piece of these magic wishing candies again." "There," you thought, "she won't remember that anything had ever happened and she'll never get into that type of trouble by accidentally eating one of the candies."

With that taken care of you could get ready for your day. On the floor were the jeans and shirt you was wearing before all this began. Normally you would put the old clothes on for another day or at the very least simply leave them on the floor. Today, not only did you fetch out a new outfit but you picked up the clothes on the floor and put them in the hamper on the way to taking a shower. Even though the clothes you picked for your day was just a pair of jeans and a t-shirt. You didn't pick the first pair of each you saw. You considered each article of clothing for a moment before taking them out of the drawer.

In the shower you washed your hair and the rest of you like any other day although you did decide to use the conditioner for your hair which you had never done before. Other that that a shower is a shower. You didn't even pause to examine your new genitals. Why should you, they were a part of you now like your arms and kneecaps.

After the shower you dried yourself off and brushed your teeth. Nature called and you sat down to pee not because 'you was a lady now' but because that was the only way to do it with the equipment you have. The used towel was also placed in the hamper instead of being left on the floor and you did wash down the soap scum from the tub so it would be nice for the next user.

You went down to make breakfast. Usually you would just have a bowl of cereal, but today you decided you wanted to cook some eggs. While retrieving the eggs, you saw the cheese and decided your eggs should be an omelet. You wanted some coffee to go with your breakfast, but you was alone in the house except for Erin and you didn't want to make a whole pot so you could have one cup of coffee and throw the rest out. You poured yourself some juice instead. After eating you decided to wash the couple of dishes you had used. In the sink was a cereal bowl. You assumed it was from Erin's breakfast. You washed her bowl along with your dishes and put them away in the cabinet. Erin was busy in her room and didn't notice or care that you had taken a much more mature attitude towards your breakfast.

You then called your best friend Liz. You wanted to see her in person to apologize for having to leave so abruptly with Erin. You picked up the phone and dialed the numbers that you knew by heart. Liz answered the phone.

"Hey Liz," you said cheerfully.

"Hi Nate," Liz said with equal cheer, "what's up?"

"I thought we could meet at the mall and do some window shopping, if you aren't too busy." Window shopping meant that you weren't planning on buying anything. If you wanted to get something you would have said shopping or some other keyword that Liz would have known exactly what you meant. In your head, you and Liz had been best friends for many years and knew what each other meant instinctively.

"Sure, I have nothing cooking that can't wait. What time?"

"How about eleven, we'll walk around the mall, see what's on sale and then have lunch...then of course more shopping."

"It's a date."

"I'll see ya then. Love ya."

"Luv ya too." and you both hung up. You didn't have to tell her where to meet you at the mall, you had done this hundreds (or even thousands) of times throughout the years. You had a little time before you had to head out so you decided to watch some TV.
1112111111122111221112121222.title: A new day for Nate

11121111111221112211121212221.content:
Perhaps it was because of your wishes, but Erin seemed to leave you alone as you just watched a little TV. With her memories of the events gone now, she seemed to have gone back to her more carefree self. Seeing that did make you smile to yourself. That experience was pretty bizarre, so it was probably best for someone like Erin to forget.

That being said, looking at the clock, it was 10:30 right now. Perhaps you should get going. Just for any particular situation, you grabbed 2 or 3 of the candies, just to keep yourself prepared should something happen or come to mind. To be honest, you hoped there wouldn't be, and it would just be a nice day with your friend. With that in mind, you said a brief good bye to Erin, who waved back a bit before you left the house, leaving in your car. It wasn't too long before you could see the central mall in the distance, turning off the road and into the parking lot. You found a nice spot that was close enough to the mall, and got yourself out. You couldn't see Liz initially, but you didn't expect to.

Instead, you smiled as you just entered the mall, being welcomed by a hug.

"Hi Nate!" Liz smiled at you as she left go.

"Hi Liz, nice to see ya. Sorry about the whole party mishap."

"Oh, it's no problem. You had something to take care of after all."

"Indeed." You smiled before walking beside her. "So, shall we get going?"

And with that, you both began walking side by side as you began your little tour of the mall. As you would expect, Liz did a lot of the talking, mostly about current events and what she thought, which did allow you for some discussion as well. At times, you both started pointing out things at the various shops, which pretty much involved everything. You briefly pointed at the little sports shop to the side.

"Trevor would probably love to see this."

"He would. He's very much like his dad isn't he?" smiled Liz.

"You know it." You replied back.

Other shops and came and passed by, many of them clothing shops and other such places. It was very much like how you always spent these leisurely days with Liz, and that was how you liked it. Though, as you were both walking, you went into one of the smaller clothing stores, just to look around for a bit. There were nice clothes of all sizes, for men and women of course. However, as you were looking through the many aisles, you happened to look upon a set of women's panties. Granted, what you were wearing right now felt good enough for your day. Still, it might help to have something just in case. It sounded reasonable enough in your mind, and there was a discount too. Why wait?

"Well Liz, looks like I found something after all." You said to her.

"That's probably the first thing you've bought here in a while." Liz said back.

"Well, it's good to be prepared." That was reasonable enough as you paid for said clothes, having them put inside a bag. You both had spent a good amount of time looking around, and as you left with your purchase, your stomach rumbled.

"Guess we know what time it is." Liz laughed a bit, making you laugh and agree as well.
11121111111221112211121212221.title: Meet Liz at the mall

111211111112211122111212122212.content:
Later in the day, your mom, Lynda came home. "Hello!!!" she bellowed when she entered into house at no one in particular. When there was no answer she assumed that everyone had gone. She took this opportunity to enter the kids rooms and tidy up a bit. It was an almost daily ritual to go into the kids rooms and to pick up what was on the floor and just in general clean.

She trudged up stairs into Erin's room first. It was as she expected. Stuff all over the floor, cups on the dresser and an unmade bed. Typical for a teenager regardless of gender. Lynda picked up what needed to be picked up. Put the used clothes in the hamper. Made the bed and did what ever else needed to be done. Soon the room was in her mind presentable.

Next she went to the bathroom and found it spotless. The used towels had been replaced with fresh ones on the rack. The used towels were in the hamper. The tub had been scrubbed, even the toilet seat was down. "Wow," she thought, she hadn't seen this before.

She then went to Nate's room and found the room also well maintained. It was obvious who cleaned the bathroom as Nate's room was in perfect order. The bed was made and nothing was on the floor. It looked as good as Lynda's room herself. Since everything was in its place, the jar of candies which was the only thing new in the room stood out. She opened it and looked inside to see the treats. She decided to have one and left the room.

On the way to the den to finish her needlepoint she wondered what had gotten into Nate. But she thanked god for small favors. While the candy was dissolving in her mouth, she was still thinking of the miracle that was Nate cleaning his own room. She thought to herself, "I don't know why he did it, but I wish that Nate would continue doing what he is doing and that whatever got into Nate would also get into Erin."

At that moment, Erin who was with one of her friends listening to music found herself transported (without her noticing anything different) to the mall. She was about to have lunch with her brother Nate and her friend Liz. They had been best friends for as long as she could remember.
111211111112211122111212122212.title: Later in the Day

choices: Liz tries to fix Nate up with the handsome waiter
1112111111122111221112121222121.content:
You and Liz met Erin at the Ruby Tuesday's that was in the mall. You must have gotten separated from her while shopping but she knew where you were all meeting for lunch. "Where have you been?" you asked Erin.

"Oh just walking around, you know I would lose my head if it wasn't attached."

A hostess asked you how many were in your party and you put up three fingers to indicate the amount. Soon a table was ready and you followed the hostess to the table.

Erin wondered what you had bought and you showed her your package. Inside were the panties. There were three loose pairs of full brief style panties each in a different soft pastel color. "Pretty," she said. Although from her tone you could tell that she didn't like them.

"What's wrong?"

"I didn't say anything was wrong," Erin said trying to put a what who me tone into her voice.

"I know that tone." Now that you and Erin were both suffering from the same "I wish you would join the ladies." wish you had become very close. You were no longer brother and sister...well you still were physically but your relationship had changed to one of adult sisters who had shared everything since infancy.

"Well, they are in just such bland colors. They are all soft pastels. They have no oomph."

"Well who is going to see it anyway. Well besides you and mom."

It was at this point that Liz spoke up. "I think that Erin has a point. What if you meet a man, would you want him to see you in that?"

"Sure, why not?"

"You can't be sexy, if you don't feel sexy? And those panties won't make you feel sexy."

"But they are comfortable."

"You can be sexy and be comfortable too." Erin said.

"I've seen your panties, you should talk." you retorted.

"My panties are prettier than yours." Which made sense since in reality he only had male briefs at home.

"Do you remember Margaret? She used to only dress for comfort like you, but I talked to her and we did a makeover. She found a man immediately." Liz stated.

"Who says I am looking for a man?"

"Everyone who is not married should be looking for a man. You should find one and settle down like me and Carl."

"I don't know if I am ready." Which was true he is only fifteen even though he acts as if he is a woman nearing thirty.

"I have known you and Erin forever and I know you are ready....That goes for you too Erin."

A handsome waiter witnessed the end of this exchange, looking for an opportunity to take their order.

What happens next?
1112111111122111221112121222121.title: The three friends have lunch

11121111111221112211121212221212.content:
The waiter seemed to be about the age of Liz, and pretty handsome as previously stated. You had to admit that too, though you weren't sure about that glint in Liz's eye. Right from the moment she talked about hoping you could settle down like she did, you knew that her mind was set on it. Though, as you all began to order what you liked from the menu, Liz began to add her "extra thoughts" to the conversation.

"All right, anything else I can get you?" the waiter asked.

"Actually, I have something I'd like to ask you." smiled Liz.

"Uh oh." you thought to yourself.

"Yes?" the man asked.

"You're name is Jeff, correct?" she asked, remembering his introduction from earlier.

"Ah yes. Jeff Hartford." Jeff said, sounding as polite as he could,

"That's great." smiled Liz. "I'd like to ask a particular question if you don't mind."

"Please, ask away." Jeff smiled sincerely.

"Okay, I'd just like to ask: What do you think of Nate here?" What the heck kind of question was that? That was on your mind as you gasped at Liz before turning hesitantly to Jeff. Did Liz have any subtlety? Apparently not to ask a random guy a question like that. Jeff seemed a little hesitant himself, like he wasn't sure what to say, but he did answer.

"Well, from what I can tell, you seem like a nice lady." He said politely.

In the hallway, your sister passed you and jabbed you hard in the stomach with something.

"Here's your B-day card, Twerp. Enjoy." she said as she continued down the hall not paying any attention to you bending over in pain.

You wished that she wasn't such a bitch. Yeah, you've always teased each other, but recently it's like she thinks she's better than you. You wished she would act more like when she was little.

1112111111212222122211221221111211112111.content:
Suddenly, a strangely dressed man appears in your room. He has on a blue cape with white stars and moons and wears small, wire-rim spectacles. His dark brown eyes flash around the room as he's obviously confused trying to know where he is. Finally, they land on you and go wide when he glances down and notices the box.

"Oh, my," he gasps in a crackling soft voice. After several deep breaths, he adds, "You must have made the wish I was hoping nobody ever would."

"Wish? Huh? Oh, yeah. I guess I did," you manage so surprised to actually believe what has happened.

"So, you wish to know who came up with the idea of these candies?"

"Ah, yes sir, but I thought it was a joke someone sent me as a prank for my birthday."

"Well, young man, besides informing you of the idea, I can also tell you that those candies are truly magical and can grant wishes, at least most wishes. So do be careful using them or letting others have one."

Still amazed at all this, you continue to behave with respect taught by your parents. "Yes, sir. I will definitely be careful."

With a kind smile, he approaches you and pats your head. The cape flies out with his arm like a bat's wing, and suddenly, ...

1112111111212222122211221221111211112111.content:
Your vision goes blurry for a a couple seconds, and when you can focus, you are in a room like you've seen in history books of the early twentieth century. The smell of sugar is in the air, and there are two children, a boy and a girl about ten and eight respectively, sitting at a table in front of a bowl of candy treats that look like the ones you have in the box.

As they each take one and begin to roll them in their mouths, the little boy calls out, "These are the best you've ever made, Grammy."

The little girl nods, then after several seconds adds, "Too bad they aren't magical and could grant wishes while you suck 'em."

A noise from the far corner catches your attention, and you see a young man put down a newspaper and lean into the light in the room. His features seem vaguely familiar. Under his coal black hair slicked down on his head, his dark brown eyes seem to sparkle as he speaks.

"Do you think magic is real?" he asks.

"Of course!" the girl exclaims, and the boy shrugs and says, "Maybe."

"Well why don't you box up some of those candies and send them to someone with a note saying they are and see what happens?"

The little girl springs from the chair calling, "I know just who to send them to," as she pulls a small box from a a cupboard.

"And who's that?" the boy asks.

"The boy that lives on Holland Street. It's Nathan's birthday in a couple days. It would be a great surprise."

Before she filled the box from the candy in the bowl, the room faded and you found yourself back in your room. The man was gone, and you wondered if he had ever been there. Just because two kids thought about it doesn't explain why you received these in the ...

"Oh my!" you thought realizing that you live on Holland Street and your name is Nathan - Nate for short. But these kids sent that box at least fifty years ago.

You unwrapped the candy as you narrowed your choices also recalling the old man's words about being careful.

"Nate," your mom called. "Your Aunt Martha and your cousins are here. Come on down and greet them."

Your birthday was going so well, and now your two cousins - Tommy, 17 and Annie, 14 - have arrived. That means you'll have to play some games with them and pretend to like whatever they and your aunt got for you. They are so conservative that it's bound to be church clothes.

Lost in your thoughts, you automatically unwrap the candy tossing it in your mouth as you walk out of your room leaving the box of candies on your desk. Why can't they be more fun and give you things like games and toys? You wonder if they understand what you like. Of course, you're never sure what to give them as presents, either.

"Man, I wish," you think to yourself. ...

1112111111212222122211221221111211112111.content:
"I wish I was somewhere else."

Sure enough, in a poof of smoke you evaporate from your room and end up at the foot of the stairs about to enter the living room where your cousins and aunt are waiting for you.

"Well, I guess that goes back to the first rule of wishing: Be specific!" you think as you march resolutely into the room. "Hi Aunt Martha, Tommy, Annie."

Hi Nate," they all call. Tommy comes over and gives you a high five followed by Aunt Martha's hug. Annie doesn't seem so sure, but she finally gives you a hug, too, somewhat rather affectionate for a cousin you think, and you see her blushing as she backs off.

"Does she maybe have a crush on me?" you wonder. Then you think of the candies and that you could use one to find out or even give you the ability to read minds. That would also help in school for tests or when a teacher calls on you for an answer.

Tommy leans back in and whispers, "I brought some cool stuff along just in case, you know ... boring."

He points to the boxes wrapped and stacked on the table that look like they contain shirts, socks and underwear. You never thought of it before, but certain boxes always seem to give off an aurora of clothing. They're hardly noticeable for girls (they want and mostly get clothes, so everything seems the same), but for boys whether a birthday or Christmas (or any religious holiday where presents are given) boxes and wrapping paper scream "Hey I've got clothing!"

Now there's another idea: the ability to see into presents or through walls and stuff. Something to consider for wishing later.

Fortunately, Annie runs off to play with your sister, Aunt Martha and your mom head to the kitchen, and Tommy excuses himself to check out, more likely hit-on, your next door neighbor, Kaitlynn, a sixteen year old red-headed cheerleader who is sitting on her front porch.

So you go back to your room considering what the next wish is that you should make.

1112111111212222122211221221111211112111.content:
As you stand by your desk with a candy in hand thinking, your door bursts open and then slams shut, and you hear the lock click. Spinning around you see Annie backing up, then hear your sister's voice through the door after she tries the knob and can't get in.

"That's OK, Annie. I know you can't hide in there forever." Then footsteps walk off down the hall.

Annie turns around and sees you causing her to gasp. It actually makes her look very cute, but then you realize that she is rather a cute girl.

She's about 1.6 meter topped with auburn hair that curls in below her neck and cascades a couple inches over her shoulders. Her chest and hips are small as she has just started to blossom, but they are perfect with her slender frame giving her mature looking curves. Her head has a blushing round face centered on a button nose and with the greenest eyes. All the rest of her family have a shade of brown, and she got a nickname because of them and her mischievous nature which is probably why your sister was after her: Little Witch.

You stand there stunned and partially entranced not saying anything.

"Sorry, Nate. I didn't mean to ..." she starts apologizing then smiles and says, "Thanks, Natey," as she reaches over and takes the candy from your outstretched hand.

Before you can stop her, she unwraps it and puts it in her mouth. You shudder hoping she doesn't accidentally make a wish.

"This is really good, Natey. What kind are they?" she chirps interrupting your panicked thought.

Without thinking you answer, "Uh, wishing candies."

"Oh, like magic? Neat-o, Nate-o." she giggles. "In that case, I wish that you ..."
1112111111212222122211221221111211112111.title: You are interrupted while trying to decide.

"Sure, Annie," you say walking to her.

Before you know it, you've raised your hand to her head and leaned in to kiss her right on the lips. When you let go, she gasps wide-eyed and you step back shocked yourself of what you did - No, what your body did. It was like something just made you do it.

Annie is blushing bright red as she speaks. "Did you really read my mind?"

"No. I just, ... just felt compelled to, ah,... kiss you. I'm sorry," you say feeling embarrassed. Then suddenly you don't. You feel happy. "Wait, I'm not sorry," you add smiling at her. Then you realize you're doing what she's thinking, that she didn't want you to be embarrassed.

"Yes, I like you Annie. You're very pretty," comes out of your mouth next causing you to freak. Quickly you tell her, "Please stop thinking for me to ... Yes, I have a whole box."

That makes you remember the candies, and you pick up the box to unwish this and ...

You pick up the box and start to open it for her to choose since you like her and want to please her. Then you think she might wish you to not like her, and you think that would hurt. Actually, the thought she wants you to unwish liking her does hurt, and you close the box quickly almost on her fingers.

1112111111212222122211221221111211112111.content:
"But, Natey. If you like me so much, why can't I have a candy," Annie whines making a seriously cute pouty face.

You start to tremble at that, but know how you can fix this. You grab a candy and stuff it in your mouth.

"Now, Nate," Annie begins sounding scared. "Remember that we're cousins, and we can't be together. It's wrong. You know it is. So if you really like me, you will stop liking me so we don't get into trouble."

Pausing in your wishing that she like you as much as you like her, her words and your moral compass begin to spin in your head. If you like her so much, why would you force her to like you? If it's not culturally and morally acceptable to like your cousin this much, shouldn't you bow to that. If you two became girlfriend-boyfriend, you would get in trouble with more than both families. It's not something that you can change, can you?

You stare at the girl that you like more than anything in the world. You idolize her. You want her to be happy, and here you are about to do just the opposite. But if you make her like you, she would be happy, but you'd both be miserable because it's deemed wrong.

Both hands go to your head to stop it throbbing from all these difficult questions, and you squeeze you eyes shut to help stop the pain. You can taste the candy dissolving quickly but remain confused and stuck.

"What to do? What to do?" you ask yourself silently over and over.

Finally, your brain gives way as words fill the air.

"Um, Annie, ... that thing about you being my girlfriend, I, um ..."

"It's OK, Nate. I know we live too far apart for it to really work and I'm younger and ..."

You pick it up and read the words aloud.

"Hocus Pocus - The Book of Annie"

Quickly you open the book. As you turn each page, you hear a sound as if someone was speaking. Flipping a few pages at a time makes it sound like a voice and words, and you recognize it as Annie's. You start to thumb the pages pages rapidly.

"Help me. Find a way to change me back."

"Annie, if you can hear me, I will look and find a way," you yell at the book then flip the pages again.

Care must always be taken when using magic. Children should be properly supervised.
Do not use when under emotional stress.
Not responsible for typos that cause unwanted results.
Product of the USA. All rights reserved.

It also contains a copyright date of fourteen years ago. "That's how old Annie is," you think.

Looking to find something useful in the book, you turn to the table of contents and find various chapters on different spells:

Physical transformations - animate and inanimate.
Emotional spells - Love, Submission, Kleptomania, Triskaidekaphobia, etc.
Health and Wealth - Internal and external body transformations, Money/Stocks/Jewels
Weather - Various clouds and precipitation
Familiars - Human and non-human companions
   plus several more.

However, what catches your eye is:

Introduction and Correcting Accidents
1112111111212222122211221221111211112111.title: You open the book and try to figure out what to do

1112111111212222122211221221111211112111.content:
Skimming the Introduction, you come to the section on Corrections:

Accidents happen. Even the most experienced witches make mistakes. This is why magic is never permanent. It can be like electing a person to political office. Fortunately, magic is much easier to correct than a politician than is more ego that interested in the welfare of constituents. HOWEVER, use of reversal spells should only be used when no other means is practical. A reversal does not guarantee full restitution of the previous state especially if other actions have been performed while the spell was in effect. (Ref: Witchipedia)

Reversal Spell

         As with the use of any spell, you must be certain that the following is carefully followed:

1. One must believe in magic: that it exists, that it works, and that people can use it.

2. A wand or other instrument or gesture that directs the flow of magic is used.

You point a finger making a circle in the air and thrust it at your door. Suddenly your door rattles, and you shiver and shake in response.

You're about to tell her to get lost when you realize you have Candy's body and voice. Fortunately, you hear her stomp off down the hall. Maybe you should wish yourself back, but that may affect the current spell and cause the reversal to go awry.

There's a bright flash of light causing you to close your eyes. You feel your body being twisted, crushed, and melted. Once that stops, you slowly open your eyes only to realize that you don't have eyes. However, you can sense your surroundings.

Everything looks gigantic as if you're lying on the floor. You try to move to get up, but can't budge. Even just trying to roll over is impossible. That's when a huge face appears over you. It looks like ...

"Candy? What happened?" you try to shout but only hear a weak very high-pitched squeak of the words.

"Nate? It's me, Annie," comes loud and clear from Candy's lips. "I think the wish just reversed you and me instead of the actual spells."

Her enormous hands come down and massive fingers clutch you pulling you up into the air. It almost feels like you are flying. She turns you over twice making you dizzy. Then she starts to peel back your outer layers. It's as if your skin was pulled back but without any pain.

"Annie," you squeak softly again with all the strength you can muster in your voice. "What can we do?"

"Well, we have two choices. I can try the reverse spell and hope the effect from the candies magic doesn't create a side effect, or I can use a candy and try to make a much clearer wish and hope that the witch magic doesn't effect the wish."

You ponder this but soon realize that at this point, it probably doesn't matter since the magics have already been mixed. The only thing you can do is hope ... No, believe because the most important aspect of magic is believing in it.

"I believe in you and whichever magic you use, Annie. I believe it will work."

"OK. Here goes," comes Annie's reply.

You get bigger and bigger and think you're going to explode; but just before you do, it stops and your eyes (you realize you have eyes again) adjust and can see forms in the room. Another couple seconds and they gain focus.

"Annie! You did it. We're back," you cry with joy and give her a big hug, a hug that feels more than happy and that you hold way longer than the relief that you felt initially.

As you slowly move apart, your eyes look into hers.

"Such pretty green orbs," you think, and before you know it, ...

1112111111212222122211221221111211112111.content:
Everything seems to go dark, and your body feels like it's floating for several seconds until you fall on the ground. The cool air conditioning now blows right across you, and you can't see the screen for what seems like seat backs beside you as you lie on the ground. A screech owl howls in the distance, and the crackling of twigs and leaves follows getting closer.

"Wha-what happened?" you stammer looking around with your chin still only an inch above the ground.

Two feet appear in front of your face, and you start looking up the slender, ghostly pale legs growing out of the shoes. Your view soon finds a pair of shorts and then looks straight up from under a girl's small chest who is leaning over you. Her hair falls down on either side of her face obscuring it with darkness. An alabaster hand reaches towards you with fingers outstretched. You start to scramble backwards on your belly as her voice comes like a phantom in a breathy deep whisper.

"Come and get up from behind those tombstones, Nate."

You recognize it as Kate's voice and finally look around as you rise to your knees to find yourself peering out from behind a line of grave markers as a full moon beams light where the movie screen used to be. You tentatively take her hand. It's very cold as if she might be a ghost or something worse. This sends a shiver through to your core and makes your eyes snap onto hers. They glow green from her shadowed face, and you begin to babble.

"Ka-ka-ka-ka-Kate?"

"Silly," she giggles as you stand next to her. "It's just me."

The realization that it's Annie finally takes root, and you relax feeling warm again.

You turn and look at Kate's apologetic but cute face remembering that she is really Annie who used her witch powers in the movie theater. It is rather interesting to actually see a movie being made, and being in one fascinates you.

The transformation is so amazing that you start to shiver especially as the puppet creatures begin to weave and bob like tentacles with mouths out for a snack.

At first you are concerned; but as it goes on, you become more and more comfortable with her actions. Everything she does is cute and adorable.

As you leave the theater, you're holding hands, and she is talking excitedly just the way Kate does when she's happy about something. Everything she does makes you feel wonderful, and you're so glad to be with her.

"Nate," she starts looking at you then glancing down as she blushes. "I'm so glad that we finally had this date."

You squeeze her hand and use the other to lift her chin so your eyes meet. Staring into those deep green pools, you realize that you could really go for her as your girlfriend even though she's still your cousin. The way she acts and talks just like Kate makes you smile until you get a brain twitch of what's happening: She only changed the two of you back physically. She's still under her spell to act and talk like Kate.

Quickly you pull a candy and pop it in your mouth before this all gets out-of-hand.

This is a Familiar's Contract spell... Uueeee..." She comically loosens her scarf. Flipping to the appendix, she looks up familiars. "Despite common folklore, familiars aren't demons or spirits, but mortals that apprentice to witches. Unlike children born of witches, the only ways mortals have to gain a witch's power is through a magical artifacts, or by becoming a familiar to a full-fledged witch for 100 years. When a mortal enters into a Familiar's Contract, there are three things to remember. The first is that ALL FAMILIARS MUST BE FEMALE. THIS IS NON-NEGOTIABLE, AS WITCH'S MAGIC IS CONDUCIVE ONLY IN A FEMALE FORM." "Exactly." a familiar voice said. Nate turned and saw his mother in his doorway. "Maybe this time you'll keep a better eye on the candies. I honestly didn't like the idea of calling my son 'mom.'"

"Seeing is believing, and the candies were my way of getting you to see." Lynda told her child. "Speaking of seeing..." she adds, "While I'm a firm believer of the 'Many Worlds Theory' of time travel, just to cover our quantum bases, maybe you should send the note back to yourself now." She flicks a candy to Nate. "A freebie."

"Uh... okay." Nate hastily jotted down what was on the now present note and finished the doodle, then said with candy in mouth, "I wish this piece of paper was on my bed ten minutes ago."

"Now that that is done," Lynda explains, "Before I let you enjoy your day, I should suggest a wish to you and explain how these things work." She sits down in his desk chair, which she has amazingly place on the ceiling. "First, obviously, there's the 'no wishing for more wishes' thing. However, the bag has 1000 candies, so I don't think you'll be running out anytime soon." Nate looks at the tiny sack that looks barely deep or tall enough to put your pinky in, wondering how it can hold so many candies. "Stable Einstein-Rosen bridge, if you're wondering. That's right. There's no candy in there, just a wormhole to where the candy REALLY is." Lynda says to sate his curiosity. Going on, she says, "Second, you can't intentionally kill someone through wishing. Now I haven't got to test it yet, but I think you can't accidentally kill anyone either, but I'm not sure." Nate gulps. "Going on, be specific. As you learned in the previous reality, vague wishing leads to weird results, like you becoming your dad's wife, and having your memories and personality changed. That brings me to my suggestion to the one wish you should definitely make; 'I wish by no means my mind or personality can be altered by any means, natural, magical, or technological, in perpetuity throughout time, until the end of time.' That way, even if, say, Mike were make the same wish again, you'd only change physically. While the universe would change to fit the new world order, your mind would stay intact, and allow you to undo or modify the damage, and not lose yourself."

"Thanks for that detail." Nate utters.

"Finally," Lynda goes on, "never, NEVER, NEVER wish for things to 'be normal,' 'go back to normal,' or anything involving the word normal. It will make the world as is the status quo." She gets up, and finishes, "other than that, enjoy. Cake will be ready in an hour."

Oh, you could just see her face if she didn't think breasts on you were normal. Then again, you honestly felt a bit more confident now. You had talked to her at times, though not too much. Perhaps now could be the time. You had tried to advance on her at times, but you imagined she was cool with it. She was really nice after all, so what could she hold against you?

After a little bit of thought, you heard the bus come in. You got on with the rest of the students there, though you had no idea how things would turn out for you on this day.
11121111112211.title: Mom

111211111122111.content:
Slowly but surely, you walked on to the bus, seeing all the students from your neighborhood. You looked down one more time at your chest, seeing your assets poking through. No one seemed to be noticing so far, not even Tommy, who was your best friend. He was right behind you, but he didn't seem to notice anything. He just looked at you silly when you asked if anything was off.

Anyway, you ended up sitting down in your normal seat. Right across on the other side, you saw Kate sit down as well. You had crushed on her for quite a long time, about as long as you and Tommy had been friends. Why wouldn't you? She wasn't popular in that sense, but many people liked her for her personality. You did as well, as she was as nice now as she was in Kindergarten. She was about average in height, about 5'3, but she had nice green eyes and long dark hair. It really fit with her fair complexion.

She usually had some friends around her, but it looked like she was on her own this time. Perhaps you could finally talk to her? She likely had no idea that you had breasts either. Or at the very least, she didn't think they were weird at all. Perhaps this time you could talk to her. You had tried to advance on her in the past, but nothing came from them. Still, you had to try. Kate was nice enough where she didn't hold much against people.

So, when the bus stopped again to pick up another batch of kids, you slowly came over to Kate's side, to which nobody really paid attention to.

"Hello Kate." Kate suddenly turned and was a bit surprised to suddenly see you there but she recovered, smiling a bit.

"Hello Nate. How are you?"

"I'm doing fine. I see you're well." you began.

"Yes, I'm doing fine." Kate felt a tiny bit uncomfortable as you were sitting there; your breasts partially seen through your shirt. She remembered how you tried advancing on her in the past. She mostly just smiled you off, as you knew you since Kindergarten and kind of knew how you normally acted.

To be fully honest though, as you actually began talking about stuff as best you could, she was a little bit frustrated with your constant advances. Could you take a hint that she wasn't really interested right now? Perhaps that's how boys always are. Kate sighed as you kept talking, which surprised both of you with how much you could talk. Sheesh, did a pair of breasts really give you that much confidence? Just as Kate was thinking, she felt something fall into her hand. She looked down to see a candy there, which happened to fall out of your pocket. She wasn't quite sure what it was, given that she had never seen the candies before, but she felt the need to pop it in her mouth. So, she did just that, putting the rather nice-tasting treat into her mouth.

As that happened though, you just happened to ask if she was free later on.

"Nate....."
111211111122111.title: Seeing Kate on the bus

choices: "I wish you'd understand how I feel!"
1112111111221111.content:
“Nate…” Kate sighed, closing her eyes and rubbing her forehead, in a back and forth motion, as if attempting to relieve some sort of violent headache. In this case, the headache being the ever-persistent you.

You, meanwhile perked up, suddenly, surprised that Kate actually seemed to have some sort of response to your asking whether or not she was free later. It seemed too good to be true.

“Is this happening?” You asked yourself, in your head. Indeed it was. “Could this be it? The moment of truth? Possibly the greatest moment in my teenage life? Let’ find out…” You continued to himself.

Nonchalantly, you dusted yourself off and cleared your throat as if about to make some sort of life-changing speech.

“Yes…?” you responded, all the while, Kate, in her pleasant beauty, thought of ways to let you down gently. Of course, you were unaware of these intentions.

She and you had known each other for quite a long time, and she had thought of the two of you dating before. But, at the moment, she felt neither of you were ready for such things.

Kate sucked on her candy and braced herself for what she was about to do…
1112111111221111.title: Kate's Wish (Tired of your advances)

11121111112211111.content:
“I wish you’d understand how I feel!” Kate exclaimed, rubbing her throbbing head as you continued to chatter about nothing. Her loud shrill caused the entire bus to pause in whatever it was they were doing. Nothing but silence as you and Kate awkwardly stared at each other, causing the two of you to blush violently.

After a few moments, moments that seemed to feel like an eternity to both you and Kate, the silence transitioned into the normal, chatter-filled setting.

You thought about what she said before asking her.

“What do you mean?” You asked her, curious as to why she ended her statement in ‘wish.’

“…” Kate sat silent, still getting over the awkwardness of the situation, brushing her fingers through her luscious, dark hair that glistened in the sunlight that beamed in through the window.

“I mean what I said, Nate.” She said, plainly, wearing a smile you knew was just her trying to be polite. She really was a sweet girl, didn’t have the heart to hurt a thing.
