“And… That means…?” You asked again, still confused by her wish.

She rolled her eyes, still wearing what you knew was a pseudo-smile. She laughed nervous laugh before proceeding.

“It’s just that… I… I don’t think you consider how I feel sometimes, Nate. For years, you’ve been playing your little moves on me… For years!” She continued, passion growing in her voice, much to your dismay.

She exhaled in and exhaled out in attempt to calm herself.

“Listen, Nate, you’re a good friend, a best friend, to me.” She plainly said. “But, If I haven’t said ‘yes,’ yet, it’s probably because I’m not ready yet! And that’s what I’m talking about, Nate! All these years, I don’t think you’ve ever once considered how I feel! The only thing you’ve ever considered is what move you’re gonna use on me today!” She continued, the passion in her voice observing a crescendo.

“There it is…” You thought to yourself. “I guess this is what they call ‘friend-zoned…’” You proceeded in the back of your mind.

“So, Nate…” She said coldly. “I mean what I said. I wish that you’d put yourself in my shoes…” She finished, unable to look you into the eye.

“Well…” You said to yourself, in the mind. “At least we’re friends… I guess…” You sighed mentally as the brakes of the bus screeched, coming to a slow halt. The doors opened and the students around you dashed out of the vehicle

“Bye… Nate…” Kate swiftly said, still not looking you in the eye, sliding herself past you in order to get out.

“I don’t get… I just don’t get it. There she goes, using the word ‘wish’ again…” You said to yourself, under your breath, butterflies fluttering about in your stomach.

"Women." You plainly justified as the reasons behind the peculiar way she was acting.

You walked out of the bus, and there stood your best friend, Tommy, who stood with that strange smile he always had about him.

“Time for class, bud.” You told him, as the two of you began on your way to class.
11121111112211111.title: "I wish you'd understand how I feel!"

choices: Dealing with it and heading to class
111211111122111111.content:
As you both walked towards the building itself, you recounted the details of Kate to Tommy, who didn't seem surprised one bit at what happened.

"That's not surprising. I've known Kate just as long, and she's always been a bit uncomfortable trying that sort of thing." He said, trying to be helpful.

"I guess so. Perhaps I just thought that it would work this time." You sighed. Guess you just didn't understand women like Kate. A thought briefly went to the candies, but there's no way you would use them to do anything like that. Still, nothing made you feel much better as you and Tommy entered the school building together. However, he didn't stick around for long afterwards.

"Sorry bud, I gotta get something done quickly. See you in 1st class!" And with that he was off, making you sigh. That guy always procrastinated, but you did too at times so who were you to judge. After Tommy disappeared from view, that left you to just head to the Freshman Hall to your own locker. You went up the stairs to the 2nd level and went down that hall, passing by all the other students. You didn't see Kate at all, so perhaps she was already here. You didn't have her until 4th period, which was the last one of the day. You didn't have many chances to talk to her in the first place, so that made things harder. Should you apologize? Perhaps that would be a good idea. At least mend what happened so no one can talk of it again.

You walked down to your locker, doing the lock and opening it up. As you switched out which books you didn't need, you couldn't stop thinking about the Kate incident. After that, you shook your head, as you just wanted to put it behind you. Yet, the memory didn't seem to want to do away. It got so hard that you actually started combing your hands through your short hair quickly. Right as you realized that, you chuckled a bit.

"Heh, combing my hair like this. Kate always does that when she's frustrated. Always found that kind of cute." You said to yourself. Kate always had that nervous habit of combing her hands through her hair when she was frustrated or nervous. Old habits never die apparently. Anyway, after finishing getting your books, you closed the locker and began heading out. You needed a quick bathroom break before class, so that was your next destination. You headed straight to the bathrooms down a level, heading in and doing your business. Eventually, you heard the flushing sound and went up to wash your hands. You were a bit frustrated as the Kate event wouldn't leave your mind. However, it seemed to be getting weirder. Brief images of the event were coming into your head, but it was almost like you were seeing them from Kate's view.

"That's weird." However, when you look up to dry your hands, you nearly did a double-take. Your eyes were normally a nice blue, but when you looked in the mirror, they were now a striking green.

"What the heck? What's going on?" You put a hand to your eye, seeing if the reflection was true, and it was. Was it just a trick of the light? Or were you just going insane? Yo had forgotten about the candies right now, as your mind was on many other things. Besides, you had no idea Kate made a wish.
111211111122111111.title: On the way to class

1112111111221111111.content:
"I must be going insane..." You said aloud, continuing to stare into the mirror, looking into your eyes. "I know that my eyes are blue!" You said, continuing to stroke your fingers through your hair. Speaking of your hair, something else caught your attention as you glanced into the mirror, horrified…

“And I know that my hair isn’t this dark!” You exclaimed, staring at your hair, which certainly was a few shades darker. You couldn’t quite put your finger on it, but… The hair color, the color of those eyes they looked a lot like…

“Kates!” You frantically wailed. “The hair looks like Kates, my eyes, too!”

You stood there for a few more minutes, violently inhaling and exhaling, in a panicked state. But, as the minutes passed, the longer you stared at yourself, your fears and anxieties of whatever was going on suddenly died where they stood. It’s not that you quite thought of these aspects, like the hair and eye color, normal. You just became more and more comfortable with it.

“Well…” You calmly sighed. “I think those are the only things that have changed…” You said as your hyperventilation slowed until finally retracting to a steadier pace. And, so, the vicious cycle continued. The longer you stared into the mirror, those slight feature changes became less and less apparent to you. Heck, you didn’t even notice your frame shrink the slightest bit. Also to skip over your attention was your height dropping from 5’6 to 5’5. It all went unnoticed, as you subconsciously continued to comb through your slowly elongating hair.

“What am I even doing here anyway?!” You exclaimed, snapping out of your little trance. “I’m nearly late for class!” As you darted towards your first period class, in this case, English with a particular Ms. Judith Brooks, a young, go-getter type teacher.

You continued to rush down the crowded and clustered hallways, the chatter and various conversations taking place around you, combined with the rush in your steps, left you with a small headache and a foggy mind.

“Left! Right! Another right! Down these stairs, up these!” You said in your mind, guiding yourself to your classroom, no slowing in your speed. You could not be late to this next class.

“And… Bingo!” You chimed, slowing down as you walked inside Ms. Brooks’ classroom. You found yourself a bit shocked. Why was this? You feared you’d be tardy. No, you were certain that you’d be tardy! Yet, the classroom, Ms. Brooks aside, was empty! You looked to Ms. Brooks, who shot you a surprised look.

“Nate? Why so early?” She asked as she sat at her desk, grading papers.

You cleared your throat. “Uhm… I don’t know, I just didn’t want to be late or anything y’know?” You answered, proceeding to your desk.

Ms. Brooks continued to offer you her peculiar look. “I suppose, Nate… You do know you’re ten minutes early, right?”

You immediately turned your head to the clock that hung on the wall. 8:00 A.M. You were indeed early…

“Sorry…” Ms. Brooks started, gaining your attention. “I’m just not used to seeing you here early, Nate.” Ms. Brooks smiled before returning to her grading.

This early arrival of yours reminded you of a trait a particular girl possessed. “Kate.” You said under your breath. Kate certainly was the type who hated, loathed, even, tardiness. If she were late on something, she would be bothered by the not knowing of what she’d missed. It was something you never understood, but, definitely did find to be cute. She wasn't exactly the super-nerdy type, but, not some delinquent, either.

The more you thought about it, the more you began to empathize with Kate’s reasoning behind being early. Never before had you understood it, but, now, her earliness made perfect sense.

Before long, more and more students began to slip into the classroom, until, right before the bell, students flooded the classroom as to avoid a tardy. You noticed that Tommy hadn’t yet arrived. That was so like him…

“He really ought to change that ugly habit of his…” You sighed, failing to notice the change in your vocabulary and view on your friend, Tommy. Heck, on a regular day, you’d be late right along with him. But, unknown to you, this was no regular day.

As Ms. Brooks began to call out roll, that headache returned, with a vengeance. You closed your eyes, breathed in, breathed out and attempted to relax and have rid of this storm in your head. Your mind became mistier and mistier, memories… They became distorted. All the times you’ve had with Kate, of all people, you began to see from her perspective, like the conversation you had with her this morning. As the headache and fog continued to crescendo, escalating in violence, Ms. Brooks called your name and grabbed your attention.

Ms. Brooks looked to you, holding a clipboard with attendance sheet and called.. “Nate…”
1112111111221111111.title: Dealing with it and heading to class

11121111112211111112.content:
"....Smith."

"Here." Before you could even think about it, your hand had shot up and confirmed that you were here. Ms. Brooks had just called you "Nate Smith", right? Where did that come from? Kate's name was Smith, but yours wasn't. You had a thought about asking Ms. Brooks if she had it right, but something in you chose against it. The more you thought about it, the more you seemed to get used to it.

"I guess I'm okay with it."

Anyway, Ms. Brooks suddenly called up the previous night's homework. You groaned at just the thought of it, as you knew that you didn't finish all of it. Your birthday plus the candies really made you forget about a few things. Still, you had to turn something in, so you took out your homework folder and pulled out what you needed. What you pulled out though shocked you. The page was completely done, and with neat handwriting too. Where did that come from?

"Nate, your paper?" You turned up to see Ms. Brooks asking for said homework, which you turned in slowly. You were a bit apprehensive about it, but she took it without problem. As it did, you suddenly began seeing something. It was you writing homework, all of it, and in a different room than you're used to. For some reason, it seemed like you got it done before last night.

Everything just seemed like a mess, though a growing part of you was growing okay with it. There was a side of you that was trying to calm you down, and it resulted in you combing your hands through your hair again. Why did you keep doing this? That was Kate's habit, not yours. In addition to that, as Ms. Brooks gathered her things at her desk, you subconsciously crossed your legs. Since you couldn't see them underneath your jeans, your legs had gotten a bit longer now, with any hair they had just falling off gently, leaving smooth skin behind.

"All right everyone, if you turn to page 23..."

The English lesson had begun, so you whipped out your book along with everyone else. However, once you did, you also eagerly got your notebook out, writing some quick things down. You were okay with notes usually, enough to get by, but right now you were writing stuff that you normally don't think of. You didn't know this and that happened in the book.

As the lesson went on and your furious note-taking continued, your feet began to shrink and curve within your shoes. A gentle curve formed, made by wearing heels at some point, and your feet became much too small for the boy shoes, but also softer too. To be honest, it felt like your clothes were hanging a bit on you, like your t-shirt which was almost long enough for a short dress at this point. Still, you didn't seem to pay it much mind as the teacher droned on about the lesson. It felt as if you were the only one really listening.

Eventually, the bell rung, signaling the end of 1st Period. Ms. Brooks gave out the next assignment, much to everyone's chagrin, and you packed up your books and notebook. What was the first thing you noticed after putting your backpack on?
11121111112211111112.title: "... Smith."

1112111111221111112.content:
"Nope!" You immediately dismissed, pacing about the restroom, continuing to brush your hands about your hair, which also looked a bit darker than usual... Just a few shades darker, but certainly noticeable... And, your eyes...

"They should be... Blue?" You asked, continuing to pace the room, guys giving you a strange stare as they walked past you. You certainly must have looked a bit strange, almost insane.

Quickly, you ran to a mirror, paying the guy washing his hands next to you no mind. You needed another look.

"Green! That awesome shade of green Kate has!" As you stared into your eyes in the mirror. And, the bathroom did seem just slightly taller than usual...

"That's it! I must be going insane! That's all it could be, insanity! All this stress with Kate must be getting to me... I'm so infatuated with her I see her all the time... Even in me!" You said, glancing to the mirror once more. "...Like... I even remember this morning, but... From her view? I see me, but from her point of view..."

"Or! This is all a trick of these crappy lights!" You said, placing the blame on the dimming, beat-down lights of the lavatory. "Yup, that's it! That would explain it all! The hair looking darker, the eyes appearing a different color, the... room being tall? The memories? No... The lights probably have nothing to do with that...."

"I need a second opinion!" You said, darting out the restroom doors, straight to your classroom. You would've asked anyone in the restroom, but, the way they looked at you. They must've thought you to be insane. You needed someone who was unaware of your insanity...

You continued to consider all these things... The point of view, the height, the hair, the green eyes, the way you combed your hair in anxiety... All of those things screamed Kate. Her signature, beautiful eyes, her elegant mane of hair, her rather petite height, those cute little mannerisms of hers...

"What is going on?" You asked yourself as you darted through the halls, finally arriving to your class; Ms. Brooks English class. You slammed the door open, relieved to find that students were still trickling in. Only a few people were currently in the class, Ms. Brooks sitting at her desk, her feet resting on the desk as she played about with her phone.

"There's my second opinion!" You thought, taking a deep breath before walking to her desk.

"Ugh... Ms. Brooks?" You asked, your voice sounding a bit more high-pitched. This made you step back a bit... "That's new..."

Ms. Brooks looked to you, a smile on her face, removing her feet from the desk, placing them on the floor.

"Sure, Nate!" She chirped. "What's up?" She asked.

"I might sound a bit crazy..." You whispered, leaning in a bit. She followed your actions and leaned in, to, sensing the discretion.

"What is it, Nate?" She asked.

"... What color are my eyes...?" You asked, slowly, fearsome of what would be thought of your sanity.

"Uhmm..." She mouthed, gesturing that you look her way. For a moment, she looked into your eyes, you looked into hers, and she immediately replied... "Green, Nate..."

You gulped, her answer sending your heart racing.

"Alright... What about my hair? What color's that?" You inquired, combing through your hair, which now seemed the slightest bit longer.

"A darkish shade of brown... Ugh... Why are you-?"

You cut her off, offering her yet another question.

"And... Do I look a bit shorter to you?"

She scanned you up and down for a fraction of a moment and finally spoke.

"Well... You do look a bit short for a boy your age, but, it's fine! I'm sure you'll get there eventually! Now, is there any reason you'
re asking me these things, Nate...?" She inquired, sounding almost concerned.

There was an air of silence for a few seconds until you finally uttered. "... No reason. Just asking."

"Ooooo-kay..." She dismissed, gesturing that you head for your seat. As you made your way there, the room being unusually tall was definitely there. And... It seems that you weren't going insane. These changes were truly happening, leaving you to wonder what in the world was going on.

By the time you got comfortable at your desk, the entire class had already appeared, including Tommy, who sat behind you, copying off of somebody's homework at the very last minute. You rolled your eyes at his gesture. While you sat here changing, into who-knows-what by some unknown-to-you-force, some things, like Tommy's habits, never did.

"Alrighty, class!" Ms. Brooks chirped. "Hope everyone's doing well this morning!" She smiled, looking to you. "Now, if you all recall, we have an assignment due today, if everyone could pass their papers forward..." She continued, as your mind lay in other places... Like what in the world was happening to you...
1112111111221111112.title: Second opinion

11121111112211111121.content:
Luckily you still had your assignment as normal, so you were able to turn it into the front. You rolled your eyes as Tommy's paper was passed up to your row. It looked so incoherent that you almost had a headache just looking at it. When will he ever learn? Well, it was bound to come back to bite him eventually. All you could was watch until it did.

"All right class, now that that is settled, please turn to Page 20...."

With that done, the class went into the discussion for the day. Honestly, you weren't quite sure what it was about, as English was never your best topic. You could read just fine, but reading between the lines so to speak was never your best quality. That was perhaps what you envied a bit about Kate; she was pretty good at that sort of thing. Perhaps you could actually ask about it sometime if you ever worked up the nerve again after today's rejection on the bus. Well, at least it was enough to try and get your mind off of the weird events today. The last thing you really wanted to do was remember your lack of height, green eyes, and darkening hair.

"So class, what is the author implying on this paragraph? Harold, how about you?"

Oh great, it was that time again. You really weren't into volunteering for this kind of discussion. Not really your thing. You were okay with mingling, but trying to talk about something you had no clue about wouldn't be good. Still, you at least tried to take good notes. You could hang your hat on that at least. Though, to be honest, as you kept writing, your hands began to feel pretty different. During one answer, you looked at your right hand, holding your pencil. Your palm seemed kind of smaller than normal, and your nails were nice and straight, not too long or anything. Your left hand was much the same way, not an imperfection in sight.

"Wait, did I clip my nails this morning?" You made sure to whisper that comment so no one else could hear that. You weren't sure what to say about this, though it honestly didn't feel that bad. Sure, perhaps a little awkward, but maybe Erin messed around with you during the night or something. She wasn't the pranking type, but don't push it. However, in addition to that, as you were wearing a t-shirt, your arms felt smoother too. You worked out every now and then, so you weren't exactly stacked or anything, but the skin on your arms seemed more fair now, with your muscles a bit smaller. Was that a trick of the light too? Or has it just been longer than normal since the last time you worked out? Being in class right now, you weren't too sure.

"Perhaps I can get a better look later." You whispered to yourself.

At that moment, you felt a little awkward in your seat, though it didn't seem like your body was any different. You tried shifting in your seat a bit, but something still seemed off. You looked down at your clothes: a normal t-shirt with shorts. To be honest, your shirt seemed a tiny bit closer to your body, so perhaps it was catching on something and constricting you a bit. You reached down and tried to sort it out. However, as you tugged on it a bit, the result greatly surprised you. The hem of your shirt was connected, almost like glue, to the hem of your shorts!
11121111112211111121.title: During class

111211111122111111211.content:
"What the...?" You confusedly asked aloud, attempting to conceal the question under your breath.

Curiously did you tug at the edge of your shirt, which certainly did appear to be attached to your shorts. As you gave that tug, you took notice that, along with your shirt, your shorts, too were being tugged.

"..." You sat silent, speechless, as you slightly tilted your head downwards as to get a better look below your desk, particularly, your clothes. It was true. The shorts and shirt were now one cloth, almost like a dress. The 'short' part of the 'dress' retained its khaki, beige color while the top half of the 'dress' retained the dark green color of the former shirt.

One other thing caught your attention as you peeked below... "And... Are my legs... Smoother? They look a little more slim, too..." You whispered, again, in a failed attempt of discretion.

"Mr. Wilson!" Ms. Brooks called, at which point you immediately turned her way, only to find her handing you a stern glare. You turn around, only to find the entirety of the class staring emptily at you.

You thought to yourself. "I guess it is true what they say about whispers being louder than normal volume..."

"Mr. Wilson," Ms. Brooks began. "Are you following our discussion?"

"Yes! Yes I am." You nervously said, your voice trembling a bit. You never did deal well with being at the center-stage, so to speak.

She handed you a devilish smile. "So, then. Would you mind picking up where we left off?" She asked, sure you'd fail at this, too.

"Of course..." You sighed. As you scanned the page, attempting to recover the last words you heard, you felt something brushing at the side of your face. Particularly, at the midst of your cheeks. You brushed the hair behind your ears instinctively. As the class, and the teacher, continued to stare you down, you freaked out and reached for your hair. The skin about your face felt notably smoother as well. And, as you touched your face, the way the touch of your hands felt. It felt familiar...

"It's longer.... and... DARKER." You thought to yourself.

"Yes, Mr. Wilson, your hair is very nice..." Ms. Brooks coldly said, igniting chatter and laughter about the remainder of the classroom. "...Mr. Wilson, I'd like to speak to you after class..." She sternly continued.

As Ms. Brooks continued leading the discussion on whatever in the world it was they were speaking of, you looked back to find much of the class continuing to hand you their eyes, in a mocking way.

"So embarrassing..." You thought, blowing off the distinct sound of Tommy's chuckle.

After what felt like an eternity, the bell rang it's ring, effectively dispersing the class. You and Tommy attempted to blend in with the crowd, trying to avoid Ms. Brooks' wrath.

"I haven't forgotten, Mr. Wilson!" she called. You halted, wasting no time in doing so. You turned around, expecting to find Tommy waiting for you, as a friend should... No sign of him. Long gone was he.

"That little..." You muttered as you dragged yourself to her desk, where she stood, tapping her foot in frustration. The toes of her heels clicking as they tapped the ground below reminded you of the trouble that certainly awaited. You looked down to your feet, attempting to avoid eye contact. Something else caught your eye, instead. Your shoes.

"You're kidding! Not the shoes!" You noted your white sneakers... They certainly looked to be changing color and material. The white looked more like a beige-esque sort of color, kind of like the bottom half of the dress-like cloth you wore. And... your clothes looked a bit shorter, certainly a little tighter, and, most certainly more flowy at the end of the cloth. And, just like earlier, most of the hair about your legs had vanished, leaving mostly smooth skin.

"Up here, Mr. Wilson!" You looked to her. To your disappointment, you matcher her height almost perfectly. You know for a fact that, on a regular day, you were two inches, more or less, taller than Ms. Brooks. This left you standing at a short, really short, 5'4." At least short for a boy your age.
111211111122111111211.title: Surprise in Class

1112111111221111112111.content:
You felt so bad right now, and to think it actually started out well enough. Now, Kate turned down another advance from you, and you got in trouble with Ms. Brooks. Not to mention all the weird things about your body. Right now though, you were staring right into her eyes, easily 5'4 now.

"So, Mr. Wilson, are you really feeling alright?" She asked you, which seemed both stern with a touch of worry for her student.

"Um...well...why do you ask?" You tried deflecting the comment, though your hands started fidgeting with the "shorts" part of the dress. The material of your shorts felt a bit thinner now, and the pockets looked even smaller than usual now.

"Well, you're acting in a way I'm not familiar with. I'm not exactly mad with you, but I am concerned about your actions all the same. Is there any particular reason for those odd questions you asked me earlier?"

Truthfully, you weren't sure how to answer those, especially as you continued to feel really weird. Still nervous, you brought a hand up to her hair again, but you immediately stopped after that. You felt something against her back, so you stole a look backwards, having to keep yourself from gasping. Your hair was now even longer, flowing down past your shoulders to your mid-back, flowing in long dark brown locks of hair.

"Oh my gosh! My hair is so long!" You thought. This was way beyond just missing a haircut.

"Mr. Wilson! Did you hear me?" asked Ms. Brooks again in slight frustration, bringing your attention back to her. Apparently, whatever was happening, she didn't notice.

"I-I'm really sorry Ms. Brooks." You tried to say to her. "Um, I just....kind of woke up on the wrong side of the bed today. I haven't been feeling as well as usual." You hoped that would be a good enough explanation, considering you just made that up on the spot.

"Oh? Are you sure you're not sick? If you are, you probably shouldn't be here." Ms. Brooks commented sincerely. However, you weren't sure if going home would be good right now. If Ms. Brooks didn't notice anything wrong, who knows if your parents would either. Not to mention, considering you weren't sick, they would get really mad. You were sure that you weren't sick, so that was out of the question.

"I...I think I'm fine. I'm really sorry for the interruption." You tried again, being as sincere as you could. Ms. Brooks seemed to lighten up a bit, actually giving a small smile.

"Well, if you're sure that you're alright, then it's fine. You're not a troublemaker, so I'll overlook it this time. However, do make sure to take better care in the future." she said.

"Yes ma'am."

After that, you were free to go, thankfully. Once you exited the classroom, you immediately rushed your hands back to your hair. It looked really nice, much more than any man's hair, like it was taken care of daily. To be honest, it even looked a bit familiar, but then again, many girls had long dark hair, so who was to say about that. However, you only had a few minutes until the next class came, so you probably should be on your way.

As you began walking though, your legs continued to look more smooth underneath your clothes. By that time, there was not a hair on them, leaving fair skin in their place. You began to wonder just what could be behind this, but you couldn't draw any reasonable conclusions.
1112111111221111112111.title: Ms. Brooks confronts you...

11121111112211111121112.content:
"Great, this is just great..." You said, continuing to nervously comb your hair with your ever-more-soft hands. Now that you thought about it... Your arms, as well as your legs, had lost a bit of muscle mass. Mind you, you never were the 'manly-man' type with huge arms and always being at the gym. But, you weren't a total-loss, a slob, either.

"Well, there goes that class... She officially thinks I'm insane..." You sighed, continuing your rush.


As you continued through the crowded halls, the people passing by brushing you as you walked along, you rubbed your arms.

"Hairless..." You sighed, noting the daintiness that had overtaken your arms. And, you didn't even want to examine your legs. The last observation you made below the waist proved you were growing more soft, less masculine by the moment. The reason, beyond you. But, for some reason, you looked down there, anyway, if only for the purpose of curiosity. That, and you felt something riding up your legs, slowly and softly, much like the feeing of a bug crawling about your skin. In this, you made the decision to finally look over your lower half.

At this point, you hardly cared for the dress-like cloth you wore; the shock had passed. You noted the shrinking sleeves, the tightening of the cloth above the waist, and the flowiness of the cloth at the waist and below... It certainly resembled something like a dress, the colors of the cloth, respectively, the former-shirt and former-shorts, now certainly seemed to be shifting into a darker color, most definitely black.

"Oh!" You exclaimed, covering your mouth immediately in surprise. The unmistakable bulge that was your 'manhood'... It was... Smaller than before, no doubt about that. You did a double take over your shoulders, quickly cupping a feel.

"Definitely smaller!" as you felt there, it seemed o be fleeting with every passing second. You ignored this and moved on.

You raised an eyebrow towards your socks and shoes, as your eyes settled there. Your shoes continued to darken in color, surpassing the beige color that was present earlier, now a light brown, looking to become darker by the minute. You tapped a foot on the ground. The material was also changing, surely into something more solid, harder... The thud you made as you tapped indicated this. And, as for your socks, at this point they were completely beige, and growing longer, now reaching a few inches above the ankles.

"Well..." you sighed, continuing to comb the mane of hair now yours. "...I guess that explains that crawly feeling..." You murmur, continuing walking along.

Finally, you arrived at your destination! Chemistry with a certain Mr. Lucas, a slightly overweight, balding middle-aged man. As you neared the classroom, nothing seemed to be out of the ordinary, just the usual chatter could be heard emanating from inside the classroom, seeing as class had yet to start. And, also not out of the ordinary, stood three girls, also taking that class, standing outside the classroom, talking about subjects typical; Boys, who's dating who, fashions and the usual gossip these three could be heard discussing to no end, particularly, in Mr. Lucas' class.

These three, respectively, Heather, Cassie and Hannah were among the popular type, the cheerleader, jockey type, infamous for passing classes solely due to their popularity; that, and the connections they had with the nerds who often sold their services in homework and answer-getting for a claim to popularity. Which, all too often, went unanswered. The three always spoke of such nonsense, infamous for sitting in the back of the class and discussing, paying the class no mind. The teachers often did nothing about it.

The three of them usually paid you no mind, much like the rest of the popular crowd.

As you passed them by, almost entering the class, one foot in the door, one of the girls' voices caught your attention, successfully catching you off-guard.

"Hey, Nate!" The leader of the trio, Heather Cunningham, chirped.

You looked around, confusedly. "Is she talking to me...?" you wondered.

Finally, seeing no one else around you, you pointed to yourself, silently asking "You mean me?"

"Yeah, you!" Hannah chimed. "Join us!" Cassie added.

Nervously, you walked over, as you did, you noticed your hips began to instinctively sway with each step.

"Yes...?" you anxiously asked,

"We just wanted to, like, tell you how much we totally love those leggings you've got on!" Heather complimented.

"Leggings?" you asked aloud, completely lost as of now.

"Yeah! They're totally awesome!" Hannah entered once more. "Where'd you get 'em? I could so use a set of those!"

"Ugh..." You sighed, looking down to your legs, fearing what may await. Sure enough, they were right. You stepped back, shocked by their observation. Just as they said, there, covering your more shapely, smooth legs like never before were beige leggings. Again, slightly familiar... But... From where?

"Well?" Cassie entered in, "where'd you buy those things?"

"Ugh..." you continued muttering, combing your hair. As you did, you looked down to your body once again, this time noting that your chose continued to contort and shift, continuing to change material, color, into a darker brown, as well.

"Well, at least answer this, Nate..." Heather sighed, "Did you get it at the same place you got that dress and make up you've got on?"

This much was enough for you to hear. With that, you darted into the restroom, conveniently located right in front of Mr. Lucas' room.

Upon entering, you dashed to the full body mirror that stood at the end of the restroom. Again, much to your dissatisfaction, they were right. What you donned now was surely a dress, black, sleeveless, and flowing most gracefully below the hips. Speaking of hips, they, too, looked much more defined, as did your thighs and legs, which the dress definitely complimented. The dress itself was tighter above the hips, while the flowy part of the dress extended a few inches above the knee, meeting the criteria clothing had to meet in the school.

You looked into your presently green eyes and were met with a face perfectly decorated in a modest amount of makeup. A little bit of blush, and not much more than that. Your eyelashes were bigger, more emphasized.

Now, after all this, everything looked familiar.

"How have I not noticed!" You exclaimed, again, attaining a few awkward stares.

It all made sense! The dress, the leggings, the hair, the modest amount of makeup, the eyes, the mannerisms. All of it.

"Kate!" You muttered under the breath, registering it all.
11121111112211111121112.title: Passing by other girls

111211111122111111211121.content:
It was so obvious now. This was Kate's appearance, including the clothes she was wearing today. The dress, which looked very nice for a young woman, formed your body gracefully, with the skirt flowing over your hips. They seemed a bit bigger, though not quite to the size of Kate's own hips. For a while, you briefly considered whether or not you should go to class now. The girls in there didn't seem to notice anything strange, but that in itself was strange.

"What should I do?" Right there, you clasped a hand over your mouth, as you heard a somewhat softer tone than before. Given everything so far, you had to imagine that you were getting her voice too.

"But how is this happening?" You asked yourself this as you slowly exited the bathroom, heading back to class for now. Was this some kind of wish? You didn't make any. However, as you were thinking of Kate, something suddenly made you stop.

"I wish you would know how I feel!"

Suddenly, it all made sense. Kate wished for you to know how she felt, so you were becoming her? But how could that be? Did she have wishing candies too? Who were you to say. Perhaps you could confront her at lunch, as you and her shared lunch period next, before 3rd and 4th period. Right at that moment though, you heard the bell ringing, forcing you back into class and to your things. The girls from before immediately asked if something was up, but you said nothing. Whether you were Kate or not, you didn't like talking to jocks like them.

"All right class, thanks for coming." said Mr. Lucas.

The class began much like the previous one, though you were more distracted now. The dress was complete, which meant that your shorts were now a skirt, and your larger hips now rubbed against each other. It almost made you feel naked, making your face turn a bit red. Maybe it was out of instinct, but you crossed your legs, perhaps trying to show less or something. However, as you watched, you saw more changes. Your shoes made larger sounds on the floor, as it becoming sturdier. This was true as they were now a brown color, conforming against your feet more as they began to rise up your legs, ending a bit below the knees. It was Kate's favorite pair of boots.

"Wow, I guess these do look cute, just like Kate always said." You slapped your head as you said that to yourself. Come on! You weren't supposed to be agreeing with Kate on girl's fashion! You were a guy!

Though, judging by the shrinking feeling in your groin, that time was short at best. It certainly didn't help when you began feeling an itchiness on your chest. It was not even too long when you saw your dress beginning to push out halfway through the class.

"Oh no."
111211111122111111211121.title: Head to Chemistry Class...

choices: You resume you hunt for Kate
You find an excuse to talk to Mitch
1112111111221111112111211.content:
The class finally ended and you hurried along to lunch. On the way, you met up with Tommy. You have been friends with Tommy since kindergarten. You was in a hurry, you needed to see Kate.

"Hello Nate." You suddenly turned and you was a bit surprised to suddenly see Tommy there but you recovered, smiling a bit.

"Hello Tommy. How are you?"

"I'm doing fine. I see you're well." Tommy began.

"Yes, I'm doing fine." You felt a tiny bit uncomfortable as Tommy was walking with you. You tried to just smile Tommy off, as you knew Tommy since Kindergarten and kind of knew how he normally acted. Tommy kept talking about this and that. You wanted to get rid of him, what you had to talk to Kate about you had to do in private.

Tommy kept talking about this and that, you couldn't pay attention you had other things on your mind. Suddenly, seemingly out of nowhere Tommy asked you, "Are you doing anything later? I have, uh tickets to, uh, that show I know you like and I was hoping you would go with me. We'll have dinner first, I'll pay of course."

You realized that Tommy was asking you out. You didn't feel for him like that. Despite your appearance and your friendship with Tommy that went back a decade you didn't feel that way about him. How could you, you was really a guy. Then it hit you, memories of Tommy hitting on you since you were kids. Well maybe not kids, more like as soon as puberty hit. You didn't like him that way. You were just friends.

"Tommy," you said with a sign.

"Yes....?"

"This is hard to say," you started, "but I have put up with your amorous advances for as long as I can remember and I don't think...." Tommy couldn't bear to hear what you was about to say. He didn't have the confidence you had because you had had the candies. he suddenly fled down the hallway. "Whew" you thought, you didn't really want to tell him.

You had forgotten for a moment what you needed to do. You sort of just stood there gathering yourself. Then you saw Mitch Green. He was such a hottie, but he didn't know that you was alive. At least Tommy was your friend, he could be with you and talk to you. But Mitch was just gorgeous and he didn't know you existed. You couldn't even go up to him and ASK HIM OUT. Some girls could do it, but not you, you wasn't that type of girl.

Then it hit you, you wasn't any type of girl. You was really a guy. But Mitch was coming closer to you.

What happens next?
1112111111221111112111211.title: End of Class

1112111111221111112111212.content:
All things aside, realizing you were becoming a duplicate of the girl of your dreams, clothes, voice and all, the class proceeded as usual. A class filled with the boring, the uneventful, and the sounds of the useless chitter and chatter that erupted from the mouths of the popular girls from the back of the classroom.

The class was largely uneventful. The teacher often gave a brief, 10 or 15 minute lecture on whatever the topic of the day may have been, leaving the remainder of the class (mostly) free. Mr. Lucas insisted that the free time, the non lecture time, go to the assignment provided that would serve as homework due the next day. Of course, much of the class ignored his request and spent the remainder of the class at their leisure, effectively rendering the class a glorified recess.

And, seeing as you burned the lecture time freaking out about your changes, and, simultaneously, adoring the boots you now donned, time flew and the free time was yours.

And, as the class remained in anarchy, as the teacher sat at his desk, doing nothing about, seeming not to care, there you were, soaked in fear.

"...My chest REALLY itches..." You sighed, aloud, noticing your voice continuing to raise in pitch. As you scratched at your (presently) flat chest, you felt something happening around your throat, voice-box area, as if the area was contorting in some way... For only a second, it felt as if you were choking. In this brief moment, you grasped your throat, as if choking, and coughed a bit. It felt like something was missing from the throat area. But, just as fast as it all happened, it ended.

"Man, what was that all about?" You asked, quickly placing both hands over your mouth.

"I officially sound like her! I have Kate's voice!" You panicked, removing your hands from the face area. But, at the same time, you admired the voice you had. The sweet, musical, enticing voice of Kate that one could listen to all day long.

"So, what happens now..." You sighed, in your new, more feminine voice. As you pondered the situation, you stretch your legs out in front of you, staring at the boots decorating your feet. But, as you sit, you felt something at your rear... As if your butt was...

"...Inflating?" You asked aloud, turning behind you to stare at your rear-end. Sure enough, the butt was swelling like a balloon, morphing into the magnetic tail of hers. As this happened, your hips, too, expanded, completing the hourglass figure Kate was famous for.

"Uhm... Sir?" You asked, fearing he'd notice the voice not your own.

"Yes, Mr. Wilson?" He answered, rising from his desk as he answered, un-noticing of your changes.

"Can I... go to the restroom?" Yu inquired among the chaos ever-present in the room.

"Yes, Mr. Wilson, just, be back before the bell." Before leaving, you picked up your backpack, which hadn't changed, thankfully, and walked on. You took the bag in case you didn't return in time for the bell, contrary to Lucas' instructions. But, he paid you no mind anyway...

With that you strutted out the door and back towards the restroom. As you walked, at this point, you had already gotten used to the sway of your hips.

As you entered the restroom, you drew a sigh of relief as you found that there was no one present, leaving the room all to you.

"I really hope that this all ends soon!" You cried, as your boots tipped and tapped simultaneously with your footsteps.

Your face then turned to that of anger. You stomped over to your backpack, reached into one of the pockets, and pulled out the candies, handing these inanimate pieces of magic a hateful stare.

"You!" You cursed. "This is all your fault! I'd still be me were it not for you!" You continued, before stopping, realizing you were telling off pieces of candy.

"This is clearly driving me insane! This absolutely must end!" You shrieked, pulling your longer hair in frustration. You stopped, for a moment or two, and cooled down from the rage.

As if prompted by your surroundings, nature called, the bladder was to be emptied.

Instinctively, you waltzed to the urinal ahead of you, maneuvered your skirt around, getting ready to pee, reached for your 'male companion' and found...

"..." You continued to search between the legs. "... Wh-... Where I-is it?" You asked, freaking out feeling nothing. As you continued to feel around, you felt a structure there, something like a clit, there between the legs. As you felt this, you felt a strange sense of arousal, but, quickly got over it.

"...It's gone! My manhood!" You screamed in terror, your feminine, soft voice, emphasizing the scene. "It's gone..." you sighed defeated, now, officially a girl.

"But..." you murmured. "I still have to pee..." you said, walking over to the stall, preparing to learn how the other half eliminates.

After a few moments, it was done. There was struggle, there was discomfort in your skirts, but, you made it past.

"Ah!" You chirped in relief. "Finally done!" you happily sang, walking over to the sink to clean up.

"Oh, the difference relief makes!" You smiled. Suddenly, there died the happiness as you looked into the mirror to find Kate's form before you... Well, all except your face...

You continued to stare into the mirror at your figure. You scanned all, the clothes, the soft hands and legs the...

"Breasts...?!" You freaked out, as your ever-itching chest violently itched and bubbled. Out of impulse, you scratched at your chest. The more you scratched, the more your chest inflated like balloons, in a very similar fashion to when your butt inflated.

"NO! NO! NO!" You shouted, stopping your scratching as your breasts continued to inflate, filling In the chest area of the dress nicely.

Finally, it came to a halt. There, in front of you, you possessed the chest, the breasts of Kate. You weren't the breast expert but, it felt safe to assume that these things were a high C-cup. But, this was only an assumption.

You played with your breasts for a moment, purely out of shock and disbelief.

"Where did I go...?" You asked in Kate's soothing voice, in a voice that trembled a bit, as if tears were about to burst. You always found her 'sad' voice absolutely adorable.

There you stood, clad mostly as Kate, defeated. You looked into the mirror, noticing all that was left was the face. You displayed no signs of hesitation as the changes finished up at the facial area.

Your eyes became bigger, pools of beauty, actually. The nose you donned shrank, becoming small and button-like. The lips you called yours puffed and swelled, but, not too much, as the lips became a perfect size, the lips you had always wanted to call your own, but, not like this. The masculine mass about the face softened greatly, cheek bones lifted, eyebrows became smaller, femininity took reign. Lips were slender, as was the nose... A generally ovular facial structure... By the end, the only words to describe your face would be 'soft' and 'beautiful.' Only two of the adjectives you attributed to Kate.

As you stood there, in your defeat, you exhaled heavily...

"Well, it's over... I'm Kate... How am I supposed to go out into the world?" You inquired, fearsomely. "How do I explain this to friends, to my family, my sister, my mom, my dad..." All these questions flowed through your mind to no avail. This was the definition of anxiety.

And, right there, at the worst possible time, the bell rang, effectively ending second period, commencing first lunch. The lunch with you and Kate in it. The lunch where your crush would come face-to-face with her clone... You.

You drew a deep breath, grabbed your bag, placed the candies back in a pocket, and walked out to meet what lay next...
1112111111221111112111212.title: Taking notice

11121111112211111121112121.content:
With the transformation now complete, you began your walk towards the cafeteria. Mr. Lucas probably didn't care much that you didn't make it back. He wasn't a bad teacher at all, but he wasn't the most proactive. Well, you weren't complaining. No, you had many more things to complain about. In addition to everything, as you had left the bathroom, you tried adjusting your new panties. Boy, did they feel weird compared to underwear. Not nearly as loose.

Truth be told, you felt angry at many things right now. Those magical candies had now made you into one of the prettier girls in school, so how in the world could you fit in now. In fact, how in the world was everyone so calm? There were two Kates now, unless nobody thought of you being another Kate. Reality was so confusing at times. Actually, part of you even felt angry at Kate. She was the one who wished this on you, though she was totally unaware of it. It wasn't really fair to blame Kate, especially when this wouldn't have happened had you not advanced on her. Still, part of you just felt like lashing out. Your life could never be the same now.

Anyway, the 1st lunch period would last a good 45 minutes give or take, which was plenty of time for you to find your target and get this mess straightened out. How you would straighten it out was a mystery to you, but now that you were Kate, something had to be done. Some people tried to say hi as they passed by you, and you waved back while retaining your hurry step. Your hips and butt just swayed with each step, which felt so bizarre. Well, might as well get used to it. They were yours now, technically.

Anyway, you neared the end of the hallway that lead right to the cafeteria, and your eyes widened at who you saw coming down the stairs in front of you. It was Kate! Well, the real one anyway. You wasted no time in walking up to her, immediately trying to get her attention.

"Kate!"

"Yes?" Kate immediately turned and suddenly recoiled backwards. "W-Who are you? Why do you look like me?" She looked quite frightened, which wasn't your intention but there was no time for subtlety.

"You and I need to have a talk. Now!" You grabbed her hand, pulling her along to the other side underneath the staircase where there was at least some kind of privacy. You let her go once you got there, but Kate wasn't in a good mood.

"Okay, who the heck are you? Are you trying to mimic me?"

"Trust me, I certainly didn't want to." You tried saying to her. Thankfully, Kate wasn't an alarmist, so she didn't scream and beg for help. "It's me, Nate." You hoped that simple sentence would get her attention. It did.

"Nate? Nate Wilson? Do I look stupid? Nate doesn't look anything like me, especially since he's a guy." Kate defended. That was not a surprising answer. The only reply? Say something only you would know.

"Maybe not, but Nate knows that you accidentally had a wetting problem in 1st Grade and he swore to not say a word to anyone else."

Kate's jay dropped straight to the ground. Jackpot! "B-But, I never that to anyone......Nate?"

"In the flesh....or your flesh I guess." You said almost nonchalantly. Kate's look of confusion only worsened.

"Okay...w-what is going on? Why do you look like me?" Kate asked. You put your backpack (which surprisingly was still yours) on the ground, looking at the candy jar inside. You loosened it and took one candy out as you stood up again.

"Does this look familiar to you? Perhaps something you found on the bus maybe?" You asked. Kate looked confused, until a slow look of realization swept her face.

"I...I saw something like that when you approached me. I picked it up and felt this weird urge to put it in my mouth. Once I did....." Kate didn't look like she was enjoying remembering this. "I said something. Like, I wished that you would know how I felt."

"Well, you got your wish. Now I am you." You said with surprising calm. "I got these for my birthday. Apparently, they are wishing candies. You can make wishes on them, and now you see what they can do." Realization swept across Kate's face, but her look of surprise soon turned to sorrow as she realized what the implications were.

"Oh god, Nate I'm so sorry." She looked like she was about to cry. "I...I didn't mean any of this...I just...wanted you to think of us as friends.....I'm so sorry."

Truth be told, your anger began to slip away. Who were you to make her feel any worse. You then put the candy back in the jar, offering her a brief hug of comfort.

"It's okay. You didn't mean me to become your clone." You said as she accepted the hug. Getting hugged by someone who looked like you was weird, but it worked. Kate smiled and seemed to calm down.

"Thanks Nate....You're a good friend....Really, I've always thought of you as a good friend." She said with a small smile. Surprisingly, you smiled back.

"I think perhaps I see that now. I'm sorry for being persistent like that."

"It's no worry. All men do that."

"Gee, thanks."

At that moment, both of you began to lightly laugh. The dark mood quickly evaporated, as the two of you were now on the same page. How you suddenly went from lamenting your fate to laughing with Kate confused even you.

"Why are we laughing?" You asked with a smile.

"I don't know.....but those boots look cute on you." Kate smiled, making you remember what you thought before.

"Well, I happened to briefly think the same thing back in my last class. Not to mention, your hair is a bit of a pain to deal with." With a look that said that Kate knew how that felt, there was a bit more laughing. Thank goodness for the privacy.

"So, what now?" asked Kate.

"Well, I have no idea what everyone thinks of me. Everyone keeps calling me "Nate" still, but that doesn't exactly fit me now." You said with a sigh. Kate seemed to give it some brief thought, before she smiled again.

"I've got an idea. How about you become my sister?"
11121111112211111121112121.title: In the Hallway...

111211111122111111211121211.content:
"Your sister?" You asked in a certain confusion. Here you stood, in the body of your crush, talking to your crush, and suddenly she pops this question.

"Why your sister?"

"Oh, come on, Nate!" Kate laughed. "You know I've always wanted a sister! Please! Do me this one favor, this one time!"

You rolled your eyes and combed your hair as she stated this. You know this much was true; Indeed she had wanted a sister for quite some time. Being an only child, and the daughter of a single father, her mother having passed on quite some time ago, you could only imagine the sorrow and solitude she felt. You yourself had siblings, and, despite their annoyances and their shortcomings, they were people whom you could confide in, people whom you could tell anything. Except Erin.

This made you wonder, how Kate has done it her entire life. No one to confide in but her father, who was loving, caring and a good dad and all, but, there are some things that you know you wouldn't want to let your parents know of, no matter what.

As you pondered this, attempting to avoid eye contact as you thought, you turned her way and found Kate handing you 'puppy eyes,' complete with a wide smile and the twinkle in her beautiful eyes.

"Alright, fine! I'll be your sister..." You sighed.

"Yeah! Thanks, Nate!" She warmly, genuinely pronounced. "This'll be fun, I promise!" she peeped, taking the piece of candy you held in your hands.

At first, in the way she looked to you, you could tell that she thought you didn't like the idea, given your hesitance to answer. You felt the desire to make light of the situation.

"I already look the part, anyway..." You looked to her and smiled, the two of you sharing a laugh in the isolation of the underside of these cold stairs.

"So..." Kate began, placing the candy in her mouth and beginning to suck on it. "...You just say 'I wish' while the candy is in your mouth, right?"

"I think so."

"Ok... I wish you were my twin sister!" She wished. As she did so, you shut your eyes and braced yourself for whatever change might come barreling towards you. But, after a few seconds, you opened your eyes and looked about yourself, finding yourself still in Kate's body and clothes.

"What was that all about?" Kate asked, mesmerized by the way you braced yourself like that.

"Oh! It's just that... I was kind of preparing myself for a change... But, as you can see, i'm still me! I mean... You!" Apparently, just like that, the two of you were now sisters. No special effects, no dramatic lights, no changing forms, nothing.

She gave a small giggle at your remarks. "Maybe this will work out..." You smiled, thinking to yourself.

"Oh! By the way..." You started.

"Yeah, Nate?"

"...Could you wish me up some new clothes?" You asked handing her a candy.

"Well, sure, but... Why?" She inquired. "Are you saying there's something wrong with the way I dress?"

Your eyes widened, realizing the way that may have come across. "NO! It's just that, I'm new to this whole 'being a girl' thing, and, wearing a dress like this is kind of a big jump..." You answered, lifting the ends of your dress slightly as if curtsying.

"Fine." She said. "I wish you had different GIRLS' clothes."

With that wish, the clothes you wore began to undergo a quick and steady transformation. The dress you wore melted apart into two separate cloths. The top half retained the black color, the tightness, and the lack of sleeves, shrinking only slightly to form a plain, black tank-top.

The skirt of the dress remained a skirt, but, became less formal, shrinking in height until it reached a few inches above the knee, resembling a modest, school friendly mini-skirt. The material remained and the color changed from black to a baby blue color, definitely looking more relaxed.

As for the shoes and leggings, the beige leggings faded from existence, shrinking downwards until they imploded, leaving you sockless. The boots began to act the same way as the leggings, shrinking until they became but a platform for the feet, like sandals. The tops of the boots morphed and contorted until they became the straps of the sandals, the color, ultimately, remaining.

And, just like that, there you stood, clad in a mini-skirt, a tank top and sandals definitely a step up from that formal stuff Kate wears, but, still, too feminine for your tastes.

You stood there and observed yourself, scanning yourself from your head to your now exposed toes.

"You couldn't have given me, like, jeans or something? And, what's with the sandals?" You asked, gesturing to the sandals, wiggling your toes on cue. "A simple pair of sneakers would have been nice!"

"Well." Kate sternly said. "I personally find that outfit to be really cute on that body of mine, well, yours. And, now that your a girl, you're gonna have to get used to those types of clothes. If anything, I hope this whole experience teaches you something about what a girl goes through to get some attention from guys like you."

"Well, at least tell me how the wish was so specific without you saying anything."

"... Actually, i'm not sure how I did that. I just... Thought about it and then Boom! There you were, standing in my sandals and stuff."

You stood confused for a bit, eventually shrugging it off.

"Well, it's lunch, and I'm seriously starving." You said, gesturing to your growling belly. "So, how about some lunch?" You asked, leading the way towards the cafeteria.

"Right behind ya, sis!" Kate laughed, following your lead.
111211111122111111211121211.title: Kate makes a Wish

1112111111221111112111212111.content:
"Gee, I've never seen this much of my legs in school before." You blushed a bit as you and Kate rejoined the other students in the cafeteria. You both lost a good 15 minutes or so with your little talk, but you still had plenty of time to eat together.

"Like I said, we girls will do many things for a little attention. Don't you boys go for a bit of leg?" smirked Kate.

"Well, Tommy does." You smiled back. "I was more of a face guy."

"Fair enough."

After you both walked in, Kate pointed out a good spot for you both to eat. Kate had her usual friends, but she wanted to just eat with you today. After all, this current situation demanded more attention. You both sat down and brought out your packed lunches. You were pretty simple, with a sandwich, soda, and a couple other things. Some of it was junk food, but you were not going to be denied just because you were now a girl.

"You seem to be taking it in better." You said to Kate as she began to eat.

"Well, I still feel bad about it, but you helped me feel a bit better. If I'm not being too shameful here, I am a little glad now. Truth be told, I was a bit envious of you. You have 3 siblings to hang around with. I never got another sibling after my mom left us." said Kate.

"True, but Erin never listens to me. Trevor I can relate to, and Nicole seems to idol me a bit. They're a handful but it all works." As you said that, you looked down a bit. "I wonder if they know me now. Did they forget me, or am I a stranger to them now?"

Kate saw that you looked kind of sad, so she reached over and grabbed your hand assuredly.

"They know me, so as my sister, I'm sure they know you. Maybe not as their son, but as a good friend at least." said Kate. Truthfully, it did make you a little happier.

"Thanks....sis." Just hearing the word made Kate smile as she went back to eating.

"I guess we'll have to wait until we get home to see if our house changed to include you in the family. My room is pretty big, so I wonder if there are two beds now. Guess we'll have to wait and see. Maybe you'll even be in our family photos now." said Kate.

"That would be odd. I don't know half the things you did with your family." You said.

"Well, if worst comes to worst, perhaps we could wish it in so you "remember" those events. We don't have to of course, but it's an option. Those candies of yours seem to have limitless potential."Kate seemed to be getting excited about this. "I wonder what else we could do with them."

"Let's cool down a bit. I need to go a while without changing. I've got enough adjusting to do already." You said with a small smile.

"Fair enough." As they kept eating, something same to mind for Kate. "By the way, did that wish give you a new name? Perhaps you should check your planner."

"Oh, good idea." Curious yourself, you brought up your backpack and brought out the school planner that had your name inside. You opened to the first page, your eyes widening a bit as you looked. "Katherine Smith."

"So it did. Wow." said Kate, truly surprised before smiling. "Perhaps Kathy for short?"

"Nicknames already?" With that, both of you laughed a bit, like any sisters would. It was truly an interesting start to this kind of lifestyle, though you could only imagine when the next curveball would come. With these candies, probably not too long.
1112111111221111112111212111.title: At the cafeteria.

choices: "Yes. Give me the memories of Katherine, but, be careful!"
11121111112211111121112121111.content:
"Phew!" You relievedly uttered, wiping an imaginary sweat-drop from your forehead, as you walked out of your last class for the day, P.E., which you shared with Kate, your sister-gone-sibling. You walked side-by-side with her, handing her a pleasant smile, a favor she returned.

"So..." She smiled, looking at you in a curious way. "...What'd you think of the girls' locker room?" She inquired, handing you this peculiar look, leaning your way, just a bit.

This caused you to blush, if only lightly so. It seemed that Kate had seen right through you, on this one.

"..." You walked along, lacking in answer, the only sounds being the mindless jabber of the students leaving home for the weekend, and, the flapping noise your sandals made as you moved along.

"I must admit... It was kind of awesome... If you don't mind my saying! I didn't mean to offend!" You quickly apologized, raising your hands in front of you and giving a slight wave, as if to assure.

Kate gave a soft laugh before speaking. "Relax! It's cool! I know that you only have the body of a girl... Not necessarily the mind!"

"You could say I enjoyed it!" You laughed, joining Kate. "... My only gripe is the shorts! After this whole thing, I'll respect every girl who wears those over-exposing shorts! I felt almost naked, my legs being out in the open like that... And, the other guys in the class kept on staring at them, along with my chest! It was weird!"

Kate laughed and raised an eyebrow. "Well, now you know how we feel, putting up with your dirty little minds!"

There was a momentary pause, as you two continued out the school's front doors. Shortly after which, you continued.

"Plus, what are the odds that I had the exact same schedule! Nothing went changed!"

"I guess the wish made you my sister and nothing more..." Kate replied as the two of you boarded the bus that await.

The two of you continued along and Kate pointed you to her usual spot, a seat located in the middle of the bus, perhaps closer to the front than the back.

The two of you sat down, the both of you instinctively holding down your skirts as you did.

"..." You looked to her in a certain silence. "So, this is where it all began." You plainly stated.

"... I guess so!" Kate laughed. "But, hey, I guess everything works out the way it should, right?" She proceeded, looking to you with a soft, comforting smile.

"What do you mean?"

"Well, think about it." Kate began. "It's fate! What are the odds that all these things happen? That I somehow, by some strange coincidence, encountered those candies of yours. Why on this day? Why that wish? Why this outcome? Why are we both enjoying it all this much?" She whispered, almost poetically.

"Oh. Well, I never thought about it quite like that..."

"Like I said," Kate said. "Everything works out as it should." A certain silence, a poetic aura created itself between you two, you looked to each other, not speaking a word, simply handing each other a small grin, a small beam of light.

"Hey, here's Tommy!" Kate chirped, as, sure enough, Tommy walked in the bus, the doors wasting no time in closing, after him.

"Hey, Tommy!" Kate called, as you were too afraid to.

"Oh... Ugh... Hi, Kate. Hey, Kat..." He waved, coyly, respectively looking to the two of you, clearly awkward about speaking to the two of you.

"...What was that all about?" You asked, referring to Tommy's behavior.

"Well, I was kind of expecting that... Remember how it was Nate, you, who introduced me to him?"

She was right in saying so, you introduced him to Kate around, more or less, 4th or 5th grade. And, come to think of it, the way he acted just now strongly resembled his actions then, all those years ago, too.

"So... He hardly knows me, us?" You asked, your voice trembling a bit. Of course, this sort of teary-eyed reaction was unintentional, it had too have been those female hormones of yours...

"No, hey! It's all right..." Kate calmly reassured, handing you her embrace. "Things are going to be fine..." She warmly whispered, slowly, but surely, putting your sorrows to rest.

"Thanks, sis." You looked to her, simpering.

"Hey, look at that! We're home!" Kate said, grabbing her things and rising from her seat, gesturing that you do the same.

You sniffled a sniffle and spoke up. "Your place?" You asked.

"No, ours! Joyously she cried, as you picked up your own belongings, the two of you sprinting out the doors of the bus, the doors fuming violently as they did.

And, as the bus rolled on behind the two of you, you two stared at the house, you in a certain awe, that you'd now be calling this your home, at least, for the time being.

The house was a decent sized house, of about an average size. The driveway had room enough for two vehicles to fit in, in front of them, a twin pair of garage doors. The cement that paved the driveway, off to the right side, veered off, forming a walkway leading to the front door, a large, dark brown wooden door.

The house itself was two stories tall, and, boasted several windows, portals to and from the outside world. The home was composed of exposed, red brick. Plant life decorated the borders of the home, as well as the borders of the mailbox, walkways and the driveway, the plants gleaming in reds, yellows and shades of green and blues...

"Pretty sweet place!" You smiled, staring in awe about the home, now yours.

"Come on! It looks like Dad's not home yet..." Kate gleamed, leading you to the front door, where she reached into one of the pockets of her backpack and pulled out a single key. After a stab of the key into the door, and proceeding a turn of the key in a clockwise direction, the door silently widened, exposing all inside.

"Home sweet home!" Kate laughed running up stairs. "Follow me!" She called. "How about we head to my room, see if anything's changed!"

Eager to see what lay in this newfound home, you dropped your backpack where you stood and darted up the stairs. Upon arriving upstairs, you knew, even as Nate, where Kate's room was. From the end of the stairs, a quick right turn until the last door straight ahead would lead you to her room.

You opened the door and found her room, a comfy , rather large room that could have easily been mistaken for a master bedroom. The walls were painted a sky blue color. A TV lay across from the bunk-beds. The TV was held by a set of shelves, among the shelves various artifacts such as pictures among decorated frames, movies, books, other knick-knacks of nature unknown. Against one wall was another, rather large door, what you assumed was the closet.

"Hey, look!" Kate smiled. "Bunk beds!"

You grinned widely and laughed. "I call the top!"

"You call the top?!?! In your dreams!" Kate echoed, darting for the top-most bed of the bunk.

"Beat ya!" She called, laying at the top. "Feels good to be on top! But, you wouldn't know, would ya, sis?"

Kate lay there, her legs crossed, anticipating an answer. Upon failure to receive any answer of any sort, she looked about the bottom-most bed, the bed below her. Empty.

"Kat?" She asked, worriedly. Just then, she turned towards to where she kept her pictures and found you among them, curiously staring into them.

Kate walked up to you, from behind, and joined you staring into the pictures.

"You were right, after all..." You sighed. "... I am in the pictures now..."

Kate looked among the images in their frames, alongside you. The pictures were strange, surreal, telling stories you could not recall, given your lack of memory on these things.

"Hey! There's you, me, and Dad at the beach!" Kate exclaimed, pointing to a picture just in front of you, at chest height. The image seemed to have indeed been taken at a beach, as the ocean stood in the background of the image, the sands looking to be a sort of platform on which all was held. There, in the picture, you, in your female body, stood next to Kate, a single arm wrapped around her, Kate's Dad to the left of Kate. Just the three of you. Kate, in the picture, was giving you 'bunny ears' behind your head. The two of you donned simple bikinis. The picture looked as if it were taken somewhat recently, too. But, what stuck out the most was the love in the picture, the happiness. You looked so... Happy, as did Kate, and her father...

But, pertaining to the picture, Kate looked happy like you'd never seen her before.

"Wow... I wonder what happened that day that made us all so happy..."

Kate looked to you and smiled a mischievous smile. You raised an eyebrow and slightly cocked your head, as a confused dog.

"Wanna find out?" She asked, holding up a piece of candy, which seemingly popped up from nowhere.

"WHERE DID YOU GET THAT?!"

"I have my ways, now, do you want the memories of Katherine, or, not? It's totally your call, sis..." Kate offered you.

"What to do, what to do..." You thought in your head, combing your hair with your fingers as you did.
11121111112211111121112121111.title: Going to Kate's Home

111211111122111111211121211111.content:
"You know it's so funny that you have my nervous habits too." smiled Kate as she saw you comb your hair like that.

"Well, it's something I could do without." You smiled back before coming up with an answer. "All right. Yes. Give me the memories of Katherine, but be careful alright?"

Kate seemed really joyful at that answer. "Alright, cool! I can't wait to see what these memories are. Even I don't know what happened."

With that, Kate popped the sweet candy into her mouth. She had to phrase this right, given how her previous wish turned out. "I.....I wish both of us knew who Katherine Smith was."

Right at that moment, a rush hit your head, almost causing you to fall down to the floor. Kate seemed to experience a similar rush, though not to the same degree. Part of you wondered if your memories would be replaced, but instead, something else was happening. It was like there was a second set of memories forming, not interfering with your memories of Nate. To your surprise, a smile graced your lips as you began to remember. That day at that beach happened a couple months ago, and it was you and Kate's first trip to the beach in a very long time. You two had so much fun that day, from swimming in the ocean to even some beach volleyball, which you were not very good at. It was truly a day of fun. From the look on Kate's face, you could tell that she was thinking the same thing now, and both of you shared a little laugh together.

With that now behind them, both you and Kate unfortunately had to face the inevitable and work on homework. Thankfully, the large room allowed for a bit of privacy. Heck, the only class you both shared was gym, and there wasn't any homework with that. Trying to finish up your Chemistry homework was the worst, but Kate didn't really know much about it either. Kate actually really refused to do much else until she was done. Hey, she was a straight-A student for a reason. She wasn't exactly the party type either. She was just your average nice girl who kept out of trouble, something you kind of wished Tommy and a couple other male friends of yours would learn.

"So, Dad is the one who makes dinner I presume?" You asked, a bit surprised at how you just called him "Dad" so easily. Kate glanced you a smile as she looked up from her notebook.

"Yes he is, and a very good one too. He really tried hard to cook better once Mom left. He didn't want his "daughters" to grow up on fast food until college. I sometimes help out though." said Kate before she went back to her studies. You went back to your own. Truth be told, there actually wasn't a whole lot to cover. It was just really annoying. Still, giving it a couple of hours straight helped. As you wrote in your last sentences, you surprised yourself with how you focused on it non-stop for 2 hours. You kept good grades, but never did that much in one sitting. Did you feel like you had to live up to your new sibling? The very thought made you laugh to yourself as you put your books away. As you did, and Kate was finishing up too, you happened to spot something in the bookcase. It was one of those baby books that everyone generally has detailing their early years. You did have a set of memories now, but you didn't know the finer details. Kate could see where you were going and came over, taking the book down.

It was even titled "Kate and Katherine Smith."

"Even my book changed." Kate smiled. You smiled back as you opened it up, wanting to see what it was about. You were both greeted with a baby picture of you now as Katherine. The picture showed you and Kate, newly born in a little hospital bed. There were even the stats about your birth: one in particular that made you groan a bit.

"I'm 4 minutes younger than you are." You sighed. You were at least 4 months older than Kate when you were Nate. Kate smiled while putting a hand on your shoulder. She tried to be sympathetic, but you could tell she liked the idea.

"It's funny to see how much has changed, and there are so many candies left." noted Kate.

"Yeah, but if just one can turn me into your twin, then who knows what more can do." You said.

"Exactly." Kate really seemed excited at the possibilities. "Like, maybe we could be in charge of class or just goof off at the beach. Really, we could do anything."

"Could we wait until I fit in a bit better?" You asked.

"Of course sis." Kate smiled, as you two shared a brief hug.
111211111122111111211121211111.title: "Yes. Give me the memories of Katherine, bu...

choices: "...Let's skip and head to the beach, or something! Have some fun!"
1112111111221111112111212111111.content:
"..." You lay on the bottom bed of the bunk bed in a perfect silence, tossing and turning once or twice, every now and then, but, not to the point of discomfort. It was then when some horrifying noise, a noise that sounded like some foul creature, a monster, even, awoke you from your slumber.

You slowly opened your eyes, raised yourself up, looked about the bed, around the room, to investigate this strange sound.

You gave a yawn as you stretched your arms and legs where you lay. "...Nothing..." You groggily sighed, scratching an itch on your thigh.

Slowly did you get to your feet, planting them softly on the ground below, still attempting to get used to your newfound height. With one more stretch of the ol' limbs, you raised yourself to your sister, Kate's, bed to get a peek.

"So that's where it's coming from..." You giggled. Sure enough, there lay Kate, sprawled about the bed in a rather uncomfortable looking position. She was laying on her belly, her legs looking contorted, almost to the point of where it looked painful. A pool of drool soaked a fraction of the pillow she hugged, held to her face. All the while, a violent snore flared from her mouth. Of course a girl as attractive as her would sleep like a man...

"Time to end it... KATE!!!" You hollered, immediately gaining her attention. She quickly composed herself together and looked to you, looking horribly frightened.

"HUH? WHA-?" She asked, maintaining the shock of waking up on such an alarm.

"Just wakin' you up, sis!"

Kate looked to you, still half asleep, a certain sleepiness in her eyes, as if that Mr. Sandman took his toll on her.

Kate shook gave a stretch, and, looked completely at peace, relaxed, a small smile about her face.

"Man, that was an amazing night of sleep!" She yawned.

"Yeah, as soon as I hit the bed, I just knocked out!" You added. "Let me tell you, 'Dad' can really cook! That was one awesome pizza he made!" You laughed, you can still taste the toppings and that delectable sauce, that warm crust. Delicious, the foods of the gods.

"See, what'd I tell ya? We are his little angels, after all!" Kate laughed, you joining her.

Last night, that is, an evening between just you, your sister and 'Dad,' was something special. It was just the three of you, jumping from topic to topic.
