1151111.content:
You stroll confidently to the door of your hopefully soon-to-be girlfriend. You're not really sure why you're so confident; you don't know if she really has feelings for you. You think she does, but girls have always been a mystery to you. Oh well.

You stroke the candy with your hand. Even though you know you can't use it to directly make Kate your girlfriend, it certainly can't hurt too much.

You cautiously approach the doorstep. Dare you enter?

Before you can be redirected to a divergence of paths, however, Kate opens the door.

Well, you guess this is it.

Then the view of the narrative switches to Kate. I can do this because, as the narrator of the present chapter, I say that Kate is a main character.

You (Kate) were just on your way to give birthday wishes to Nate (no longer you) when you happened to find him on your doorstep! You are so flustered you can hardly speak. So is he.

You want to ask him out, but you're nervous. You're not quite sure if he's in to you. Boys aren't usually a mystery to you, but for some reason Nate is. Whatever.

You attempt to say, "Happy birthday!" but instead say, "What's that bag of candy?"

Nate replies, "It's magic candy that grants wishes if you eat it and make a wish." He says it with a perfectly straight face. He looks like he's telling the truth, and he is normally a pretty bad liar, but this is rather far-fetched.

"Can I try?" you ask.

"Sure," he replies, giving you a candy. "This one's general purpose, but don't wish for anything too big or it won't work right, and don't do anything too esoteric or it won't work at all."

"Okay," you say. You pop it in your mouth and murmur, "I wish my phone's battery were charged."

You swallow it, and immediately you feel a faint vibration near your thigh. You reach into your pocket and pull out your phone - fully charged, although it had just died a few minutes ago.

"Wow, it works!" you say in an expression of disbelief.

"Yeah, it does," replies Nate. "Want another?"

"Not right now. Hang, on, do you want to come inside?"

"Sure."

A few minutes later, you and Nate are seated comfortably in your living room.

"What brings you here?" you ask.

"I wanted - " he pauses for a moment " - to show you these candies," he finishes.

You sense something else he was going to say but brush the thought aside as unrelenting optimism.

"They're pretty cool," you say. "I'm not sure if I want any more, though. Not right now, at least."

You and Nate engage each other in small talk for the next half hour until Nate looks at the clock on the wall and exclaims, "My party's about to start! I'm going to be late for my own birthday party!"

"That would be bad," you reply. "Let's head over now - oh no, it's going to start in five minutes!"

"I can't walk back to my house in five minutes! Can your parents drive us over?"

"No, Mom's at work and Dad's at a friend's house. I think we can bike to your house in five minutes, but that won't work because I only have one bike."

"We'll never make it on time!" exclaims Nate.

"Yes, we will," you reply and take out a candy.

"I wish...
1151111.title: Nate and Kate plus Candy

11511112.content:
Well, in theory that's a really good wish for you to wish. In practice, however, performing such a wish requires knowledge of which types of candies can perform which types of wishes: Each candy will grant the wish in whatever way it is possible for the candy to grant it depending on its color.

You take out two candies. One is orange and rather large, the other is yellow with a black "S" written on it.

You don't know it, but:
1. Orange involves transformation, usually inanimate;
2. Large indicates a flair for the dramatic;
3. Yellow involves the alteration of certain attributes of persons, places, or things; and
4. The black "S" means it is specialized in altering size (although it can alter others if it must).

Which do you eat to make the wish?
11511112.title: ...we could both bike to the party."

choices: Try to candy undo the wish.
Roll with it and bike to the party.
115111121.content:
Suddenly you start shaking uncontrollably. Nate looks at you, worried. "Are you okay?" he asks. However, you are unable to answer. For the time being, let's switch back to Nate's perspective.

Kate Smith is shaking uncontrollably right in front of you. You attempt to get up and help her somehow, but something appears to be happening. She's shuddering so fast that you can't make out any clear facial features. A strange force lifts you in the air.

Her head stops shuddering, but now her body is shaking so much that her clothes are slipping off. First her shirt, then her bra, followed by her socks, pants, and panties, until she is completely naked.

You gasp in shock, somehow gasping so powerfully that she is sucked inside your mouth legs first. For a moment her hips are jammed, but then she is pulled completely inside you.

You feel her pressing against you from every side, no longer shuddering. Suddenly you lose all mobility. You feel your arms and legs changing shape and a hole opening up in front of your neck. Your head rescinds down until it is part of your back, and then your vision spreads to your entire self - outside and inside. You see that you are now hollow and a slick leathery black before Kate Smith completely fills your now seemingly lifeless form. You can feel her entire body and have a panoramic view of the living room.

That is because, as you realize once you stop being Nate and resume the narrative from Kate's perspective, Nate Wilson is now a catsuit.

Well this isn't quite what you meant.
115111121.title: Catsuit Chaos

1151111211.content:
You take out a bluish-purplish candy that has the word "UNDO" written in white on it. You're pretty sure you can guess what it does.

You eat the candy and say, "I wish I could undo the the last wish I made not counting this one."

Rather than creating new, branching choices, the candy simply takes you back to a previous point in time, this one to be precise:
http://www.writing.com/main/interact/ite...

It also presents a convenient way for a reader of this story to see the story map.
1151111211.title: Try to candy undo the wish.

choices: Have some fun with the candy.
Suggest a game of Truth or Dare.
1151111212.content:
Nate's perspective:

You feel very uncomfortable with the present situation. You currently encompass a fifteen-year-old girl's otherwise naked body. Your rear hurts where it is pressed against the bike seat. Whatever you were expecting or hoping for, it certainly wasn't this.

Even when you don't use the candy irresponsibly, it seems that there will always be someone to do it for you. You hope Kate will be able to turn you back soon.

This is going to be a long bike ride.

Kate's perspective:

You feel rather comfortable with the present situation. The catsuit you're wearing sure is nice. It's a shame you'll have to give it up if/when you eventually transform Nate back. Maybe you'll keep him this way. It would be hilarious to know that, every time you wear this, you're wearing him.

You push the idea from your head so fast it doesn't know what hit it. That would be a cruel and unreasonable thing to do to a human being, even one who is trapped inside a piece of clothing. Besides, you like Nate, and you wouldn't want to torture him this way.

Nate's perspective:

You are starting to enjoy the strange sensations this offers. It's relaxing knowing that there's nothing else to do than just be filled with the girl of your dreams. You hope this never ends.

Not really. It's quite relaxing, but you have very important things to do. This might be fun occasionally, but it's really a pathetic excuse for a life, and any fiction you find on the internet saying otherwise is dead wrong.

Kate's perspective:

You keep riding your bike. You'll be at Nate's party in a few seconds. You can't wait to see him. You park your bike and go inside. You're the first one there. The party won't start for a few more minutes. The living room clock is fast.

Nate's mother, Lynda Wilson, is there to greet you. "Here for the party?" she asks. You nod.

"Make yourself comfortable," she says. "I wonder where he went."

Suddenly, you sense a familiar sensation in your lower body. "Where's the restroom?" you ask.

"That way," says Lynda, pointing in a direction.

"Thanks," you say and head off in said direction.

Once there, you go inside, taking the candy for some reason, lock the door, sit down on the toilet, and slap yourself on the forehead because you somehow forgot to take off your catsuit. You bundle it up on the floor and proceed to urinate.

Suddenly the catsuit begins quivering. After a few seconds, it turns into a naked Nate Wilson, whom you somehow forgot had transformed into your catsuit.

"That," he says, "was different."

"We're naked," you point out because it's obvious.

Nate pops a white candy into his mouth. "I wish we weren't," he says.

It seems to work - that is, it works perfectly. You and Nate are no longer naked. What a relief.

You get up and leave the bathroom, possibly to never speak of this incident again.

Your mother eyes you suspiciously, clearly wondering where you came from and why Kate is wearing something different, sees the candy, and goes back to last-minute prep, her curiousity presumably stoked by the presence of the candy.

It seems some party guests are arriving. You see Tommy Iverson and Erin Wilson walk in.

What do you (as in either Nate or Kate, or possibly both) do?
1151111212.title: Roll with it and bike to the party.

choices: Show off the candy to your party guests.
11511112122.content:
"Hey guys!" you (Kate) call.

"Hey!" says Tommy. "Hey!" says Erin. "Hey!" says Nate.

"Happy birthday, Big Nate!" says Tommy as the four of you head down to the basement.

"Yeah," chimes in Erin. "The big five-oh!"

"Yes, it is," agrees Nate.

"Let's do Truth or Dare!" you say suddenly. You normally don't suggest ToD, but you have a brilliant plan that does not involve candy.

"OK," says Nate. "I'll go first. Tommy: Truth or dare?"

"Dare," says Tommy. "There are some secrets I shall not part with."

"Sure there are," replies Nate. "I dare you to tell me one of them."

"I maintain an email correspondence with a wizard from another universe," he replies without missing a beat. "Kate: Truth or dare?"

"Dare," you say nervously. You need to say dare so as to increase the odds of your plan being successful by a slight amount, but Tommy has given some outlandish dares in the past.

"I dare you to drink this entire bottle of Sprite in a minute," he says, holding out a bottle of Sprite.

"Did you bring that just so you could do that dare?" asks Nate as you begin to chug furiously.

"As a matter of fact, I did," he says proudly.

"How did you know she was going to suggest ToD?"

"I was actually going to suggest it if she didn't."

You finally finish the bottle of soda, put it down, and release a giant belch. Erin wrinkles her nose and Tommy giggles.

"Okay, Nate," you say. "Truth or dare?"

"Truth," says Nate. "We've done two dares in a row already."

"Okay," you say, pausing slightly before executing your brilliant plan. "Who do you have a crush on?"

He pauses for a full thirty seconds before answering. "You," he says feebly.

You immediately respond. Before you even know it, you say, "Will you be my boyfriend?"

He seems thoroughly taken aback. Perhaps this was a bad - "YES!" he shouts and proceeds to kiss you. Tommy and Erin simply walk away. You don't really care.

About a half minute later, you and Nate finally separate.

Nate's persepctive:

"Now let's get this party started!" you say.
11511112122.title: Truth or Dare

choices: A hat - a Stetson, to be precise.
A piece of gum.  ("Wait, a WHAT!?")
115111121221.content:
You feel a sudden high coming on. It's not an addicting-drug high; that would be dumb. Why would you be feeling that? You're feeling a high because Kate is now your girlfriend. Wow. As in, WOW. No, really.

But this does have one thing in common with addicting-drug highs; namely, it causes you to do some things you quite frankly shouldn't be doing. That thing, specifically, is running upstairs, grabbing candies, and running back downstairs to eagerly tell your friends about them. This probably isn't your best idea ever. But whatever. It's now or never, and you're pretty sure the candy jar has like 10,000 candies. Everyone in your family turned down the offer when you asked if they wanted candy, so you need someone to help share them.

"So tell me, guys," you say, "do you believe in magic?"

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------------------------------

You've finally explained the general concept of the candies to Tommy and Erin. You can see their minds churning to process this information. You can't blame them; it's a lot to take in, even without Donovan and candy colors entering the mix.

Erin is the first to speak up. "Who wants to play Brawl?"

"What do you mean?" asks Kate. "After all that-"

"After each game," she says, "the winner gets candy. Is that acceptable, Nate?"

"Yes," you say. "Yes, it is."

"Let's make it more interesting," interjects Tommy. "How about we do a tournament and the winner gets a whole bunch of candy?"

"Good," you say, "but we shouldn't do a normal bracket, because the pairings can bias the match."

"We'll just do a bunch of high-stock free-for-alls," suggests Kate, "and when someone loses, they're out."

Suddenly you get an idea. "What if we combined those ideas?" you say.

"Explain," says Kate.

"Well, after every match, the winner gets a candy - orange - and the loser gets to be on the receiving end?"

"Sure," reply the other three, eagerly and yet tentatively.

The first match goes well for you. Erin is eliminated first, through a combination of repeated stage-caused self-destructs and pokéballs. It was close, but you managed to throw Tommy out of the stage. It's just you and Kate.

You're on equal footing. She picks up an assist trophy and finds to her dismay the Nintendog. You use the distraction to unleash a smash on…

…an explosive crate. You are blasted off the stage - but no! You manage to recover. She tries to stop you and accidentally self-destructs in the process. You have won.

You look over at Erin. What now? you wonder.

You don't need to worry about wording; the candies can determine the intended "victim" from context, and wishing for an object isn't easy to get wrong. The only question is what that object will be.
115111121221.title: Do You Believe In Magic?

choices: You know what?  I don't need this.
11513.content:
"I will go on one condition," you say.

"Name it," replies your son.

"Tell me who the Megalomaniac is."

"I won't."

You pop a candy in your mouth. "I wish you would."

"Fine." He hangs his head. "It is you."

Your head starts spinning. He can't be telling the truth, can he? Are you really a megalomaniac? He can't be lying, though; the candies don't lie.

Then you realize what truly happened - what must have happened. Your son came from the future to stop a megalomaniac. In order to do so, he brought his father - whom he knew to be the megalomaniac, in the future, but also must have known to be morally reliable in the past - magical candies that grant wishes. Somehow or other, the power got to your head; in preventing your evil, your son only assured it. Realizing this, you put one last candy in your mouth and make a wish.

"I wish for no more candy."

*****

It's been twenty-two years. You and Kate Smith are happily married and hyphenated. You made it bigtime in business and bought a luxury condominium in Missouri. You have one son, Donovan, and two daughters, Agatha and Miranda. (You and she have a thing for odd names.) Donovan is a model student - all A's, community service, athletic, school spirit, near-perfect attendance. Agatha is a bit of a geek, but she writes great fiction. Miranda, who's only three, is just learning to walk.

You go upstairs to the master suite you share with Kate and see a box of chocolates lying on your bed. A note is attached.

"You know the deal. Thanks for not going evil. Your friend, who is secretly a wizard."

It is unsigned.
11513.title: Revalation

115132.content:
To whom it may concern:

I hope this letter reaches you. If it does, know that I am perfectly happy with my life. I appreciate the gift but, instead of accepting thanks, feel the need to apologize for what would have happened. I hope you can find someone who truly needs these chocolates and won't turn out evil in the end. Just know that, even if they do, there is still some good in them.

Your friend, Nate Wilson-Smith

You take off the old note, apply the new, put a single chocolate in your mouth, and say simply, "Return to sender." There is a golden glow, and the box is gone along with the handwritten note. And all the Wilson-Smiths lived happily ever after.

And it was somebody else's lucky day.

And even though you almost took over Missouri, it's like they say: All's well that ends well, and well it ends. Viva la vida.
115132.title: All's Well That Ends Well

choices: World Switching (Entering Pokemon? Comics? Tv shows?)
1152.content:
The man has a haphazard taste, as you see from his dress code. Blotches of red, yellow, blue and green hues stains his entire attire. He literally looks like a walking rainbow. He has a tall silverish gold hat, almost as tall is he is. And as soon as he sees you, he takes his hat off, tips it once, and bows formally.

That is unusual. But what is even more unusual is: WHAT IS HE DOING IN YOUR ROOM?

You freak out, springing off the bed like a scalded chicken.

"WHAT ARE YOU DOING HERE?" You demand, eyes bulging out from your sockets.

He merely sidesteps the question. "Candies of Chance, at your service."

At first you think 'Candies of Change' is his name, but it occurs to you that there is no way anyone's parents would be in the right mind to name their kid that. But... Well, looking at that guys fancy costume, you begin to wonder if there's such a word as 'impossible'.

So- though your cold sweat is cascading off you like a waterfall-, you still boldly ask, "What do you mean?"

"Candies of Change is a Candy company," He finally explains. "I take you received your... order?"

You remember the jar of candies downstairs and you nod wordlessly.

"Good," The man replies. "I've done my job, I better be off, finishing my deliveries."

But you're definitely not letting him get away with so soddy an explanation. "I didn't order those candy," you tell him sharply.

"Then it must be a gift," he says as a matter-of-factly. "We don't give away free candy."

You blink. "Who ordered for my gift?"

"Was it labelled who it was from?" The man abruptly asks.

"No," you recall. "Nothing at all."

The man shrugs. "Then the sender didn't intend for you to know."

You open your mouth indignantly, but nothing comes out. This is ridiculous! An anonymous magical gift? What next?

But then, something stranger is happening. The man takes a single candy out of his crazily coloured pocket. The candy is bright yellow - and it reminds you of those in the jar below. It does not look anywhere near normal.

He sees you staring at him stupidly, and smiles. "Teleportation candies," he explains. "I deliver candy orders. To humans, witches, demons, anyone. We don't discriminate. Very useful for sifting through worlds, you know."

Your jaw drops even more and hits the ground. "What?"

"Try out your own candies," he advises. "They are just as interesting. But remember to read the words on the sweet wrapper. Different coloured candies are for different uses."

You just gape as he pops the 'so-called' magical candy in his mouth and sucks it merrily. "I wish to teleport to Faerieland!" He yells happily, before winking mischievously at you. You think it is some sort of prank, but before you can shift an eyelash, he is gone.

Just... Gone. There is no trace of him at all.

You stare at the piece of space where he used to be for a long time, before something strikes you. Shouldn't you be testing out the sweets? The man did mention about candies with 'different uses'. You definitely should be getting down to trying them...

What first?

121131122.content:
Erin was quite sad after leaving Nate's room. When he refused to listen to her "girl" troubles as he had put it, she felt like crying and quickly rushed out before he could see her breaking up.

She knew it wasn't because he was cruel or mean that he had refused to listen to her, but merely that he was an extremely practical and blunt person. He himself never let his emotions get ahead of him and seldom if ever cried or complained over anything. And consequently could never understand or tolerate it when Erin wanted to talk with him over her emotional difficulties.

She still loved her brother(You) deeply of course and shared a far deeper bond with him than with any other of her family members.
He was always kind, sincerely and helpful to her, but she just wished that she could confide to him all her desires and secrets the same way that she could with her girlfriends.

After walking aimlessly for a while rubbing her tears, she bumped into the candy container, where you had left it. Following her habit of munching anything edible nearby whilst depressed, she took a handfull of the sweets and propped them in her mouth.

She then, suddenly remembered the way Nate had unbelievingly summoned 30 dollars from his pocket. Hoping against hope, with her mouth still full of the magical sweets, she thought hard and loud in her mind, that she wished Nate could be her older sister.

No sooner had she thought this than the sweets dissolved instantly in her mouth and a bright ball of light escaped her lips. Like a firefly the tiny wisp of light circled her several times before shooting of to her brothers room. She stood there stunned before jolting after it, curious and excited.

As she ran after it, rounding the corner, the firefly thing entered her brothers room where she found him sleeping on his bed and the light ball hovering over him in circles.

And the ball of light directly flew into Nate’s mouth. He wanted to defend himself from getting intruded by the strange ball of light, but he couldn’t:

The next changes in Nate’s body were more drastically, because two feminine breasts were suddenly growing on his chest… His t-shirt could barely hold them, they must be at least a D-cup…

After a while Nate and also his sister were thinking this was over, but it wasn’t. The ball of light came out of the new girls mouth again and enlightened all the room, which now changed to become a typical room for a 15 year old girl!

12113112211.content:
Nate or now Natalie was in a state of shock, which was quite understandable considering his sudden switch of gender.
He - now a she - just stared at Erin completely stupefied. Then she stared down at the rest of herself.
2 painfully obvious lumps making out her generously ample bosom stared back at her, along with a slender waist and beautiful hairless legs beneath them.

Still being the practical and calm individual Nate were, Natalie jumped off her bed to see herself in the full-length mirror of the now feminized room for a full confirmation of her gender-switch.
A pretty, taller and older version of Erin stared back. The face however was a combination of Nate and Erin. Strangers would without question assume her as Erin's older Sister!

Natalie was extremely uncomfortable in her female clothing and the way it emphasized her curves to the world. She wasn't ecstatic about the change in colour-scheme to her room as well. She then, suddenly stood rock-stiff as if remembering something awfully important.
Her hand trembled as it hesitently reached from her lower front to her crotch. Natalie's face turned green as her hand gently felt the now inverted emptyness of where her manhood once stood, confirming without a doubt she was female.

Natalie turned angrily back to Erin. "You had something-" still perturbed about her new higher, melodious voice, Natalie's hand went to cover her mouth, brushing her new puffed lips. "You had something to do with this!" she accused at Erin who was now smiling ear from ear.
Erin tried to get in a word that she was just happy that Nate could now be her sister "Dammit Erin! What did you do? Why did you do this?!" Erin feebly again tried to explain how badly she just wanted a sister but Natalie cut her off.

"It was those candies!" she said remembering and pulling out the 30 dollars which for some reason, were still there in the pocket of her now slender-cut jeans. " They were supernatural after all! Where are they?!"

Erin realising she had brought the sweet-container with her when she ran after the light wisp, tried to hide them behind her back, as she still held them in her hands. Natalie being sharp saw this immediately.

"Give them back! Change me back now!" said Natalie rushing over to her."Why would you do this to me? Was I not a good enough brother, heh?!!" Natalie tried to force them from Erin, who vainly tried to keep the container out of reach.

Erin was now in tears and blurted "I just wanted an older sister who would listen and talk to me!" Seeing the tears of Erin stopped Natalie in her tracks. "Please. Just for one night?" she said brightly.

"Erin! Natalie! Please come down! The food's getting cold!" yelled their mother from downstairs.

"You really want this, don't you?" asked Natalie quietly at her sniffing sister, never wishing her sadness.
"Please! I promise all we have to do is talk. And you know... maybe a one night sister-slumberpary?" she asked hopefully.

Natalie hanged her head and sighed. "One night. One" she stated, holding one finger in front of her forcefully.

Erin - now overjoyed - grabbed Natalie by the hand and rushed with her downstairs to dinner. There, Natalie became extremely self-concious of wearing girl's clothes and hesitated before entering the kitchen, but Erin pulled her along forcefully with far more enthuasiasm than Natalie would have liked.
But, as luck would have it none paid her the slightest of attention. Besides Lynda( their mother) who scolded them both for being late of course.

121131122111.content:
Natalie was starting to have serious regrets about agreeing to be Erin's Older sister, as dinner turned to be a slow mental torture.
She quickly learned of some key differences between girls and boys, all of them to her displeasure.

First and foremost: breasts! They were endlessly more fun to look at than to have. Natalie's amply endowed bosom only emphasized this. The fatty sacks were lively and bounched and jiggled at the gentlest of movements. Worse still: they were quite sensitive. And not in a good way.
The pert orbs of flesh on her chest, persistently reminded her of their existence, the slightest movement not only setting them wobbling, but could clearly be felt. Whenever she so much as brushed her arm against her breast to bring a spoon to her mouth, it registered the action.

Their sensitivity wasn't painful or irritating, but brought an uncomfortable sense of awareness to Natalie, the likes of which Nate had never experienced before with any body parts.

Worse still yet, her long hair: It took Natalie all of her patience not to accidentally dip them in her food.
Nate always shaved his head cleanly. Military style. He firmly believed that if you had to comb it, your hair was too long. Now as Natalie, even the pink alice-band on her head could do little to keep her beautiful sleek black hair out of her face. It wasn't helped that it reached all the way to the small of her back.
Natalie was starting to understand the significance of the gesture where girls brushed their hair back to hook them behind their ears.

What made Nate truly uncomfortable as a girl, was the realisation that his female form was significantly shorter and weaker. She thought grim thoughts as she felt weak and vulnerable.
For example: she couldn't reach the top shelf anymore. When asked to pass on the salad-bowl, she had to stand up to reach it, and use both arms to lift it. Nate could have done so sitting and with one hand.

Still, Natalie recovered and adapted quickly. What truly became an exercise in annoyance was Lynda, her mother, who frequently berated her throughout dinner for "having boyish manners unbefitting of a lady".

She would say things like: "Cross your legs or keep your knees together when you sit Natalie! I know you like wearing jeans, but still!"
or
"Small bites Natalie! Small bites! The food's not going anywhere. Girl's take only small pecks at a time, you know!"

or eventually
"Honestly! You can be such a tomboy! I know you like things like camping and hiking instead of going to the mall, but .."
Well at least her hobbies were the same thought Natalie optimistically.
"But you should act like a lady indoors! You don't want to scare away any potential boys, no do we?" she said with a wink to Natalie who replied shivering and with disgusted sarcasm: "No, we certainly don't want that."

"Oh don't worry ma." said Nicole (your 11-year-old younger sister, sitting next to Erin) giggling from the side. "Natalie's already sitting in a tree."

"Well this is news to me." said Lynda smiling. Yeah, me too! thought Natalie.

With that Nicole extracted a purple piece of crumpled paper. It appeared to be a love letter. Nicole stared evilly at Natalie, filled with glee at exposing a love scandal. But Natalie just stared back, sincerely ignorant.

"To Natalie..." began Nicole ensuring she had the tables undivided attention before continuing. "From Tommy Iverson!" and then Nicole let out a long romantic sigh, before reading the remaining contents of the love letter.

Pandemonium broke out around the table as all the girls coo'd with delight. Natalie ignored them all. The handwriting was definitely Tommy's; Nate's best fiend since kindergarden.

WAIT WHAT?! Tommy Iverson?? Now that's just bloody grand, thought Natalie bitterly. Her best friend was now her boyfriend in this reality, apparently. Now that just sucks. Natalie didn't want to face him as anything but her male self.

With that Natalie had enough. To hell with being Erin's sister.
She excused herself and was about to stalk back to her room, where the magic candies were, when Nicole and Erin followed suit and intercepted her.

Misinterpreting Natalie's frustrations for anger Nicole said:"Here! I was only joking!" handing the purple paper back, anxious to make amends. "You didn't need to stalk off like that. I was only having some fun."
Natalie smiled. "I'm not angry with you."
"Oh. Well...good night then" relieved, Nicole walked off to her room.

"Nate. Can I say something."
Natalie turned to Erin, almost surprised to here someone speak her male name. She saw Erin holding the candy container in her right hand! She must have brought it downstairs earlier. Had she anticipated Nate's intent to go back upstairs?
Erin was looking at Natalie with an intensity that was almost eery.

They wake up the next morning with the Candy container still there.
1211311221111.content:
Natalie decided that guile wasn't the best course of action and directly asked Erin to change her back: "Look, Erin, I've had enough. Please wish me-"
"I said: Nate, can I SAY something." came back the retorted, interrupting reply from his sister who looked angry. Once again she stared at him with an eery intensity, and Natalie hoped they didn't hold any trickery in them.
"What?" he asked wary and on his guard, fearing she might do something with the candy that would leave Natalie regretting it.

Erin's next action took Natalie completely by surprise. She walked up to him and hugged him, his now slender waistline making it possible for Erin to encircled him with her short, petite arms. "Thank you." she said, which threw Natalie even farther of balance.
"For what?" came Natalie's confused reply.
"For being my older sis, even if briefly."
You chuckled sadly: "You realise I just came back to change myself back, right? I don't deserve your thanks."
She looked up into your face:"I know. I saw you squirm during dinner. Could see you didn't like it." she then untangled from you and held held the container before her."Here. I won't stop you."

Natalie looked at the doe-eyed Erin even more warily: "But?"
"But please, PLEASE. I'm begging you. Just this one night! You said you would! I promise, promise, promise tomorrow we'll turn you back."
Natalie held her face in her arms and groaned. She looked through her fingers to see Erin smile sweetly and then pout in a most adorable begging fashion."Fine, FINE. Alright already! But I'm holding this to you. ONE NIGHT! Only."

Erin almost went ballistic. Now with the assurance of Natalie being her sister, she simply radiated glee. In the same abrupt fashion they had came downstairs, Erin pulled Natalie upstairs. The words of "sister-slumper-party" echoed all the way to her room.
Natalie just smiled thinly. She hadn't succumbed to Erin's request because of her cute begging. Instead she knew she would never have heard the end of it, and also she sensed a genuine longing in Erin.

"Don't you have homework for tomorrow?" asked Natalie. Today was Thursday, and the next day was still a schoolday before the weekend. Natalie had finished her work early, which was why Erin had found her asleep earlier before the transformation.
"Already done!" shouted Erin as they sprinted to her room. Natalie expected Erin was lying, but knew better that nothing aside from the apocalypse would stop Erin from having her way with Natalie tonight.

Back in Erin's room, they pulled down a spare mattress from the closet and set it next to Erin's bed and then settled Erin's mattress next to Natalie's on the ground. Their mother (Lynda) gladly giving them a helping hand. Erin told Natalie to go grab her pajama's and clothes she might need.

For the second time Natalie surveyed her feminized room. Everything from Nate's old life was still there: his extensively customized and overclocked computer and all the endless videogame's he had played lying in a tower next to it. His hiking boots and camping equipment. Even his pet tarantula in a glass box on the table next to the window. It brought a moment of comfort to Natalie, knowing she hadn't lost her identity, a fate she considered worse than death. But what really ticked her off was the obsession with the pink colour-scheme. Her walls, the duvet, even her hiking boots now with its pink lacings. Whoever had made the candies had a moronic sense of humour. She doubted any single girl besides herself inside this town had such an absolutely steriotypically girly coloured room.

As Natalie went over to her clothes closet and opened it she cringed. An impressive array of clothes covering the entire spectrum of womanhood lay neatly folded and hanging from hangers before her. Jeans, shirts, jackets and the usual. But along with that came skirts, blouses, dresses and most intimidatingly: panties and bra's. Natalie was grateful her tidy nature with clothes had trancended to her girl life as well. She picked up her teddy and the least girly jean and shirt she could find.

She was careful(or perhaps irrational) not to touch any of the bras or panties, as if they might contaminate her, despite fact that she was already wearing a matching pair. Taking her sheets with her, she went Erin's room to make up her bed on the ground.

It was as if Erin wanted to make up for 13 years worth of girl-gossip. She just couldn't shut up. She talked incessantly, without break. Natalie couldn't have gotten a word in if she tried. But Natalie didn't care. As Nate, she was always a quiet person and an excellent listener, never saying anything unless it was truly worth mentioning. Besides, it would appear that Erin was finally having her wish come true. She had an older sister to talk to.
She seemed truly happy, so Natalie just laid there next to her on their stomachs.

Later Erin would caress Natalie's hair, folding ponytails and flexing braids. She even after, great effort, managed to convince Natalie to have a make-up session with her. After resisting initially, Natalie found it quite enjoyable and even relaxing having her sensitive female face caressed by the soft brushes and liners. Lipstick, powder, eyeshadow, eyelines, and various other junk mentioned that Natalie couldn't even remember, later; Natalie was allowed to see her own reflection.

A beautiful, cute teenage girl stared back. Natalie was astonished at the extreme effects the make-up had on accenting her female features and most especially her eyes. The pink pouty lips matching perfectly with the alice-band that bounded several snaking braids running down her back. The eyes were gorgeous without dispute. This girl staring back couldn't possibly be Natalie, it was almost harder to accept than when Nate had been transformed to Natalie and saw herself for the first time.

Natalie felt aroused by her own reflection, but quickly squashed the thought. The irony wasn't lost on her. That she was now the spitting image of HIS own dreamgirl. That she wouldn't be with her dreamgirl, but would be her entirely.
"It's OK for a girl to sometimes fall in love with herself." whispered Erin from the side, reading Natalie like a book and smiling proudly
that her make-up skills had such a profound effect on her sister/brother, much to Natalie's displeasure.

The night ended when Lynda called them both to sleep, saying that it was getting late, and that tomorrow was school. Erin reluctantly relented. Now came the part that Natalie dreaded the most: undressing herself. She had decided she would be quick, ripping off only her shirt, socks and jeans and pulling her teddy over herself. She wasn't comfortable with the sight of herself naked at all.
Erin looked at her expectantly, knowing exactly what she was thinking.
"Uhm...Erin?"
"We're both girls."
"Erin!!"
"Touchy, touchy." giggled Erin at Natalie's obvious embarresment, but still turned around to give Natalie her privacy.

Stripping and redressing at reccord speed, Natalie had decided to eject her bra entirely, its plastic straps having rubbed her shoulders when she had laid next to Erin earlier, and kept only her panties beneath her teddy.
The touch of silk from the teddy carressing her open nipples brought blood to her face, making her blush red-lead fire.
Natalie jumped into bed, hoping Erin didn't see her face; which, along with being covered with pretty freckles around the nose region, was also paler than Nate's face, and showed blushed very prominently.

"Good night Erin." Natalie ventured.
"Good-night, tomato-head." came back the mirthful reply to which Natalie snorted.
But Natalie quickly forgot as later, she could feel her hand grasped by Erin who held it tightly and lovingly as she snored snoozely next to Natalie who only smiled thinly.
1211311221111.title: Ignore her and demand to be returned to normal.

choices: Nicole comes in and asks what's the matter.
12113112211111.content:
Erin woke up first. But it wasn't a graceful awakening. Being a bad morning person and habitually sleeping for 9-hour sessions, she was understandably tired, since she and Natalie had only gone gone to bed at 11:30 and now had to wake up at 6 to prepare for school. Her eyelids felt as if glued with tar; she rubbed the edges of them to get rid of the sleeping-sand which had crytalized around her tear glands. Half-walking, half-crawling, she managed to get herself to face the mirror on her cabinet.

She looked like a mess. Hair diverged into all directions as if hit by a hurricane. The make-up from last nights folly spread around, out of place. The typical image of a heavily overslept girl. She took comfort in that Natalie appeared every bit as bad as she did, if not worse.
Natalie looked ridiculous and as unladylike as could be imagined. Sleek silky black hair in her face, mouth, nose and generally mixed all around her shoulders and arms; like a boa-constrictor coiled around its prey. Since Natalie's hair reached all the way to the small of her back and was about 3 times the length of Erin's, it was only to be expected.

But the scene of ridicule didn't end there, oh no. For Natalie lay in a most peculiar fashion: her rump pointed skywards, as she lay prostrated on her stomach, her knees and the side of her face serving as the legs of her tripod-position. And bandaged around her lower half was her sheets, rapped around 3 times, as if the bed had tried to eat her. Erin stifled a laugh, it was a funny sight indeed.

She was aware that Nate was a very dynamic sleeper and would often role over and change position whilst in sub-conscious mind, ruining the sheets of his bed. But the sight as Natalie was infinitely more precious and called the right of several snapshots from Erin's cellphone camera. Her smile quickly faded into sadness as she realised this would be the last she would see of her older sis.
Last night was undisputably the happiest Erin had experienced, but now all things had to come to an end.

She intended to make full on her promise to turn Natalie back into Nate after one night, and so reached for the Magical candy container to unmake her wish. Only it wasn't there...

Crap.

It wasn't where she had left it earlier, directly on her cabinet next to her closet. Erin remembered that her mother always, cleared away cutlery and food from the kids's rooms early in the morning. Maybe she had taken the container?

Erin wasn't given the chance to ponder this as she heard a long gasp behind her, as if someone had broken the waterline after a deep dive and desperately sucked up air. It was Natalie waking up. It wasn't surprising she had gasped; her own hair strangling her face, smothering the airflow. She tried to stand up drunkenly, struggling to untangle herself from her hair and the linen interwined with her legs. Erin dreaded to face Natalie.

Nate was one of those uncanny individuals who, when they woke up, woke up instantly. Not like Erin who had to rouse herself over the course of 10 minutes before she could function as a sentient being. No. He woke up fully aware of his surroundings, and could start writing a difficult exam - requiring intense concentration - straight out of bed. The same appeared to apply to Natalie.
"Phew! That wasn't my best night." she said cheerfully."Luckily it will definitely be my last with this damned hair."
"Err...it would have been your last." said Erin scared.
'Would have?? Whadoya mean WOULD have?" came back the retort.
"I can't find the container."
Natalie just stared at Erin speechless.
"I think ma might have taken it this morning. I was about to go ask her."

Without a word, Natalie grabbed Erin by the wrist and charged downstairs to the kitchen to where their mother was undoubtedly busy with her morning ritual of preparing breakfast. Like greased lightning, she sprinted downstairs at almost literal break-neck speed as Erin felt her head snap backwards whilst she was towed like a ragdoll behind the desperate Natalie.

"MA!!"
Lynda( their mother) looked at the two sisters whom had burst into the kitchen still wearing their teddies, looking as if they had just emerged from a drugged sleep: "Oh, good morning you two. How-."
"Ma! Did you take a cylindrical container from Erin's room this morning?" interrupted Natalie.
"What are you talking about, dear?" asked Lynda, taken aback by her daughters manner.
"There was cylindrical box of sweets on the cabinet." added Erin helpfully.
"Oh that. It was full of ants. I thought it best to throw it away into the garbage."

The blood drained from Natalie's face, leaving her resembling virgin snow: "You did wha-?" she chocked.
"Are you sure Ma?" asked Erin, concerned for Natalie's sake.
"Yes, I remember because the garbage truck arrived to take the trash cans away right after I emptied the bins."
Shit! Now the candy container was completely out of their hands!
Natalie felt like fainting, her knees weakened, forcing her to grab hold of the fridge to steady herself.
"You O.K. Natalie dear? You look pale." asked Lynda, completely unaware of Natalie's sudden distress.

Still trying to salvage the situation Erin asked:"Ma, are you absolutely sure you threw out all of the sweets? Didn't you maybe save at least one?"
"Yes I'm sure! Trust me, you wouldn't want to those things in your mouth, they were swarmed with bugs! Don't worry, I'll buy you a replacement this afternoon."
Natalie wanted to say that nothing, not even radiation-contamination or sewage rats would have deterred her from eating just one of those damned sweets, but she was simply too dumbfounded to say anything.

"Why are you so interested by those sweets, Natalie?" asked Lynda puzzled. Then as if she had a lightbulb switched on over her head: "Oh I know, was it mayhaps the party present of a friend who happened to be a boy?" she asked batting her eyelids.

That, yep that, was definitely the wrong thing to say. Now it was Natalie's turn to go ballistic. Already faced with the unsavoury possibility of remaining a girl permanently - a fate Natalie found horrifying - she was now pushed over the edge of panic by her mothers retarded boyfriend remark.

She turned tails and run back upstairs; Erin followed suite, leaving Lynda confused who just shrugged: "Ah, young love."

As they ran back upstairs, for who knows what reason, Erin heard her older sis swear in a language most unbefitting for a young girl.
Erin was now very unhappy. She wasn't fooled last night by Natalie's participation in the slumber-party; she knew Natalie had disliked it very bit as much as Erin had enjoyed it. That Natalie was unhappy as a girl. Now having Natalie in a state of distress due to Erin, made her even more so unhappy.

Erin found Natalie staring at herself in her room's full-length mirror, rock-still. Turning they both stared at one another in silence.
Erin cringed, expecting Natalie's wrath for her predicament. She almost wished Natalie would just accuse her for being responsible for Natalie being stuck as a girl instead of giving her this eery silent treatment.
Instead, Natalie just crumpled onto the floor and started crying.

Erin stared in fascination at her sobbing sister, for she had never in her memory saw Nate cry.
12113112211111.title: They wake up the next morning with the Candy co...

choices: Erin teaches Natalie how to properly fold a towel as a girl around herself.
Erin quickly teaches something else equally important involving hygiene.
121131122111112.content:
The sight of the miserable heaving heap that was Natalie weeping made Erin feel as if her heart were falling through her chest.
Natalie didn't make a show, she just sat quietly on her rear, the tears flowing silently, wetting her teddy. This wasn't what Erin had wanted. She never wished misery to Nate; that he was unhappy as a girl was rather fairly obvious.

And now his fate had been sealed as a her. Erin was torn between the joy of having an older sister permanently and seeing Natalie suffer. Erin just stood respectfully, silently, not saying anything. Anything she said would be fruitless anyway.

Eventually Natalie's weeping subsided and she looked up: "I don't want to be a girl." she stated simply.
At that precise moment Nicole walked past, she was clad in a school uniform, she had a piece of toast in her mouth freeing her hands to pull on her jacket and rugsack: "Yes Natalie, we know!" she said disdainfully surprising Natalie and Erin with her out of the blue remark.

"You do?" asked Erin and Natalie, misunderstanding, thinking she was referring to Natalie's transformation when she in fact was referring to Natalie's masculine demeanor she had in this altered reality.

"Yeah! You've made that point whenever we've tried to drag you to the mall and-" she stopped midsentence, seeing Natalie's tears: "What's all this then? Now I've seen everything! Natalie crying? That must definitely be a first!" she turned to Erin "So, what on earth did you do to make her leak? Beat her with a crowbar? That must have been it. I didn't think our tomboy-sister had tearglands the way she beat the bush with the boys. You definitely couldn't have insulted her. Natalie doesn't have emotions; she's colder than the fridge. Out with it, Erin. What'd ya do?" Erin looked very uncomfortable under Nicole's interrogation. The fact that she was being accused of being the cause of Natalie's sorrow hit very close to home the fact that she was the reason Natalie was stuck being female.

But like the good old older sis, Natalie came to her rescue: "Get lost, Nicole! Erin's not at fault here." Erin smiled gratefully at Natalie.
"Ooh, that so? What ya gonna do to make me, crybaby? Set your little old spider on me?" Now the crybaby remark pissed Natalie off, drying her tears instantly. Nicole was a good sort and could be called for in trouble, but she could also be a monumental pain in both neck and arse simultaniously. She had a very sharp mind and tongue, and was mature far beyond her 11-years. She always knew when to push the right buttons to annoy to the utmost, much like she was doing now.

"I might just consider letting Old Stan loose, while you sleep, Nicole." threatened Natalie. They were referring to the pet tarantula Natalie kept in a glass box in her room. Nate had called it Old Stan. It was enormous and had a leg span of 17 centimeters, truly not a sight for the faint of heart.

Nate had held a fascination with insects and arachnids and old Stan had caused a great deal consternation and arguments with his mother Lynda, whom refused to have such a disgusting creature under the roof of her house; Nate would usually counter that lots of insects lived IN her roof anyway. Eventually a truce had been agreed upon: Nate could keep his gargantuan spider,as long as it never left its glass cage. He ignored the rule as often as he could of course, allowing Old Stan to walk across his room and on himself.

Nate loved small creatures. He was a naturalist at heart. Where others would scream in irrational terror at bugs a 1000 times smaller than them and then proceed to grab the nearest fabled shoe to crush the hapless insect, Nate differed. He admired insects and there biological adaptions. He would willingly touch, hold and allow scaly, slimy and hairy creatures and allow them to walk all over him. His favorite prank in life was to settle Old Stan on his back and see how long it took friends to find their petrified voices.

"Oh my." said Nicole in mock terror. "You wouldn't do that t your own sister, would you? Ma said she'd throw that...thing out of the house if it got out of its box. Your welcome by the way."
"Oh yeah, for what?" asked Nate bemused with Nicole's never wavering impudence.
"For cheering ya up. Oh, and I'd advise you 2 to get yar tail-ends in high gear. We leave in 30 minutes for school." And with that Nicole left, wolfing down the toast in her hand.

Both Erin and Natalie realized that Natalie had stopped crying from Nicole's mockery. Again they just stared at one another.
Erin suddenly blurted: "Being a girl c-can be lots of fun! J-just try it for today. I'll help you. Please, for me? I know I can't ask you, but I really still want you as my sister."
Natalie sat down on her bed and sighed, wiping the tear-tracks from her face.
Her ever cynical thin smile appearing on her face: "I am still Nate, and I always will be. I refuse to be anything else."
"But, you'll be my sister too, won't you?" asked Erin
<Sigh>"Yes, Erin. I'll be your sister too."

"Then" said Erin gently. "We kinda need to move. We need to get ready for school."
"Why, we still have half an hour, plenty of time."
"No Nate."Erin shook her head sadly, she used Natalie's male name deliberately. "Girls take longer, we need to hurry a bit."

Erin went to Natalie's closet, took out her school uniform and laid it out gently on her bed: "Grab a towel get a quick shower, I'll join you in a bit."
"W-what?!" gasped Natalie, unprepared to see herself completely naked for the first time since her transformation: "Can't we just get dressed?"
"You...we, stink Natalie." said Erin gently. "You need to wash."
Natalie knew Erin was right and that she would have to face her own nudity, eventually. But she still begrudgingly took a towel and went to the showers.

In the bathroom alone she looked at her own reflection again, then with great deliberation and hesitation, she undressed. First the teddy, then panties. As if experiencing the shock of her transformation all over again, Natalie stared at herself with bewilderment.

Tommy had been Nate's best of friends. They were as thick as thieves since kindergarden. "Never you mind." retorted Erin, fearsomely worried that they would find and see the candy container.

"If you touch Erin, I will throw you into the traffic." said Natalie evenly. Erin smiled gratefully once more; feeling even worse at lying to her loyal older sister.
