"Whatever. You might not say that if you knew yourself. I wish you could see how good a show it is." said Nate.

Just as he said that, Trevor began feeling a bit faint. He had just exited the room and he leaned against the wall, keeping himself up.

"W-What's happening?" he asked himself, feeling too faint to stand up.

He could swear he saw some kind of light engulf him just before he passed out.
14532111.title: He made a wish right there

145321111.content:
Trevor felt like he was briefly drifting in some dark void, as if he was going between dimensions. He didn't know what to do, but the little kid was becoming more than a bit scared right now.

"Where am I? I want to get out of here!" he cried to himself. Suddenly, he could see a faint light. He wanted to get closer, but his body didn't feel like moving. However, the light seemed to slowly come to him instead, becoming bright and brighter until he felt it engulf him once again.

Trevor soon felt hard ground underneath him, feeling warm sun rays hit his face. His eyes soon fluttered open.

"Wha-?" he started to say as he tried to sit up and rub his eyes. Everything seemed....brighter..than normal.

Trevor looked at himself, and saw himself in his normal clothes and looking normal as ever. He saw that he was lying in some kind of futon, although he didn't know that. He just thought of it was a weird sleeping bag.

"Why does everything look so different?" he asked himself as he tried to stand up.

The place he was in was kind of small, but serviceable enough. There was a kitchen and a family room and everything necessary. The place was rather clean, which helped Trevor look see what it was like better.

Still, he couldn't get over how things looked. He looked normal, but everything else looked like some kind of weird cartoon.

"Where am I?" the little kid asked again, having no clue as to where he was.
145321111.title: Waking up

1453211111.content:
Rubbing his eyes again, Trevor still couldn't shake the vision in front of him from his eyes, which kind of scared him a bit. He was alone, in someone's apartment, without his parents around. This was a little too much for the 7-year old.

"Maybe there's someone around who can help me." said Trevor. Right as he began to walk around, he tried to get a good look around. He had no idea what kind of culture this was, but it certainly wasn't anything like it was at home.

"Maybe they're low income, if what mom said is true." Trevor said, remembering a past conversation with his mom.

He looked around a small hallway, which seemed to lead to a closet of sorts. It was kind of big, bigger than the one Trevor had at home. He didn't want to intrude on anyone's privacy, but he was really curious as to find out where he was. With that in mind, he grabbed the handle and gently pulled the door open. He was a bit perplexed by what he saw in there. There were quite a few school uniforms, ones that Trevor would only see on TV. There was the occasional dress and blouse in there too, along with skirts and sweats and such. It was pretty clearly a girls' closet.

"So a girl lives here?" asked Trevor, a bit surprised and worried. His mom always told him to not intrude on a girl's stuff. He quickly closed the closet door after that and walked away.

"Well, now what?" he asked himself. The place wasn't that big, so he couldn't explore much. There seemed to be a bathroom that smelled of flowers a bit, and a laundry room of course. He looked around the floors,which also pointed out something to him.

He grabbed his red t-shirt, which was actually starting to look a little brighter in color.

"What's wrong with my shirt?" he said to himself. It looked a tiny bit brighter, with a couple spots starting to turn white. Very weird was all Trevor could think about. He began to wonder if he spilled something earlier.

What happened next?
1453211111.title: Looking around the place

14532111111.content:
Before the small boy could wonder about his situation any further, Trevor heard his stomach growl. Loud. And, of course, when a child gets hungry, they can only focus on one thing: food. So, with that on his mind, Trevor helped himself to this girl's house. It's not like she would notice anything amiss.

'Come to think of it," the lost boy started to think. 'What would the girl that lives here think of me being here? Would she know why I'm he-'

GROWL!

"Dang it, Mr. Tummy, you made me lose my train of thought," Trevor said to his stomach. Though, it didn't seem strange to him that he was talking to his stomach. He may have been a little kid, but even he thought talking to parts of his own body to be childish and stupid. Guess he saw nothing wrong with doing something so weird anymore.

Anyway, he started looking through the kitchen's cabinets for something easy to cook. Pop-Tarts, cereal, ramen noodles, whatever. That was when he noticed something: Everything was in Japanese. He found a packet of ramen noodles (though he only knew how to make the cups of ramen without any help) and couldn't read a single word! He could only assume it was ramen by the picture, otherwise the words ラーメン would have left him clueless. Trevor looked at the back to see if there were any instructions on the back, but all he found was "5分間お湯に沸かす。 34;.

"Man," he said to himself. "What kind of person has only Japanese food?! I can't even read this! How am I even going to..." He looked at the instructions again. "Boil in hot water for five minutes? Wait! Did I just read that?!"

He read the back of the packet again and again, and he somehow read the same thing everytime. It didn't look any different from when he first looked at it in confusion. And yet, he could understand it perfectly!

"Holy cow..." he muttered to himself. "I can read Japanese!" he said while bouncing up and down excitingly. "Kore wa totemo subarashīdesu!" Trevor cupped his hand over his mouth in shock. "Did I just say that?" he asked himself, but it came out as "Watashi wa chōdo sore o itta?".

"Why can't I speak English?!" he yelled in Japanese. "What is going o-"

GROWL!

"Ok, ok. I'll worry about it later. Food first, worry later," Trevor distracted himself.
14532111111.title: Stomach grumbles

145321111111.content:
Ever distracted by his stomach's demands, the changing boy started to make himself breakfast. After rummaging through the girl's kitchen, Trevor managed to find a pan to fill with water. As he was about to put it up on the sink to start filling it, he realized something: He couldn't reach the sink!

"Baka! I'm only seven! I can't reach the sink!" However, after that was said, he started growing. The seven years old didn't notice it while he was slapping his head in stupidity, but he was growing past his original 4'4" height, starting to reach 4'10". His entire body and muscle structure seemed to grow also, until he looked a good ten years old. Additionally, his shirt was now completely white and somehow managed to grow a pocket on the left side. After a while, he looked back up at the sink. He could reach it now!

"I don't know how this happened, but I don't care!" he cheered in the Japanese voice he also didn't care about anymore. A couple of minutes later, he had water boiling the noodles up on the stove as if he's this many times before. However, after a while, Trevor started to feel something was missing. Perhaps this dish, no matter how simple it was at its core (though miles beyond what he could have done a few minutes ago), it still seemed to require something.

"Bean paste!" the boy shouted, despite never even hearing of such an item before. He started searching every single cabinet for said paste, but none turned up. However, he did find yellow peppers, chocolate syrup, watermelon cuts, almond milk, and zesty salt, so the dish did not go bare. Though, it did boil for a good ten minutes after he took it off the stove. Come to think of it, it probably would have boiled for much longer if Trevor didn't have the thought that his breakfast didn't want anything to do with him and had to throw it out to stop its little fit.

Those were his exact thoughts, by the way.
145321111111.title: Cooking

1453211111112.content:
Nate was just walking back towards his room after a little breakfast.

"Funny, I haven't heard anything from Trevor. Wonder where he's up to." said Nate nonchalantly. After their encounter in his room, Nate had heard nothing from Trevor. As he "wished" that Trevor would understand, he suddenly didn't see him there anymore. He had just assumed that perhaps Trevor had gone back to his room, but he took a brief look there before breakfast and he wasn't there. The very thought confused Nate.

"Hmm, I wonder if he went into the backyard." said Nate. He wasn't too worried. Trevor was known for doing things on his own. This wasn't overly strange. He figured that Trevor would just show up in time. Meanwhile, he wanted to get back to his room.

"Okay, now where was I?" asked Nate as he got back into his room. He immediately went back over to his computer, deciding to look through some stuff again.Interestingly enough, he had Bleach on on his computer, on one of his more favorite websites. He had looked through some of them after Trevor came in.

However, he was in for a surprise once he clicked back onto the website. He nearly lost his breakfast when he suddenly saw Trevor in the small screen.

"Trevor?!" Nate almost yelled.

It looked so weird. Trevor was there, normal as ever, except he stood out so much in the animated world. Although, once Nate looked closer, he saw something off. He didn't remember Trevor's shirt being so white, and he looked like a 10-year old.

"Am I hallucinating?" he asked himself. "I mean, really seeing there is impossible, right?"

He wasn't sure if he was confident or asking himself that question. There was even something else that looked off. He could hear Trevor talking, but it was in clear Japanese. There were even subtitles at the bottom.

"Huh? Well, I definitely see that this is no ordinary episode. What's going on here?" asked Nate to himself.

What happened next?
1453211111112.title: Nate notices something

14532111111121.content:
Meanwhile,

Suddenly, he heard a doorbell. Trevor instantly began to get worried. Was someone looking for the girl who lived here? If so, what would they do if they saw a little boy here? Trevor didn't want to think about it. However, the doorbell kept ringing. Obviously, the person did not want to leave. Trevor was torn. Should he open it and see what happens? Little did he know that his legs were slowly walking him towards the door. Slowly but surely, his hand grasped around the handle and twisted it open. Trevor instantly braced himself for something bad.

"Huh? Who are you?" a girl asked in plain Japanese, although Trevor could hear it as well as English.

Trevor opened his eyes, and had to look up to see a teenaged girl towering over him. She was wearing some kind of uniform that Trevor could recognize from the girl's closet. She had short dark hair, and had the kind of face that said "Don't mess with me."

He gulped at this. She asked him who he was.

"Um....well...I'm Trevor." he said slowly.

"Trevor? Well, what are you doing here? Are you lost?" she asked.

"Kind of....I'm kind of new here...." he said slowly.

"I see. How sad." said the girl, looking sorry for him. "Well, my friend is supposed to be here, but I guess she's out. Why don't you come with me?" she offered.

"Why?" asked Trevor, pulling a bit at his shirt. His white t-shirt felt as if it was tightening a bit on him, and he feel it starting to crawl up his neck too.

"Why don't we look for your family, okay?" asked the girl, a sincere smile on her face. For some reason, Trevor began to feel much better with this girl around.

"That would be great." smiled Trevor.

"Good. Oh, and I'm Tatsuki by the way. Let's go." said Tatsuki, grabbing Trevor by the hand and escorting him out of the apartment, locking the door as they did.

*****GROWL******

Trevor blushed heavily as his stomach growled again, making Tatsuki laugh.

"Guess you haven't had breakfast yet. Understandable if you like normal food." she laughed. Trevor didn't get a chance to ask about that before Tatsuki began pulling him along.
14532111111121.title: Back to Trevor

145321111111211.content:
So, with that decided, Trevor went on a brief walk with Tatsuki.

"Since I guess you're hungry, how about we stop at a restaurant briefly? Don't worry about the money, it's on me." said Tatsuki.

"Thank you." said Trevor. He wasn't quite sure what was going on, but he liked having someone help him out like this. Good thing too, because as he walked down the sidewalk with her, everything around him looked pretty confusing.

"So, how did you end up here? I mean, you have parents right?" asked Tatsuki. Trevor knew that he needed to come up with some excuse for that. She wouldn't believe him just suddenly appearing in that apartment.

"Well....I don't really remember...I may have hit my head somewhere..I can't honestly say why I was in there." said Trevor. Tatsuki gave a sympathetic look.

"I see. Sounds rough. Well, I'm sure we can figure that out eventually. I've got some time before school starts." said Tatsuki.

"You go to school here?" asked Trevor as they began to cross a street.

"Yeah, Karakura High isn't too far from here." said Tatsuki. Trevor could have sworn he heard that name somewhere before, but he couldn't figure out when. Oh well, it probably wasn't that important.

*****GROWL******

"Oh be quiet, Mr. Tummy." grumled Trevor, that odd way of speaking coming out again. Tatsuki began to laugh.

"Ha ha, sounds like you really are hungry. I guess you haven't had anything all morning. Oh look, there's the restaurant I was hoping to get to. We can stop there for a bit." said Tatsuki, pointing towards the restaurant.

"Okay." said Trevor.
145321111111211.title: A walk with Tatsuki

1453211111112111.content:
Before long, the two were finally arrived at the restaurant. Trevor looked at the sign in front and noticed it read "ヒロのカフェ", though he understood it meant Hiro's Cafe.

"My friend and I always go here whenever she blows up breakfast," Tatuski chuckled to the lost boy while they went inside. "They have some of the best donuts in all of Karakura Town."

"So this is Karakura To-DONUTS?!" Trevor blurted, interupting himself. "What kind of donuts? Exactly?"

"Any kind you want I guess." She was a little weirded out by the kid's behaviour, but it was nothing she wasn't used to. "Glazed, chocolate, sprinkles. They're not the main thing here, but they're still pretty-" She looked at both her sides and saw no one standing next to her. Tatuski looked at the counter and saw Trevor already up there ordering donuts.

"I'll take one glazed, one chocolate, one chocolate sprinkled, one glazed chocolate, one...uh..." He now looked uncertain while he was drooling over all the choices in the glass display. "Yo, Tatuski! You feel llike anything?"

"Wait, you were ordering all of those just for you?!" the dark-haired girl asked while glaring at the child with a no-nonsense face.

"Uh... Actually...." Trevor was starting to shrink his head into his enlarged collar. "Maybe..."

"Heh, heh, no," she responded with a hint of anger. "Lost or not, you're not robbing me blind."

"I only wanted five..." Trevor responded sheepishly.

"Well, I'm not made of money. We'll split the four."

"Fine..." Trevor knew when he was defeated. Especially by women. So, Tatuski paid for the donuts and the two sat in a nearby table in the shop.
1453211111112111.title: Breakfast time

14532111111121111.content:
Soon, the two were at the table, enjoying their donuts. Well, Tatuski was eating her's much slower than Trevor since she was busy looking at Trevor eat his. Actually, it was more like devouring than eating. Even while he was chomping to get another huge bite, his mouth was drooling.

"Uh..." Tatuski stammered while inspecting the boy's strange eating habits. Almost similiar eating habits. "How are you, uh, enjoying those donuts?"

Trevor could only mumble with the pieces of donut in his mouth before he swallowed and started to repond. "It's soooooo goooood!" he anwered in a daze with drool running down his chin. His voice seemed even more out there than before along with being higher in pitch. Paying no heed to this, he started stuffing his mouth with his remaining donut.

"Right... So, you know anywhere you could stay?"

"Nuh-uh," the boy answered nonchalantly, too focused on his chocolate donut's rich flavor. "No idea where to go."

"Uh huh. Do you have any information that would help me find your family then?"

"Nope." Trevor's reponse was followed by some om nom noms.

"Well, maybe you could stay at the dojo while I go to school. My parents'll kill me if I skipped school."

Trevor dropped his jaw a little and Tatuski finally had his attention. "Dojo?! You know kung fu?!"

"Karate," she corrected with a toothy grin on her face. "Number one, too."

"What?!" The boy was gaping in awe at the girl's statements. "How many fights have you won?"

"All of them for the past six years!" Tauski answered with great pride. "I even won a championship with a broken arm once."

"No way!" Trevor bursted, awesruck at this teenage girl's apparent accomplishments. "YOu haven't lost a single fight before?"

"Well..." she trailed off. "There was this one time. A friend of mine was in a really bad mood at the time." By now, she looked almost somber. Trevor, however, was eyeing the remaining glazed donut in the box. He glared hopefully at Tatuski, who stared back. The two exchanged stares for a good two minutes until...

"Fine!" Tatuski shouted. "You can have it."

"Yay! Thank you, Tatuski-kun!"

"Whatever..."
14532111111121111.title: Eating

145321111111211112.content:
As Trevor continued to devour his donut with passion, Nate was watching the whole thing with his mouth wide open. The hell was going on?! One minute, he's having breakfast. The next, his little brother's inside his favorite anime! He also noticed he seemed to be changing. Fan-freakin'-tastic. How could this even be happening? The last time he saw him, all he did was wish Trevor would see how great Bleach was.

Oh God! The wish! The candies! They were real! His own idle wish had sent his little brother into Bleach! To be honest, he was a little glad to see Tatuski have more screentime, but wasn't happy about it being with his brother.

"Okay," Nate thought to himself to calm his nerves. "So, Trevor is stuck inside an anime. Maybe it was my fault, maybe not. Point is, I got to fix this. Perhaps the best soulution is totry to use the candies

"What's that about Trevor?" called a female voice at Nate's door. He turned around to see his thirteen year old little sister, Erin. Her expression was a little confused with a hint of worry. She had obviously heard her brother's ramblings to himself. "And what's this about candies?"

Nate had to give out a large and lenghthy sigh before looking at his computer screen again. He noticed with dull surprise that Trevor's hair was now a much lighter brown now. Damn.

"Mā, watashi wa iku junbi ga dekite imasu. Ikagadeshou, Tatuski?" he heard his brother say to the supporting character. Luckily, he could read that he meant "Well, I'm ready to go. How about you, Tatuski?" through the subtitles.

"Is that Trevor?!" Erin blurted while looking at the same thing. "The hell is going on?!"

Nate had to give another large sigh.
145321111111211112.title: Back with Nate

1453211111112111121.content:
"Again, what?!" exclaimed Erin.

Nate had just explained what happened to Trevor, as well as his explanation on what could be the possible reason.

"Would you stop yelling like that?" groaned Nate.

"How can I not? You're saying our brother is inside one of your tv shows? That isn't natural." said Erin.

"I know that." sighed Nate. This was getting a bit annoying. Erin was totally exasperated now.

"Well, why haven't you tried to get him out? If your candies put him in there, surely they can pull him out." said Erin.

"I was going to get to that before you came in here yelling." said Nate.

"Well, I want to do it, so gimme that!" she said, taking one candy out of the jar.

"Hey, those things put Trevor in there. You don't want to mess things up further." said Nate as Erin popped the candy into her mouth.

"Why? It shouldn't be that hard. I wish Trevor was back with us." said Erin.

She felt something go through her briefly. However, it soon passed and they couldn't see anything different.

"Nothing happened. Does it take a while?" asked Erin.

Nate looked towards his screen. He could still make out Trevor.

"Perhaps it takes a while. How about we go downstairs and calm down a bit before it happens?" suggested Nate.

"Okay." said Erin.
1453211111112111121.title: One explanation later...

14532111111121111211.content:
As this was happening, Lynda was cleaning up some things downstairs. Suddenly, she felt something small go through her, although it wasn't much.

"Hmm, what was that?" she asked herself as she finished up some dishes. "Well, that's all for the dishes. Hmm, I guess Trevor's room could use some cleaning. He never does clean it himself after all." she mumbled to herself.

Trevor was notorious for never really cleaning his room all that much. For some reason, Lynda began to get a feeling that she should go up to his room for one reason or another. With that, she finished up in the kitchen and began to go upstairs. As she did, something odd caught her eye. She looked around the walls, and it was as if the walls were beginning to get higher.

"Are the walls getting higher?" she asked herself before shaking her head. She was probably just imagining it.

However, as she began walking up the stairs, her height and age slowly began to shrink, beginning to go lower than 5 feet. She could still hold on the staircase, but it seemed like it was getting a bit more difficult now.

Still, Lynda imagined that it was just nerves after some cleaning. She walked past Nate's room along the way. She could see that Nate and Erin were in there, perhaps about to come out, but she didn't say anything. As she passed that room, she found Trevor's room and entered it, room being as messy as it ever was. She sighed as she looked around.

"Well, I guess I should start."

As she said that, she began walking around, clearing some random things off the ground. As she kept walking around, he kept decreasing in age, easily going past teenage years and into her childhood years. Her height kept growing down past 4 feet, ending a bit below that.

What's next?
14532111111121111211.title: Mother downstairs

145321111111211112111.content:
As Lynda looked around, she happened to come across some of Trevor's Pokemon stuff. Trevor was heavily into Pokemon, collecting games, watching the TV show, and all of that stuff. Like any parent, Lynda found most of it silly, but as she picked up one of the games Trevor had, a smile adorned her face.

"This was a good game." she said before shaking her head. "Huh?"

As this happened, her blouse shifted material, becoming a bit sturdier than usual. The buttons along the middle disappeared as the folds fused together into a simple t-shirt. The light color soon faded, being replaced by a nice red color. As it happened, she could feel her bra fading away, her breasts being pushed out of oblivion.

"Oh wait, now I remember. This was the first game. Started with a Charmander." she smiled.

As this happened, any curves she had faded out, being replaced with a little boy's figure. Her shirt reformed itself into two leggings, fading blue as they did. Before long, she had a pair of blue shorts to accompany the shirt.

Soon enough, she was going through Trevor's Pokemon stuff, more admiring it than cleaning it. For some reason, she seemed to have a profound interest in it now. As she did, her brown hair retracted into her head, becoming short and very similar to Trevor's old cut.

"Oh, what's this?" she said as she came across a DVD of Pokemon: Diamond and Pearl. That was a series she liked a bit, mostly thanks to the characters. In particular, she looked at the newer character, Dawn, finding her to be a personal favorite among the females.

"I liked her. She was cute." she said, not really thinking like Lynda much anymore.

As she did, her female facial features reformed, beoming that of a young boy. She now heavily resembled Trevor appearance-wise, and before long, as her panites reshaped into underwear, a small appendage grew there, completing the change into a young boy.

"Maybe I should watch this again." smiled Trevor, as Lynda completely became a new Trevor.

What's next?
145321111111211112111.title: Cleaning Trevor's stuff

1453211111112111121111.content:
While the new Trevor was relaxing in the real world, the original one was walking down the streets of Karakura with the dark-haired girl. Funny thing, his hair used to be just as dark. But by now, it already lightened upped in ways not even bleaching could achieve. What was originally a very dark brown scalp now possesed dark orange hair. It seemed to be growing, too. After a while, Tatuski finally took notice.

"Trevor, your hair!" she called out at the boy.

"Yeah, what about it?" said boy asked back.

"It's just, I just noticed the color. You have orange hair, too!" Her expression was a mix of shock, but still possessed a grin, as if she thought of his hair color as an enduring trait.

"Yeah, it's always been? Can't believe it took you this long to notice," he teased with a mischevious, but otherwise gentle smile.

"Yeah, well, I guess I was a little too focused on your amnesia," she snapped back. "Any luck on that, by the way?"

"Nope!" Trevor answered with a careless smile.

"Uh-huh. Well, it's just that, I know a couple of good friends with hair like yours is all."

"Really? Who?"

"Well... Remember when I told you that the only fight I've ever lost was by a friend of mine who was in a really bad move?"

"You lost a fight?!" Trevor was in genuine shock.

"Guess you don't," Tatuski smirked in amusement. She was annoyed, but amused. "See, this friend, his name is Ichigo Kurosaki. And I tell 'ya, he used to be such a big baby when we were little! Always by his mom, always crying when he got beaten in karate, which was every time. He was a nice kid and all, but a horrible fighter."

Tatuski now had Trevor's full attention. He himself remembered when he used to be a momma's boy, all those years ago. But he had to be at most seven back then, and he was thirteen now. Those days were but simple memories.
1453211111112111121111.title: Back to the old Trevor

14532111111121111211111.content:
As Trevor was listening intently, Tatuski was continuing her story. "I'm not sure whether it's funny or even harsher in hindsight, but let's just say he's far from a crybaby now. In fact, he always seems to get into fights. Apparently, all the punks in town think he's one too since he looks like he bleaches his hair to look orange. Though, that's completely untrue. Ichigo's hair is just as natural as yours." She paused for a little bit. "Your hair is natural, right?"

"Absotutely!" the new teenager chirped.

"Well, have you ever been picked on for your hair?"

"Not really. Sometimes I even get compliments!" he smiled back.

"Right..."

"So, what happened to this Ichigo guy so tough, anyway?"

"Oh! Um..." Tatuski started rubbing the back of her spiky hair nervously. "I'm not too sure I should tell you. He'd give me hell if he found out."

"Oh, come on!" Trevor whined while staring at the older girl with big blue eyes. However, neither of them noticed when his eyes grew even larger and his eye color turned brown.

Tatuski had to give out a nice long sigh before responding. "Fine..."

And so she explained her friend's tragic backstory in as much detail as she could handle. When your friend develops such deep troubles when they are both at a young age, you tend to remember every detail. Trevor could feel the very details sink into his gut, as if feeling this person he's never seen before's pain. It was so sad! Trevor wouldn't even deny he had to wipe his eye a couple times during the story. To tell the truth, they were both feeling a little depressed when all was said and done.
14532111111121111211111.title: Tatuski continues her story

145321111111211112111112.content:
Just as Tatuski was finishing her story, the two finally arrived at the dojo. Tatuski had to admit that she was a little glad to get off the uncomfortable subject.

"Well, here we are, kid," she proclaimed while opening the door.

"Kid? I'm just two years younger than you! And why do I have to stay in some smelly dojo?"

"Yeah, well, you're a little too young to go to school with me and this dojo is the only open community center in town that I can bring you in. So, unless you spontaneously age two years, it's either this way or the highway. And traffic is getting busy right now."

"Fine..." Trevor grumbled. "Just let me use the bathroom before you leave."

"Why would I wait for that?!"

"Just don't leave until I'm done! Is that too much of a stretch?"

Tatuski let out a long groan. "Fine. Just hurry up."

And so, Trevor went into the nearest restroom, not even noticing it being the girls', and sat down on the nearest toilet to do his business. As he did so, he felt his seat becoming even more cushy, not realizing it to be his enlarging rear. Nor did he realize his shrinking boyhood that never seemed to grow with his age. As soon as he was done, he looked at himself in the mirror.

Everything seemed as usual: His fifteen year old body was still only 5'2'' and still seemed to be an even 99 pounds. Puberty was rather small on him. In fact, any body hair he may have had before it had already evaporated. Though, he supposed his back-length hair more than made up for it. Hell, he even had two strands that reached down all the way down to his shoulders. Couldn't remember why he let it grow out so much, though.

After the quick inspection, Trevor met back up with his equal aged friend.

"You finally ready?" Tatuski asked impatiently.

"Yes, sir!" Trevor saluted playfully. And with that, the two darted off to Karakura High.
145321111111211112111112.title: They arrive at their destination

1453211111112111121111121.content:
"Now I can finally see this school of yours." smiled Trevor.

On the other hand, Tatsuki just sighed. "Yeah yeah, I'm aware. Could you stop jumping around? You're giving me a headache." she groaned.

"Sorry, but I'm really curious." said Trevor.

"Well, you should like the place." said Tatsuki. "I mean, it's decent enough to where it gets the job done." she further explained.

As they walked, Trevor continued to ask about the school, not noticing a red ribbon form around his collared neck. Further more, as they kept walking, Trevor could feel himselt beginning to walk differently. He looked down for a bit and saw that his shorts were seemingly a dark grey right now, different from their blue color before. The leggings even seemed to be fusing together, as it didn't prohibit his walking as much as the shorts did.

"Does this friend of yours go there too?" asked Trevor.

"You mean Ichigo? Yeah he does. Doesn't talk much though. He's gotten quieter since those days when he would always cry." said Tatsuki. "Although, I do wonder if he's been up to weird things as of late, but he doesn't like to speak what's on his mind a whole lot."

"Sounds like he likes acting tough." smiled Trevor.

"Maybe so." smiled Tatsuki. "But he is tough to back it up, especially nowadays."

As they kept along the sidewalk, Trevor's shorts fully fused together, becoming a thigh-length grey skirt that flowed around his legs and newly-formed rear. His socks even seemed to reach higher up his legs now, reaching higher up his calves. His shoes even looked a bit simpler now, looking more brownish in color and lacking shoelaces.
1453211111112111121111121.title: To the school

14532111111121111211111212.content:
Meanwhile, Nate watched the TV, as exasperated as before.

"Sheesh, he's acting more like her now." said Nate.

"What do you mean?" asked Erin.

"He's acting and starting to look like Orihime. I won't bother with details but that looks like he Trevor is becoming." said Nate.

After what happened earlier, the two of them had gone downstairs for some food, although tye didn't see their mom down there. Surprisingly enough, they were unaware of the fact that their mother had become a new Trevor that was currently in his room.

However, they also didn't notice that someone else had entered the room, someone who was now sucking on a stray piece of candy that had fallen out earlier.

"What'cha doing?" asked a voice.

Nate and Erin turned around to see their youngest sibling, Nicole. She was apparently sucking on something, but they didn't make the candy connection. They were focused on Trevor.

"Watching Trevor." said Eric out of the blue. Nate wasn't too sure about outright telling Nicole about it. She seemed confused.

"Where is he?" asked Nicole.

"Well, let's just say he's in Japan." said Erin. Nate raised an eyebrow at that. Nicole smiled aqnd clapped her hands.

"Wow, that sounds cool. I wish I could see Japan." she said.

Right as she said that, a bright flash of light engulfed her, and she soon vanished from Nate and Erin's view.

"What?" asked them both.
14532111111121111211111212.title: Back in the real world

145321111111211112111112122.content:
Meanwhile, on the other side of the world (otherwise known as Tokyo, Japan), Nicole was beamed down near a large pool at an expensive hotel. She looked around a bit, but it only confused her further. Honestly, if it weren't for the magic, she'd be having a panic attack by now. But since she was only there because of magic, she was abnormally calm. Confused, but calm. Although, she did get a little scared when a large man, most likely Japanese, came over to her.

"Jigoku wa anata ga yatte iru to omoimasu ka?" the man shouted at Nicole, though she did not understand. However, she didn't need to know what he said to be hurt by it. In fact, she was already in tears.

While she was sobbing, Nicole was changing rapidly. Her very DNA was being rewritten as ripples appeared all over her body. All of her skin turned from its usual pale Caucasion tone to a more yellowish tint. Nicole could recognize it as similar to his brother's friend, Heather Yamamoto. Though, Heather was Japanese-American. Nicole was becoming a full-blooded Japanese. The tears coming from her eyes started to recede, somehow changing her eye color to brown from the Wilsons' regular blue. Right above her new sparkling blue eyes, her eyelids started to meld into her skin, gaining epicanthal folds.

Nicole now seemed completely Japanese, but her new genes still caused her body to shift ever so slightly in some places. Before long, her facial features and mole on the right side of her back made her heritage traceable to Hitomi and Shiro Hashimoto. Not that it mattered to Nicole. Besides, she loved being told how much she resembled her parents.

Akahana Hashimoto loved her parents after all.

So, with her emotions finally in check, Akahana looked back at the man. "Watashi wa watashi ga koko ni iru hazudatta to omotta," she finally answered the man, meaning "I thought I was supposed to be here," in English.
145321111111211112111112122.title: Where is Nicole?

1453211111112111121111121221.content:
By the same time that Akahana was newly minted, Nate and Erin had finally gotten over their initial panic and decided to do the most logical thing.

"I wish Erin and I could see where Nicole with our minds," Nate wished carefully. Suddenly, the two were given a psychic image of a little Japanese girl around their sister's age. It took them a few seconds of confusion for it to dawn on them that this girl was their sister. The simultaneous realization caused them both to gasp at the same time. Wait until they saw what changed next.

After Akahana decided to sit down on a chair against the wall of the pool at the request of the man from earlier, she was stuck with sudden jealousy. The man was directing a calender photo shoot at the pool, so there were obviously plenty of bikini models there. Akahana thought these women were beautiful and could only wish to some day be as pretty as them. Even though she already used up her candy's wish, the magic didn't transport her to a photo shoot for nothing.

Her entire body tingled and started to grow far past her prepubescent standards. In an instant, she grew from 3'8'' to a sleek 5'6'', with the womanly legs to match. The girl's face matured to reveal a beautiful Japanese woman's, free of any of her former baby fat or blemishes. A necklace and bracelet appeared on her neck and left wrist repectively. Her hair grew even longer and became more volumous than ever, even curling a bit at the ends.

Akahana's blue dress was ripped to shreds by now, but the remains were already forming into a new set of clothes. A two-piece bikini, to be exact. It looked strange on her flat chest and immature figure, but those problems were soon corrected. Her hair was pushed up from her chest a little bit as a couple of modest breasts were starting to grow. More womanly fat was applied to her hips that also allowed her curves to show in full flaunt. Akahana was far from the five years old she was but moments ago. She now resembled a downright gorgeous 26 years old Japanese model.

Granted, everyone knew she was. Akahana Hashimoto was known across all of Japan for her beauty and occasional acting gig. In fact, she was in the middle of a shoot now, with a good five bodyguards protecting her and her fellow models. Life was good.

(Akahana Hashimoto: http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-pCvTHw9BpBY/Tz... )
1453211111112111121111121221.title: Nate and Erin watch her

14532111111121111211111212211.content:
Erin was in panic mode right now.

"What is happening? Now both of our siblings are gone." said Erin.

"I don't know any more than you do, Erin. We still don't know about when you wished Trevor back. Perhaps we should go look." said Nate.

"I guess that's a good idea." said Erin, still sucking on the candy she had. After Nate ran out of the room, Erin sighed. "I wish that Nicole was back with us."

*****Meanwhile*****

Oblivious to all that was around him, Mike Wilson was sitting in the family room, channel surfing currently. As far as he knew, all three of his kids were running around somewhere. He seemed to think about a fourth sometimes, but the idea of him having a fourth kid sounded very weird. He shook his head as he thought that, figuring that there wasn't much to think about there.

"I don't have another kid, right..." he trailed off as he kept channel surfing. As he kept on watching, a different show appeared. It was one of the kiddy shows that Nicole used to watch. As Mike was about to hit the channel button, he suddenly stopped. Something in him didn't want to change the channel, which was weird.

"Huh? What's going on here?" he asked.

As he said this, he felt a small shock go through his body, although it wasn't enough for him to really think about it. However, he soon started to see the walls begin to extend, if that made any sense. It felt like the room was getting a bit bigger. Mike raised an eyebrow at that. The room couldn't be getting bigger, could it?

"I must be seeing things." he said to himself. However, as he ended up taking a look at the show, his height was slowly decreasing, along with his age for that matter. Quickly, he wasn't looking like a mid-30's man anymore, as he rapidly grew down past 20 years old, looking a bit more like a teenager. With that, his height was rapidly going down, nearing 5 feet, far from where he would end up.

"You know...I guess this show isn't bad. I can see why the others watch it." he said.

Soon enough, the show was over, and Mike got up from the couch and stretched. However, he noticed that the room looked much bigger now, as he had grown down past 5 feet, and past 4'6 as well, looking ever younger as he did.

And something else seemed to catch his eye as he looked down. "Am I wearing sandals?"

His socks had vanished by now, exposing his feet as his shoes were rapidly shifting. Their color was going towards a bright blue color, and more of his feet were beginning to be shown. Mike was beginning to wonder if he was hallucinating or something.
14532111111121111211111212211.title: With Nate and Erin

145321111111211112111112122111.content:
Hoping to get his mind off of this, Mike absentmindedly began walking upstairs. It was like something was drawing him there right now, and he just wanted anything to get his mind off of these changes. Although, part of him really didn't have too much of a problem.

Anyway, as he walked up the stairs, he had to hold onto the railing, as his height kept decreasing. Now, he truly looked like a little child, barely at 4 feet right now. His skin was much softer now, and hairless for that matter. He didn't think about such things though. He just wanted to find out what was happening. He got to the top of the stairs, bypassing Nate's room, and happened to see Nicole's room. However, while he normally would just go past it, something beckoned him to walk in. As he did, his shorts and shirt began fusing together at the hem, becoming one single garment.

He stood on his toes for a bit to open his door, being pretty short and all, and got into Nicole's room. Like any little girl, her room was filled with dolls and the like, with some stuffed animals as well. A little bear was Nicole's favorite when she was around, and Mike even began to find the dear cute.

"Hey there Mr. Stuffy." he cooed at the bear.

As he did, his facial features softened, his little mouth once again having mostly baby teeth, with some adult teeth coming in. His face took on Nicole's soft features, including the little freckles she had. As this happened, his brown hair began flowing out of his head, flowing down to his shoulders.

Without even thinking, Mike walked over to the collection of dolls and animals and began to play, honestly having a lot of fun. He laughed and giggled through most of it, his voice becoming Nicole's high-pitched one.

As this happened, his shirt and shorts, which ere now fully fused, turned a bright blue color. The leggings of his shorts tore and came together in a single skirt form, creating a light blue dress for the little kid. Beneath his changing underwear, which was becoming little girl panties, Mike could briefly feel something pop in his groin. He reached down and felt something small slowly slip away, as "she" became Nicole.

"What was that? Oh well, back to Mr. Stuffy." giggled Nicole as she arranged a little "party" with her animals and dolls.
145321111111211112111112122111.title: Going upstairs

choices: She tells about all the weird things
1453211111112111121111121221111.content:
As all that craziness was going on, things were starting to get interesting in Karakura Town. Trevor and Tatuski had finally arrived at the school's gate and were trying to reclaim their breath from the run. Well, Trevor was, anyway. He obviously wasn't wearing the right shoes for running.

"I... hate... running!" Trevor somehow managed to spit out while panting.

"You really got to get in better shape, dude," Tatuski chuckled back.

"Well... in case you haven't... realized... one of us isn't a karate champion."

"Come on!" She playfully slapped Trevor's back. "If you live in Karakura Town, you got to learn to run."

"Why's that?"

The question was expected on Tatuski's part, but she still couldn't help but feel shocked that she had to give an answer. Was this strange teenager that was in her best friend's apartment worthy of her trust? Worthy of explaining all of the strange things she's been seeing? Could she even explain it to herself?

"Oi! Tatuski!" Trevor snapped while waving his hand in front of the girl. Funny how he had to look down to do it despite being noticablely shorter earlier. Granted, it was also funny how neither noticed how lean his arms had become and how femimine his hands were now. Or the fingernail polish.

"I know how pretty the sun can be," the boy continued in his Japanese schoolgirl voice. "But you know you shouldn't look at it too long. Your eyes could burst enter flames!" Trevor accentuated his warning by mimicing what he believed eyes bursting looked like. His female friend couldn't help but laugh.

"Well... If you must know..."
1453211111112111121111121221111.title: Back to the old Trevor

choices: They make to class in time
14532111111121111211111212211111.content:
"You see," she sighed. "This may sound crazy, but...." She hesitated a little bit to look back at the boy she was telling this to. Better damn well be worth telling him. "I can see ghosts."

"Ghosts?" Trevor questioned back in genuine curiousity and intrigue.

"Yeah. Both good and bad."

"There's such thing as good and bad ghosts?" Would this have been earlier, Trevor would have thought the girl as insane from her tellings. Or at least a really stupid liar. But now, he couldn't bring himself to believe Tatuski-chan could ever lie to him. Also, for some reason, he seemed much more open to the idea of supernatural forces.

"Yeah, well, maybe not quite good or bad. There are nice ones and ones that are just whiny idiots. Thing is, there are... different ones I see sometimes. I don't know what they are, but they definitely aren't nice.

I've only seen little glimpses of them before, but... I can practically feel their darkness. Or evilness, hunger, or whatever. I dunno. All I know is that I can feel how much bad news they are. Luckily, they don't seem to stay around for long."

Tatuski looked back at her single-man audience. He must be thinking she was mental. "I know you probably think I'm mental, but I'm telling you this is-"

She was cut off by a spontaneous hug from her friend. "Oh, Tatuski-chan, of course I believe you!" he comforted. Tatuski could only pat the boy's back in response. She couldn't tell what this guy's deal was, but she felt genuinely comforted. Almost like she was used to such affection. Even he did run them late, he-

Oh, God, he ran them late!
14532111111121111211111212211111.title: She tells about all the weird things

145321111111211112111112122111111.content:
It was a close call, but they did somehow manage to get to their desks right before the bell rang. Yeah, their desks. Although he couldn't reason his choice, Trevor sat in the desk right next to Tatuski without hesitation. It didn't bother anyone since no one saw anything wrong with it, not even Trevor himself. All of his surroundings were new to him, yet he had an absolute sense of regularity sitting next to his tomboy friend in a Japanese classroom.

The teacher was taking longer than usual, so Trevor just started to glance around the classroom. It seemed pretty normal (for Japan, that is) with some pretty average students. Well... Maybe not completely average. Just from his seat in the back, he noticed a guy with almost impossibly shiny glasses sewing embroidery, a dark-skinned guy who could pass as a full grown man (an almost impossibly buff grown man, at least), and another guy with bright orange hair.

...Wait. Something about that seemed familiar. Sounded familiar....

... Wait... Of course! How could he be such a ditz for not realizing it before?! This was Ichigo! Ichigo Kurosaki, the guy Tatuski was talking about! This was the guy!

He took one more look at the strange haired boy's deep scowl. Oh yeah... It was that guy. The one with that whole tragic backstory and whatnot, who would randomly disappear now a days. How sad. At least he still looked kind of cu-

"Good morning, Karakura High!" shouted a young woman with brown hair and glasses. Although he'd never seen this woman before in his life, Trevor was somehow able to identify the woman as Ms. Ochi, the class's teacher. "Sorry I'm late. There was some kind of freak accident down at Mistsumiya. I think it was some type of spontaneous explosion or something."

The room was suddenly erupt with murmurs of the accident. Annoyed by her student's interuptions, Ms. Ochi saw it fit to clear her throat as loudly as possible. "Since you all seemed so interested in explosions, perhaps you'd enjoy our chemistry experiment today."

The entire class gave a collective groan with the exception of Trevor, who seemed almost excited of the idea. Tatuski looked at his expression and gave a nervous chuckle. She didn't know if she trusted this guy with chemicals. Or anything that could potentionally lead to an explosion.
145321111111211112111112122111111.title: They make to class in time

1453211111112111121111121221111111.content:
Anyway, back in reality, Erin had gone downstairs to get a snack. Nate was in the bathroom right now. Both of them hadn't realized that their parents were gone, having become newer versions of their little siblings. Lynda, who was now Trevor, had walked into Nate's room, looking for his big brother.

"Where is he?" he wondered out loud. As he did, he looked forward, seeing the jar of candies that Nate had left behind. Of course, no kid could resist.

"Oooh, candy." he smiled as he climbed up Nate's chair and grabbed one of the many candies inside, instantly putting it inside his mouth.

"Hmm, this is good!" he smiled, before jumping down from the chair and walking out before Nate could realize he took one. He ran back to his room, closing the door as he did. After closing it, he looked around at his toys all around. One of them was a DVD for the Pokemon show, which was one of his favorites, especially in the recent series. One of the newer main characters, Dawn, was someone the little kid thought was very cute. He had a crush on her, although he told no one about that.

"I wish I could see someone like her." he said.

*****Back with Nate*****

As the wish was made, Nate had just exited the bathroom, feeling refreshed after relieving himself.

"Okay, maybe I should try and find Trevor or Nicole." he said to himself. He hadn't seen either since the wish, so perhaps it was time to look. Quickly, he began walking towards Trevor's room. Opening it a peek, he could see "Trevor" inside, making him smile.

"Oh good, so the wish worked I guess." said Nate. Instead of going back to his room to see if he was still on the TV, Nate instead began walking downstairs. He could tell the news to Erin.

However, as he began to go downstairs, he felt the handrail get higher to lean on. He turned to the side and saw that he actually had to reach up a bit to keep a hand on it.

"What? What happened here?" he asked, looking around and seeing that the area looked a little bigger than normal. However, that wasn't the case. Nate was rapidly shrinking, growing down and closer to that of a kid, possibly around 10 years old. His new height was rounding out at about 4 feet or so.

"Hmm, maybe all this stress is getting to me." he said to himself.

However, as he reached the bottom of the stairs, he didn't notice his figure and skin start to become more feminine, with his skin getting softer as if it was taken care of daily, and his figure became more petite.
1453211111112111121111121221111111.title: Back in reality

14532111111121111211111212211111111.content:
Nate reached the bottom of the staircase, feeling awfully weird compared to when he started walking. He looked down, seeing little kids feet attached to smaller legs. He couldn't see all of him, but he looked a lot like a little kid.

"What is this?" he asked himself.

However, he still wanted to tell Erin about this, so he tried to look around for her. However, he couldn't find her in the kitchen or dining room. He then walked towards the family room, but couldn't find her there either.

"Man, where is she?" he asked in frustration.

However, as he walked, his hair began to grow, becoming darker as it began to flow past his shoulders. His t-shirt was also beginning to lose his sleeves, becoming darker as well. Nate didn't notice either of these as he was focused on finding Erin, but he still felt the odd feeling throughout it.

"Maybe I should just watch some TV." he decided, jumping onto the sofa. As he did, his t-shirt finished turning jet black, while also losing any sleeves it had as it confirmed closer to his thinner body. The undershirt he wore also seemed to be getting smaller in a sense.

Anyway, Nate turned the TV on, putting whatever he could find on. He briefly saw a commercial with Akahana on it, but didn't care much for it. He just wanted to see what was on. However, to his surprise, he actually ended up on Cartoon Network, where a Pokemon episode was airing. Surprisingly, he smiled at it.

"Oh good, another episode." he smiled.

As he sat there, his hair flowed down past his back, some of it twisting into a particular hairstyle that used two hair clips on the sides of his head. In addition to all of that, it began to even get a bit of a blue shade to it. Quite unnatural normally, but Nate wasn't becoming someone normal at all.
14532111111121111211111212211111111.title: Further along

145321111111211112111112122111111111.content:
Nate kept watching the episode, continuing to be fascinated by it. He liked it when he was a kid, but he looked every bit like a kid now.

"This is cool." he smiled.

As he did, his shorts started fading, becoming more pinkish in color as the leggings began to tear apart, starting to remake themselves as a short skirt, flowing around his thighs. Soon enough, the ends reconnected, and the pink skirt was complete.

Right after that, Nate heard someone.

"Nate!" cried "Trevor", who was really the transformed Lynda. However, Nate didn't know that and smiled as he came over.

"Hi Trevor!" smiled Nate, whom Trevor hugged upon coming over. As this happened, Nate's socks rose up his legs, turning blackish as his new look began to complete. His facial features were already feminine now, including his eyes turning a bright blue.

"When did you come over?" asked Trevor.

"Just now." said Nate, not wondering why Trevor would ask such a thing. However, as his underwear began to turn into pink panties, an opening was forming in his groin, as his manhood began to fade away.

"Oh, you're watching the show. You look so much like the girl in this." smiled Trevor.

"Thank you." smiled Nate, who by now was even beginning to sound like her. His manhood continued to shrink away, as Nate began to feel Trevor's eyes on him. He turned towards Trevor, making him turn his head quickly.

"What's wrong?" asked Nate.

"Oh nothing." Trevor said quickly.

Nate smiled at him. It ended up being his last as Nate as his manhood faded away, leaving what almost looked like a real anime-like girl in the room.

"Oh come on, tell me!" smiled Dawn as she shook Trevor back and forth. Trevor blushed and didn't answer. It only made Dawn even more curious.

"Oh well, I'll see what it is eventually. Let's go watch another episode in your room before my mom has to pick me up." said Dawn.

"I'm game for that." smiled Trevor as he took his 10-year old friend up to his room.
145321111111211112111112122111111111.title: After that

1453211111112111121111121221111111112.content:
While the new Trevor was off having fun with his slightly older neighbour, the original one was having to use the Karakura High girl's bathroom. See, today's chemistry lab didn't exactly work out all too well. By that, I mean Trevor kind of caused his and Tatuski's flask to explode after making their solution unstable with his lunch. It never crossed his mind how he suddenly had a girly pink backpack he didn't come into the building with, or how he had a homemade lunch inside of it.

And now, him and Tatuski had to wash off whatever formula he ended up creating. Whatever it was, it smelt just like Trevor's cooking: terrible.

"I still can't believe you'd do something so stupid!" Tatuski growled while washing her face with the faucet. "Why would you even try put your lunch in there?"

"Sorry," Trevor replied apologetically. "I was just trying to eat a good luck ramen and watermelon sandwich, but I guess some of the mustard and hot sauce must have dropped into the flask. I'm so sorry, Tatuski-chan." His teenage girl face was starting to wilt while his feminine voice cracked a little. Tatuski didn't like the looks of it at all.

"Listen, it's okay, Trevor. Just try not to do it again."

"Yes, sir!" he said while saluting playfully. "Would you like to try some of my sandwich to make it up to you?"

"Uh... No." The two shared a brief laugh and got back to washing off whatever chemicals may still be on them. Trevor took the time to adjust the bangs of his lenghthy hair. He took a pair of flowery hairpins out of his pocket and used them to tuck his bangs behind his ears. He worried less about where the hairpins came from and more about why he did't have them on before. He usually always had them on, in memory of his brother.

Wait... His brother wasn't dead. Or was he? No, last he checked, Nate was... a person? Who was Nate? The only image that came to his mind when he thought 'brother' was Sora. And he knew he was gone. Safe and sound in... Heaven? He knew that much was true, yet the name 'Heaven' seemed wrong. What was the real name again?
1453211111112111121111121221111111112.title: Back to Trevor in Karakura

14532111111121111211111212211111111122.content:
Before Trevor could think anymore of the subject, he felt a shiver go down his spine. Though, it felt like more than a shiver, it felt like... something. Something nearby. Something bad. Trevor was worried. Somehow, he knew whatever he felt was a bad omen. Possibly even an evil one.

However, he was not scared. For some reason, he actually felt empowered, like he knew he could take on whatever he was feeling. Though, a small voice in the back of his orange haired head told him that Tatuski couldn't get involved. He had to find this thing without her.

"Um... Tatuski?" he asked the girl next to him.

"Yeah?"

He had to think of an excuse to get away fast. "I, uh, have to go outside. For important reasons. Alone."

"What kind of reasons?" she questioned reluctantly.

"Personal alone reasons," he answered quickly. "I'll just copy your notes later, thiscan'twait. Bye!" He was already out of the bathroom, leaving Tatuski with a look of extreme confusion.

"Trevor Inoue, you are a strange case," she said to herself, brushing her friend's strange behavior as his regular behavior. She proceeded to head back to their classroom, noticing her Ichigo, Yasutora Sado, and Uryu Ishida rushing down the hall also. Either they all had to use the bathroom at the same time, or something fishy was brewing. This wasn't the first time they've all rushed out at the same time, though there was usually someone else who rushed out with them. Oh well, no time to ponder, she was too late anyway.
14532111111121111211111212211111111122.title: A strange pressence is felt

145321111111211112111112122111111111221.content:
Trevor arrived outside the school first, and was therefore the first to bare witness to what was giving off the strange energy. Spiritual energy! That was what he was feeling! Scary spiritual energy, too. Spiritual energy exactly like a...

"Hollow!" Trevor yelled at the giant monster in front of him. It looked kind of like a giant gecko but with a skull for a face and a sharp knife for a tail. Also, it was about 50 feet tall and had at least ten feet, unlike most geckos. Trevor could swear he'd seen other things like this, though not quite as large. He did a double take to the front entrance of the school, waiting for someone and ignoring the giant abomination in front of him.

'Man, where are they?', he thought to himself, not even knowing who they were.

"Hey, idiot!" the giant skull-gecko shouted at Trevor. "You can obviously see me, so why are you ignoring me?!"

Trevor looked back at the huge monstrosity with a calm look. "Sorrry, I'm just waiting for some of my friends to arrive. I'll get back to you then."

"What?!" it called out, aghast at the boy's unwavering attitude towards itself. "You're just going to wait? You're just going to ignore me?!"

"I'm not ignoring you. I just politely asked you to wait until I can attend to you. My friends will be here shortly, I promise."

"Why, you little...! Fine! I was hoping to eat the Soul Reaper I was smelling, but you look delictable enough. Time to say aww!"

The beast opened its gaping maw and charged towards Trevor. He quickly dodged out of the way, accidentally causing the Hollow to smack face first into the school.

At first, Trevor was a little frightened by the sudden charge, but then something dawned on him. "Wait, why would I say 'Aww'? You're the the one trying to eat me." His question wasn't much of a taunt, more of an actual case of curiosity.

"Shut up!" the gecko demanded while charging towards him again.

This time, Trevor didn't even flinch. He could sense the stronger spiritual pressure coming from above at a breakneck pace. And he saw the orange haired teenager with what looked like a giant kitchen knife stab the monster's back. He even felt butterflys in his stomach when he appeared. Ichigo Kurosaki was here, so Trevor was prepared to fight now.
145321111111211112111112122111111111221.title: Fight!

1453211111112111121111121221111111112211.content:
To call it a fight wasn't too accurate. It was more like curbstomp with the occasional hint of suspense. To tell the truth, the only reason the fight wasn't over already was because Ichigo didn't account for the Hollow to move before he could cut its mask off. Oh well, at least he got to skip some more of class.

While the orange haired teenager started slicing the out of control giant, Trevor just watched in awe. This boy, this Ichigo Kurosaki, was amazing! Somehow, he felt like he knew him longer than just today. Even weirder, he felt like Ichigo was more important to him than he could believe. Like they were good friends, but Trevor wanted to be something more.

Trevor simply watched as Ichigo sliced off the gecko's legs one by one, only getting wacked with its tail after the third one. He didn't dare worry, though. He knew Ichigo had it under control. Trevor just watched his hero get back up and start fighting again while cupping his chest in comfort.

... Strange. His chest felt oddly softer than usual. Actually, it felt kind of plushy. Oh well, it was nothing out of the ordinary.

Little did Trevor notice the strange thing he was feeling on his chest was his chest. Or, at least, were breasts growing on said chest. They continued to grow until they were big enough to cause most girls envy.

The Hollow gecko continued to scream from the removal of its fourth leg and glared at Trevor again.

"Well, maybe I won't be eating Soul Reaper today, but a spiritual human like you should do good anyway!" And with that, the monster lunged itself at Trevor with its mouth wide open and tongue lashed. Its target could only brace himself before noticing a bright light shine near his face. He knew what to do.
1453211111112111121111121221111111112211.title: Fight! Fight!

1453211111112111121111121221111111112211.content:
With those two words said, several tiny fairies were released from her hairpins, two to keep a shield up and another cutting the Hollow straight through the mask, causing it to dissipitate completely. Yeah, fairies and her. The summoning of the Shun Shun Rikka was enough to wipe away Trevor's young boyhood, the only thing remaining of his previous identity, completely, leaving only Orihime Inoue in the world.

(Orihime: http://cloud3.faout.com/uploads/201209/h... )

"I... did it," she muttered while retracting her fairies back into her hairpins, allowing her magic shield to retract. "I. DID. IT!" she repeated while jumping up and down in joy. "Defeated is the Hollow!"

Ichigo looked at the cheerful girl with a strange grin on his face. Orihime could be a little excitable and weird at times, but at least she meant well. He knew she couldn't possibly be dumb, since she was one of the school's top ranking students. Still, her out-there attitude did tend to surprise him at times. It was something you always got used to, but always noticed.

'Uh, Orihime?" Ichigo muttered while rubbing off any blood the monster must have left. "Why exactly are you so excited to kill the Hollow? Haven't you done this before?"

Orihime couldn't help but chuckle at her own pun. Besides, she did tend to get pretty talkative around Ichigo, but he didn't seem to mind. In fact, she could swear she saw him crack a smile at her joke.

"Well, good for you," he smiled back. "That was some quick thinking. I'm sorry if I couldn't protect you in time."

"Oh, don't worry about that, Ichigo-kun! I'm sorry that you didn't get to defeat the giant gecko monster like you wanted. I promise that the next time there's a giant gecko on the loose, whether Hollow or not, you can have it." All of this was said without a hint of irony, all genuine concern on Orihime's part.

"Okay then," Ichigo sweated off. "We should probably be getting back to class."

"Wait, where's Chad and Uryu?"

"They kind of got stopped by the hall moniter on the way out."

"How come you were able to get past?"

"Well, I had the advantage of having my Soul Candy handy, so she couldn't even see me in Soul Reaper form."

"So, Kon's in your body right now?"

"Yep." There was a slight pause. "Wait... Crap! We should probably hurry up now."

"Lead the way, Kurosaki-kun!" Orihime saluted before the two headed back to their classroom. Although it was brief, she still enjoyed her time alone with Ichigo.
