1552322.content: Is the family about to go on vacation now?
1552322.title: no

15523221.content:
Sometime after Nate's birthday, a break in the school semester finally came up. It was a relief for everyone to finally get away from the toils of work and school. Nate certainly appreciated it. The jar of candies were in his room right now, but he had yet to even touch them. Who knows why, but perhaps he felt like staying away from them.

Anyway, news came at dinner time.

"Hey everyone, I have an announcement," Mike got everyone's attention. "We've decided to spend the week out of town on vacation, and head to that resort we told you all about."

"Really?! Yay!" cried Trevor and Nicole, both clapping. Nate and Erin seemed happy too.

"Wow, that's awesome Dad!" said Erin.

"Very nice." said Nate, the most unenthusiastic one so far but it didn't matter.

"So, tomorrow we're going to pack up. We've got a plane to catch and it leaves tomorrow." said Lynda. "We wanted to keep the surprise so that's why we told you now."

"Alright, so pack up what you can tonight. We leave early tomorrow." said Mike.

"Okay!" said most of the kids.

Nate continued as normal that night, packing up a few things. However, his thoughts turned to the jar, and he felt like keeping them around. Well, he wasn't sure what to make of it, but the jar fit easily enough in his bag. Satisfied enough, he went to bed that way.

"Well, what's the worst that can happen." he said to himself.

*****The Next Day*****

The very next day, everyone was bright and early, so they were soon off to the airport. Nate quite liked flying, though he was always nervous on the way up and down. Some things you never get used to. Still, getting in was all well and good, and soon enough, the plane was in the air, heading towards their destination. The rest of the day seemed to whirl by on this Saturday, just a rush from their home to the hotel.
15523221.title: Yes, the whole family

155232211.content:
"Wow! Finally here, after that HUGE trip, we're finally here!" Erin laughed, admiring the view of the ocean vast and blue from the rather large window near one of the beds, all before she threw herself onto the large, fluff ball of a bed.

"Yeah! This is gonna be loads of fun!" Trevor cried, plopping himself onto the couch facing the bed on which his older sister, Erin, lay.

Nicole said nothing, but, simply let out a giggle before following her older sister, slamming onto the bed gigantic, snuggling onto one of the pillows.

Meanwhile, in the midst of this immense joy, this relief from lives dreary, there was a bitter aura between a certain patriarch and matriarch, that is, Mike and Lynda. Mike set down all the luggage he carried with Nate, all the while, Lynda shot her husband a stare furious.

Lynda, before proceeding, made sure Erin, Nicole and Trevor were all not listening. Sure enough, all three were fast asleep, completely knocked out by the trip. Nate, sensing the aura, and growing more and more anxious about it as time moved, was finally told by his mom to leave the room. Nate listened to his mom forthwith.

"I guess there really is no fury like a woman's scorn..." Nate thought as sat on the seat closest to the door, this way, he would be able to hear whatever his parents from the hallway, where they had been off to talk.

Nate pushed an ear against the door and listened to the muffled voices.

"Mike..." Lynda mumbled under her breath, clearly concealing anger.

"Lynda, please..." Mike started, fear in his voice. "... The family needed a vacation, you know we did..."

"But at what cost?!" Lynda scolded her husband as if he were a child. "How are we supposed to afford this? There is no way that we'll go through this without some financial loss! What were you thinking?!" Lynda cried.

Nate cringed in his seat. Even now, without even seeing this argument occur, he could see his mother furious, hands on her hips, shaking her head in disapproval, both mannerisms she took on as she scolded either Nate himself, or, his siblings. But, to his father? Impossible. He continued to listen.

"I was thinking I was making the right decision. I was thinking that we'd pay for it all now, and, we'd worry about the expenses later, it's not about the money, anyway. I was thinking about the kids... I was thinking about... Well... You and I.." Mike continued, emotion in his voice like he'd never heard.

Even now, Nate imagined the scene in his head. His dad was leaning in for a hug of some sort of forgiveness... That's when he heard the voice of his mother make itself known.

"You get away from me!!" Lynda took a step back from Mike. "If you were thinking about us, you should've thought about our financial well being!" Lynda cried.

Right about now, Nate imagined the argument ending. Quickly, he pulled his ear from the door and sat by, fiddling with the jar of candies he held. And, just as his mind foretold, in stomped his mother, not even passing onto her son so much as a look. Straight off to the restroom Lynda went.

Nate, shocked, looked to the hallway, where the argument took place. There stood his dad, a blank, defeated look about him. No words, no emotion, only defeat. Suddenly, without warning, the look of defeat became that of fury.

"She never appreciates what I do for us, for her!" He looked directly to Nate, Nate cringed slightly, scared stiff.

"Nate, get whatever you need, you and I could use a vacation from this vacation." Mike firmly insisted.

With a gulp and a deep breath, Nate mustered the courage to ask... "W-Where are we heading to?" Nate grabbed the candies and followed his father out the door and into the hall, closing the door behind him.

Mike stopped, looked to Nate, and answered simply...
155232211.title: Settling in

1552322111.content:
"...The mall next to the hotel." Mike said, as if leaving no other option on the table.

"Are you sure, Dad?" Nate asked his father. "You usually don't like going to the mall."

"Well, it's the best place to be to get some privacy," Mike barked back before calming down a bit. "I'm sorry Nate....I just want some time away from your mother for a bit."

"It's okay." Nate quickly forgave his dad. Things had been rough all of a sudden. Truth be told, neither extreme was totally right. The family expenses weren't too bad, not to Lynda's extreme anyway. However, there was truth in how things had been rough as of late to the point where the family did have to be a little more judicious with their expenses. Mike thought that the vacation would help the family get away from the doom and gloom of it all, while Lynda was more uptight about it. Nate had seen it before, though not to the extreme he just witnessed.

"Come on." Mike said as he began walking down the hallway. Nate looked over his clothing one more time, just to make sure since he didn't want to look out of place. He wore his typical light blue shirt, tan cargo shorts, and socks and shoes. All normal stuff. With that in mind, he began walking to keep up with Mike. Who knew where this would lead, but Nate hoped that the vacation would work out in the end.

Still, he could only wonder how a trip to the mall would help. Mike was never fond of the mall, though maybe it was the right chance to at least clear his head. Nate followed Mike through the hotel until they reached the bottom floor. It was at that time that Mike noticed Nate's jar. He recognized it as something Nate got for his birthday, but not much else.

"Um, Nate...if it's not too much trouble..would you mind sharing one of your candy treats there with me?" Mike asked his son. Neither one knew what they could really do, so Nate saw no problem.

"Sure Dad, I don't mind." Nate smiled as he allowed his dad to have one of them, popping it into his mouth immediately. It had a nice sweet taste to it.

"Thank you." Mike said with a smile as they continued to walk after that. As they did, Mike kept talking to himself. "Lynda just doesn't understand, and I don't think she ever will....Honestly...I wish I had a wife who did understand..."

No one but him heard that, but no one needed too. Everything was set in motion after that.

*****Back in the hotel*****

Back in the hotel however, Lynda had come out of the restroom briefly to check on something. However, she spotted something near where she rushed by Nate. There was one candy on the ground. Normally, such a thing on the ground wouldn't entice anyone. However, these were no ordinary candies, and Lynda found herself picking it up, eating it before she could think otherwise, her thoughts coming out. Her thoughts ranged from many things, from Mike's vacation idea to Nate's own withdrawn personality. Honestly, Nate didn't have too many friends. If not for Mike borrowing him, he'd probably just be sitting in here doing nothing.

"Of all people, Nate really needs a mindset change, especially if he can't see what's wrong here. I wish Nate would become a lot more open, then perhaps I might actually be able to converse with him."

With that, two wishes were made in a short time, and they both had their sights set on the unsuspecting Nate Wilson.

All he did was feel a slight chill as he and Mike left the hotel.
1552322111.title: "...The mall next to the hotel."

15523221111.content:
As the two walked on, the ominous chill about Nate subsided, dying as the front doors to their hotel flew open, the breeze cooling both Nate and Mike. The sun shone bright, the wind was cool, the atmosphere as vibrant as the sun, the hustle and bustle of the resort ever present.

"Wow!" Mike exclaimed, presenting himself with a demeanor too far from his flaming hot anger. "What a day, eh, son?" Mike inquired, continuing the hike to the conveniently close shopping mall, which, as far as Nate could see, was a generally neat looking mall, decorated with all sorts of greenery on the outside, and extending as far as four stories. Though, surprisingly enough, for such a high mall, with such a vacation-esque atmosphere, the mall appeared small.

As Nate noted all the people passing by, the couples of men and women young and old strolling along the beach, mothers and fathers with children young, groups of teens and adults hanging around in clusters... As a group of women, all bikini-clad, swayed past Nate, gaining Nate's eyes like a magnet, Nate noticed something. Staring at these women, he didn't necessarily feel... Attraction, as he normally would. All he saw were women in their swimsuits.

"Sure is." Nate agreed, handing his father a polite smile.

"Y'know, son, I feel like you're the only one I can talk to sometimes..." Mike confessed, as the two went through the revolving doors leading into the mall, which was certainly far bigger than the outside may have insisted.

Nate offered a light blush, feeling his cheeks redden slightly. "Really?" He asked.

"Yeah... I mean... Your sisters are wonderful and all, and, your younger brother is definitely a blast, but... You're my oldest son. I feel like I can connect with you the most..." Mike sighed.

This statement Nate found to be strange, very strange. Was he being compared to Erin? To Nicole? To Trevor? Was he the favorite? Surely this wasn't right...

"Are you saying you play favorites?" Nate accusingly uttered, as he did, his height slightly fell to 5'5".

"Ugh... No." Mike answered firmly. "I'm just saying... You're like a friend. I can talk to you, is what I'm saying..."

As strange as it was, for one reason or another, Nate felt awkwardly flattered, his words... Touched him, made him feel special. Seriously, Nate couldn't emphasize, iterate enough how strange this conversation was, how strange it was getting. These words sounded as if they should've been written on some cheesy card from a husband to a wife, or, vice versa. But, despite the peculiarity, he continued...

"Thanks." Nate smiled, genuinely. "I guess I can talk to you, also." Nate smiled as the short hair he called his own grew a shade or two lighter and an inch or two longer, both changes notable only to the deeply focused eye.

"Good to hear!" Mike bellowed. "Now, what should we do now that we're here? You know I'm not one for the mall, so, why don't you decide?"

Nate looked around at the plethora of options at his disposal, putting a hand to the chin as he did, not noticing the softer touch, the softer skin that spread about all of him. The mall was crowded, swarmed, even. People here, people there... There was hardly enough room for someone to hear their own thoughts... But, in the end, after but the quickest moment of thought, Nate decided on...
15523221111.title: Walking to the mall

155232211112.content:
"The food court sounds good." Nate said quickly, making Mike chuckle a bit.

"Really? You came up with that quickly." Mike said.

"Well, it's about midday so it's a good time for lunch....besides that would leave the whole afternoon for shopping." That last part came a little bit late for Nate, kind of making him wonder why he said that. That wasn't exactly something he looked forward to, though it didn't sound too bad right now.

"Well, I'll go with whatever you want." Mike smiled, which seemed to make Nate feel a little bit better. It was nice getting to talk to Mike like this, without Erin and the others to interfere. Nice and quiet time....well as much as you can have inside a mall.

It was with that settled that they began their walk through the mall. Overall, the scenery was rather nice, making Nate curious as to what else was there to see. The place was well air-conditioned as well, and he could even feel the cooled air on his softer skin. Frankly, he wondered why that was, though maybe it was just the new humidity or something. Probably best to just leave it be for now and just get adjusted. They kept on walking for a bit, looking at a map along the way to see where the court was.

"So...." Nate began as they walked. "Um...why can't you talk to Lyn...I mean Mom about this?

Mike seemed to think about that for a bit, sighing as he did. "It just....I don't know but it seems like there's a disconnect between us now and I don't know what to do about it. Actually, I don't know if I really want to talk about it."

"Sorry." Nate replied.

That was actually all that happened as they approached the court. There were many little restaurants, but they settled on the local Chick Fill'A. Mike got what he usually got, which made Nate smile a bit at how much he could eat while still being very fit. However, he kind of began to wonder himself. His stomach felt a bit.....what was the word....flatter. A hand went to that spot underneath his light blue shirt, feeling a little bit less than normal. He went with the smaller chicken sandwich, kind of similar to what Lynda got at times actually.

They got a spot rather quickly, thanks to it not being too busy. When Nate sat down, he actually briefly crossed his legs before correcting them. It felt a little odd for a second, but he just let it go for now. Still, in addition to that, he didn't see his height go down to about 5'4, where it seemed to stay.

"I will say though Nate....you are more pleasant to talk to." Mike said as he ate. "At the very least, I feel like I can tell you more than I tell Lynda."

"That's....very nice." Nate didn't know, but he felt a tiny bit shy about the attention, though it felt really good. He had to admit, Mike was quite the man. Maybe even more than just a father, but that train of thought felt more confusing to Nate. He actually gently curled his hair a bit as they talked, said hair actually getting a bit longer as he did, growing down to at least past his ears and to his neck. His former shade of brown was really fading too, closer to a much lighter color now. Between that and what seemed to be a thinning waist, Nate wasn't sure what to think of it.
155232211112.title: Off to the food court.

choices: ... Notices a clothes store from behind Mike that he simply must visit.
1552322111121.content:
"Ah!" Mike let out a sigh of satisfaction as he finished up his meal, throwing a napkin to what would be the trash. He took a sip of the soda before him and leaned back, nearly falling, igniting a delicate laugh from Nate, which, again, went unnoticed by either of them.

Mike shook the cup in his hand. Nothing. "Only ice." He sighed. "Looks like I'm going to be needing a refill... You need a drink, too?" Mike inquired, getting to his feet. Nate looked into his cup and, like his father, found nothing.

"Yes, please." He politely accepted his offer.

"Another diet coke?" Mike asked.

"Actually..." Nate thought for a moment, suddenly feeling a desire for lemonade, a drink that had never really peaked his interest, even in the slightest, until now. "... Just a lemonade, I guess." Nate handed Mike his cup.

"You got it!" Mike exclaimed, taking their cups and heading off for refills.

"What a gentleman..." Nate thought to himself, a small smile spreading across his face. As Mike stood there, at the counter, Nate couldn't help but notice Mike's body, a fit, strong, toned body. Nate giggled at the sight of it, immediately stopping himself, confused at the thoughts of his Father's body, his kindness... He dismissed these thoughts immediately as the man approached the table.

"Here we go! One lemonade!" Mike held the filled cup out to Nate. Nate blushed before taking the cup from his hands. "Thanks..."

"I guess I should get the trash, too." Mike insisted, grabbing the tray an dreading off to dispose of it. As he went off, Nate felt an itch about his right leg... As he lowered himself to tend to this itch, he failed to notice the shrinking muscle tone once his, the absence of hair... No, even as he continued to lower himself, the absence of his socks didn't even manage to capture his attention. He just scratched the itch on his skin smooth, and got to his feet as Mike again neared him, this time, standing there, waiting for Nate to rise.

"So, we ready?" Mike asked.

"Sure!" Nate smiled, getting to his feet as his hair elongated, brushing his shoulders as it did, ceasing for the moment. Finally, the duo left the restaurant, Nate swayed his hips slightly as they did. And, did his shorts feel softer? Much softer than the usual roughness the shorts had against his legs? His shirt? Was this also getting a bit tighter? All these thoughts he dismissed as Mike spoke.

"Where do you want to head now, Nate?" Mike inquired, looking down to Nate.

Nate sipped his lemonade followed by a look to Mike. "I don't know." Nate answered, his pitch surely the slightest bit higher. "I feel as if there are so many options here. There are four floors of all this, after all... How about, for now, we just walk and talk, talk and walk, like we've been doing?"

Mike heartily laughed. "Whatever you say!"

As the two continued, the shorts Nate wore certainly developed a particular lightness and flow about themselves... But, this, too, went dismissed for coincidence.

"Y'know..." Mike began.

"What?" Nate replied.

"I know we've only just gotten here, I know we came here with family... But, I feel like, through all this, all I need is you." Mike smiled.

At first, as he did earlier, Nate was filled with a sort of apprehension, with the way Mike so readily dismissed Erin, Nicole, Trevor, even Lynda, whom Nate now saw as Lynda rather than Mom. But, for some reason, this apprehension flew, and, Nate just came to accept this flattery, embracing this warm, fuzzy sensation.

"Well, aren't you sweet!" Nate's voice continued to rise as features softened up, as his nose became more button-like, as muscle mass almost died completely.

Nate, just as he was about to embrace Mike, was caught off guard...

"OHMYGOSH!" Nate exclaimed.

"What, what is it?" Mike asked, concerned, given the panicked tone.

Nate...
1552322111121.title: Finished with lunch

15523221111211.content:
"Sorry, but I really need to use the restroom!" Nate said immediately. That exclaim was probably louder than it needed to be, but Mike just smiled all the same.

"All right, go and get that done. I'll wait here."

"Thank you." smiled Nate as he rushed off a bit.

For some reason, Nate really felt like he couldn't hold it in anymore, though he usually was good about waiting to use the restroom. Well, apparently he couldn't know. He didn't even really notice how he just ran in his new skirt. Yeah, that new feeling of flow he had was due to the tan shorts become a nice and free skirt of the same color. Of course, that meant his wallet wasn't there anymore due to the lack of pockets, but he wasn't concerned with that right now. He ran up to where the restrooms where and ended up having a brief moment of wondering where to go exactly.

"Where to go......" He mumbled before just running into the ladies room. Thankfully, it was empty right now. "Oh, that's good."

Nate walked over to one of the stalls, locking it behind him. He looked down and pulled down his new skirt, not really sparing a thought for why he was wearing one now, though a thought did come that it was a good idea to wear it to such a warm place. As he did, he pulled down his white underwear as he sat down. However, as he did that, the material of the underwear began softening, changing shape slightly.

Anyway, Nate didn't even look down as he did his business, instead thinking about what had been happening as of late. Mike....he was being such a gentleman. Why hadn't he seen this before? Perhaps it was something he just hadn't paid attention to in the past. Perhaps it was time to start taking that into account. I mean, he even valued Nate above Erin and everyone else. That had to speak for something. He smiled contently at that, even though he started feeling a tiny bit of extra padding in his behind. He didn't really care though and finished up, even using the toilet paper to make sure. Once he was done, he pulled everything, including his new and softer panties up to his smaller waist, along with the skirt.

Content, Nate walked out and washed his hands. However, he looked up at the mirror for a brief moment. Still, it ended up catching his attention. He didn't see a teenage boy's face, but rather that of a woman, a very beautiful one at that with long blonde hair. The mirror only showed up to his chest, which Nate could make out large breasts beneath a light blue top. He looked down at himself, seeing himself still the same. Though, for some reason, he liked that image in the mirror. That woman was beautiful, and the kind of woman Mike would love.

"Wait, where did that thought....." Nate wondered as he was finished and began to walk out of the restroom. As he did, another person passed by.

"Oh, excuse me ma'am." he said.

"Oh sorry." Nate smiled a bit as he got out of the way, not unnerved by what he was just called. Anyway, feeling relieved, Nate began to walk back. However, as he did, he had to use a soft hand to comb his hair out of his face. It had grown longer, down to his waist now in long, blonde strands of hair. Though, it didn't seem to bug him. Mike liked long hair right? Well, his opinion seemed to matter more anyway. His hips still swayed gracefully in the skirt, with them now being a little bigger now.

"Mike!" Nate called as he approached Mike, who smiled.

"Hello, all done?" asked Mike as he handed Nate back his lemonade.

"Yes, thank you." smiled Nate. This feeling of comfort was almost beginning to overwhelm Nate, but it wasn't a bad feeling.
15523221111211.title: ...Has to use the restroom.

choices: Nate and Mike decide to continue strolling the mall...
Nate and Mike decide to stop at a store of Mike's interest...
155232211112111.content:
"Anyway, I..." Nate started, as if about to ignite conversation, but, something caught his attention. He fixed his long, mane of hair, adjusted the skirt and beheld a sight.

"Yes, Nate?" Mike asked.

"Would it be okay if we... Made a stop here?" Nate stepped up to the display window of a clothing store primarily aimed at the womanly demographic, he stared in awe at the mannequins before him, admiring the dresses, skirts and blouses each gracefully donned. In his mind, seemingly did he imagine himself wearing each, wondering if Mike would enjoy him in these things.

Mike let out a hearty laugh. "Sure, why not?"

"Great!" Nate giggled, adjusting the shirt he wore, not noticing the softer texture about it, also failing to recall that surely the sleeves were shrinking... Was the shirt a bit tighter? No matter the answer, Nate continued. "After all this time we've been together, I know how much you hate these things... So, i'll be quick!" Nate laughed, unsure of what he meant by 'all the time we've been together,' but, these words naturally came.

"No! Please, take your time!" Mike insisted, despite his reluctance, following Nate in.

Nate wasted no time waiting for Mike and skipped on in, with a lighter step, surely. As he did, the sleeves of his shirt were definitely departed, and, the male collar, too, was gone, beginning to widen and leave the upper chest more viewable. The place felt like a candy store to him, all these clothes, all these departments and rows and columns of clothes, all at his disposal, at his leisure. Mike playfully rolled his eyes and followed Nate, giving his rear end a stare, he, too failing to notice his hips and butt widen and become more defined.

"Ooh!" Nate cooed in pleasure as he noticed a small, tight, club-type dress, black in color. As he did, his voice continued to elevate, sounding more like a young girl than a teen boy.

"What do you think of this one, Mike?" Nate playfully asked, waving the dress from its hanger to the man, who smiled offered a whistle and continued.

"I like that one. Alot."

Nate let out a giggle. "He's so cute..." He thought to himself. "And... It's just my size!" Nate examined the dress. "I'll take it! Maybe I can wear it, and, you and I can go dancing tonight..." Nate winked as the girly voice of his matured, sounding more like a young woman as his Adam's apple faded.

"I like that idea!" Mike complied as Nate decided on purchasing the dress. Next, Nate noticed a cosmetics section, even including employees handing out samples of certain products. Nate had never been the kind for makeup, but, it felt right. He smiled and walked over.

"Yes, can I have a sample of this particular lipstick?" Nate requested as his soft, gentle, yet, mature voice continued to age.

"Of course, Ma'am." Smiled the employee as she handed Nate a sampling of a light red, almost pink colored lipstick, which Nate applied gracefully to his lips, as if he were a seasoned pro. As he did apply the lipstick, sure enough did his lips become more defined, slightly more plump and certainly becoming a certain softness and shape that any man would love to kiss. Nate looked into the mirror and smiled in content.

"Looks like i'll be taking that, too!" His voice finally settling on the voice of a 36 year old woman, gentle, sweet, kind, yet, still young and fun.

As he proceeded, facial features rearranged... Cheek bones lifted, skin smoothed, eye lashes lengthened... All as he tried on various cosmetics, eventually, coming to decide to purchase them all. Two mounds from his chest bubbled slightly as he approached Mike, having already purchased the dress, the makeup, and all such things.

"Wow, looks like someone went all out!" Mike grinned.

"Of course!" Nate agreed in his new voice. "We are on vacation, aren't we?"
155232211112111.title: Nate spots a clothing shop

1552322111121112.content:
Nate smiled as they left the clothing store, with the bag in his arms full of what he bought. It seemed a bit spur of the moment, but he really liked what he saw. Heck, even that thought of going dancing with Mike....the thought left a small blush on his soft cheeks.

"Okay, I've had my fun. So you should have yours now." Nate said.

"That sounds good to me." Mike replied.

The two of them began walking in the other direction, ending up back at the map where Mike could look at the options. Nate smiled at how things had been going so far. He and Mike seemed to be getting ever closer. Technically, they were kind of close before, but....as time was going on, Mike seemed to be someone incredibly important to Nate. Though, he couldn't help but feel like he knew Mike in a different way. He had known him since he was born right? His mind didn't seem too sure.

"Ah, here we go." said Mike, pointing it out to Nate. He smiled and agreed to let Mike have his fun.

So, the two of them went up a floor to where Mike specified. Nate finished his lemonade as they did, throwing it away in the process. Nate's limbs were all pretty different now, nice and smooth. His legs constantly brushed against each other underneath his skirt, but that felt totally natural now. In addition, the laces were vanishing on his shoes, with the tongue disappearing as the material stiffened. As they approached their destination, a pair of nice black flats adorned Nate's feet, perfectly going with his clothing.

Anyway, as Nate predicted, Mike had chosen a sporty-type store. Nate smiled at that, since Mike was really into that stuff like most men. Then again, he didn't dislike it himself. Heck, if he recalled correctly, Mike even got him a small jersey in his size some time ago. So, with that in mind, they entered the shop, which wasn't too busy at the time.

"Wow, they got a bit of everything here." Mike was rather surprised at the variety.

"Well, take what you want. That's what I did." Nate said in return.

"True."

As Mike began looking though, Nate couldn't help but feel some eyes on him. He briefly glanced around, noticing that some men had given him some looks. In spite of that, he smiled that they thought he was good looking enough to stare at. The skirt flowed around his nice hips and butt well. Also, the top, with a wide neckline, showed a good amount of chest too.

Speaking of which, as Nate actually looked around himself, his breasts continued to push against his top, steadily growing ever larger. It was an A cup to start, followed quickly by a B cup. Then it was a C cup, before they gently stopped at about a large CC cup size. Nate felt a little omph as they stopped, but felt nice when he looked down, seeing his womanly assets. In all the ruckus, he could see a white bra that had formed underneath the top, completing the clothing look. He smiled at that, as if not surprised.

"Sir, I'll take this."

Nate heard Mike purchasing something, which was totally fine. He glanced around a bit more, seeing a couple more looks. All the same, he smiled a but, but it didn't feel as good as when Mike looked at him.

"Well, I'm satisfied. Shall we go?" smiled Mike.

"Yes, we shall." said Nate.
1552322111121112.title: Nate and Mike decide to stop at a store of Mike...

15523221111211121.content:
Nate strolled happily in his outfit that ever so gracefully hugged his body; The khaki skirt swayed as he walked emphasizing the hips and butt, the tank top he donned made known each every inch of the figure now of an hourglass, leaving what was just the right amount of cleavage exposed to the public. The long, dirty blonde mane of hair he effortlessly brushed away from his face, smiling as he did. He looked to Mike, Mike looked to him, a certain air between the duo. An air of deep admiration, almost like being in love.

"Now I remember why I don't like the mall..." Mike sighed, still retaining a smile about him.

"Why's that?" Nate asked, his face continuing to soften, finishing the feminization process about the face. The nose was softer, the eyes offered a softer look, the face left smooth and flawless.

"My wallet hurts..." Mike laughed, Nate entered with a soft giggle, his laugh sending Mike flying.

"I hope you don't mean that... It was never about the money, even though money is a nice little thing." Nate smiled.

"Yeah..." Mike agreed, as the two neared a simple wooden bench perched in front of a palm tree that seemed to loom into infinity. Mike politely gestured that Nate sit first.

"What a gentleman!" Nate happily squealed in his voice womanly, followed by a soft blush about his cheeks as he held the skirt against her skin as he sat. Mike followed and sat next to him, wrapping an arm around his long, smooth neck, making Nate feel as secure as can be.

"It's not about the money, you're right..." Mike said, handing Nate a purse, his purse, which had formed from the aforementioned missing wallet.

"My purse!" Nate cried joyously, recalling that this was indeed his purse, a purse Mike had purchased for him quite some time ago, on an evening out about the town back home... Nate couldn't recall details, but, the more he thought, the more the fog cleared itself. Meanwhile, the small bulge slightly visible from Nate's skirt shrank and faded within seconds.

Mike continued, "...It's about only two people... Us." Mike smiled. "Just you and I, Stephanie!" Mike proceeded.

"STEPHANIE?!" Nate asked himself in apprehension into he back of his mind. Protest and fear rioted through his mind for only a fraction of a second as this anxiety faded along with the foggy memory. Suddenly, he was a she. A strange feeling surrounded the ring finger on her right hand, yes, this was the formation of a simple wedding ring, silver colored with a small diamond on the center. With the sight of the ring, it all made sense to her.

Stephanie suddenly sounded familiar... Yes, Stephanie Booker, well, at least until she married Mike, then she became Stephanie Wilson. He proposed after both had graduated form college together, at a graduation party filled with both their family and friends. Stephanie wasted no time in accepting the proposal, becoming his wife in no time. The purse, too, made sense, he bought for her on their first date in their freshman year during college.

It all made sense. As he leaned in to kiss her, her to him, time froze. She looked him in the eyes and observed the reflection.

The woman in the mirror.

"Mike!" Stephanie cried, meeting him in the middle, each offering the other a simple peck on the lips, nothing more, nothing less, the passion for each other seemingly immeasurable.

"So, hack to the hotel?" Mike asked, happy as can be.

"Right!" Stephanie chirped, getting to her feet, brushing off her skirt, softly grasping Mike's hand as the two walked off.
15523221111211121.title: Sitting at a bench outside

155232211112111211.content:
The "new" husband and wife continued walking towards the hotel, back to their own room. Stephanie's hand never left Mike's, since she liked it there so much. The candies from before were still in her purse. Still, those were far from her mind as she lovingly looked at her husband.

"Hey, remember how Lynda said that she was coming with her kids? Maybe we should go meet them now." she suggested.

"What if they're not done unpacking?" Mike asked.

"Oh, Lynda will be fine with it. Nothing to worry." Stephanie smiled. Lynda Butler was her old friend. She had come here with her own kids. Three of them actually, to which Stephanie kind of wondered how she handled on her own. Well, it was a touchy subject so Stephanie didn't even think of it. Eventually, they entered their hotel again, and Stephanie remembered where Lynda was staying. Going up to what used to be the floor for all of them, Stephanie knocked gently on the door, revealing Lynda on the other side.

"Hey Lyn!"

"Hello Stephanie!" The two women greeted each other. They had known each other since elementary school after all. Mike and Lynda were civil towards each other though, though Lynda seemed to think that Mike should treat his families' money better. Stephanie would always assure her that they were good. Stephanie's job paid very well.

"So where's the kids?" asked Stephanie.

"They're around. Trevor can't stay in one place for too long." Lynda smiled as she let them in. Nicole was playing with her dolly as she usually did. Erin was listening to music, and Trevor was flying around. The adults smiled at the kids as they began to talk. As they did, Stephanie brought up how she got a new dress to go dancing tonight and decided to offer to Lynda for her to come as well with the kids.

"Sure, it sounds fine." smiled Lynda.

"Perfect!" said Stephanie happily. This was turning out well so far.

Although, things weren't all good. Perhaps Nicole was too young to understand, but Erin and Trevor felt a bit odd. Something didn't feel right. They knew Lynda was their mother, but seeing Mike and Stephanie felt odd to them, like Mike was supposed to be their dad or something. Nothing seemed to make sense to them.

Well, perhaps they would do something later.
155232211112111211.title: Back to the Hotel

1552322111121112111.content:
"Do I have to go out all formal like this?" Erin whined, gesturing to the dress she wore, a maroon colored, sleeveless dress that went down slightly above the knees, a pair of heels and all out together by a small black belt, her hair in a bun.

"Yeah, I feel like this is overdoing it..." Trevor adjusted the slacks and buttoned up shirt about him, as it felt a bit too loose.

Lynda smiled and rolled her eyes, fixing her hair into a ponytail. "Oh, c'mon! It's just one night, besides Stephanie and Mike were kind enough to invite us out with them, when, really they didn't have to! The leastww we can do is look half-presentable... Besides, look, Erin!" Lynda chirped. "We're twins!" Lynda struck a pose in her dress, one identical to that which her daughter wore, heels identical, too.

"There is such a thing as too presentable..." Erin sighed.

"Well, I like it!" Nicole smiled in her small evening dress of blue.

"That's the spirit, Nicole!" Lynda laughed. "Now, c'mon, look happy!" Lynda opened the door to the restaurant, an eatery on one side, a bar on the other and a dance floor in the center, all complete with lighting atmospheric.

"Table for how many?" an employee asked for the front counter.

"Oh, we're here looking for someone..." Lynda scanned the room. "Oh! There they are!" Lynda waved to Mike and Stephanie. "They're friends of ours." Lynda justified as she and her kids made their way towards Stephanie and Mike. Though, as they got closer, it seemed that both occupied a two person table.

"Hey, Lynda!" Stephanie called as Mike politely waved to her and the kids. Lynda looked to the two person table, then back to Stephanie.

"Oh, this. It's all they had, but, we managed to save you guys a table somewhat close to ours." Stephanie pointed to a booth at least 2 or 3 families/ tables away from the couple.

"Oh, no, it's fine, it wasn't anyone's fault." Lynda said.

"But, don't worry! When the place gets less full, we can always take a bigger table and mingle then!"

"OK..." Lynda sighed, leading her kids to the booth saved for them.

Nicole slid in the booth seating, Lynda following. Erin slid into the seat across form her mother and sister, her brother sitting at the edge. As Lynda and Nicole began speaking, both Trevor and Erin looked suspiciously to Stephanie and Mike.

"Something seems weird about those two..." Erin noted.

"Yeah, I feel like I... know them? Both of them. I'm just not sure how." Trevor sighed.

"And it's kind of weird that they don't feel the same way." Erin poked her brother and gestured to Lynda and Nicole.

"I know!" Trevor agreed, fixing his getup. "It looks like it's just you and I sis..." Trevor looked to Erin and smiled, she returned it. He always felt that the strongest relationship among the siblings was between he and Erin. She felt the same way.

"Candy?" Trevor pulled a small handful of candies out of his pocket and offered one to Erin.

"Where did you get those?" Erin inquired.

"Found them in a jar at the hotel room earlier. I took a few cause I didn't think i'd like the food here..." Both Erin and Trevor laughed.

"Sure!" Erin took two candies, putting one in her purse, and, the other, on the table in front of her.

Trevor smiled and put one in his mouth, the other one on the table. He and Erin continued to stare down Stephanie and Mike as Trevor sucked on his candy.

"I don't know..." Trevor began. "I just wish I could get closer to them. Maybe they're talking about something that'll help us out." Trevor justified. As he wished, a strange, dull feeling went about his spine, causing him to sit up straight.

"You Ok?" Erin asked, noticing her brother's strange actions.

"Yeah." He answered, his height elevating an inch or two. "I think I just need to go to the restroom..." He got to his feet and walked off, Erin handing him a peculiar look.

Trevor rubbed his back and continued walking along, as he walked on, he suddenly found himself in front of...
1552322111121112111.title: That Night

15523221111211121111.content:
Trevor soon found himself in front of the restrooms. Not even really caring, he rushed into the men's room, finding himself a stall as he liked to sit down. Though, as he did enter, he felt like he really needed to sit down for some reason.

"Oh well. I like sitting down anyways."

That being said, he kind of took his time as he sat there thinking. Trevor, being the kid he was, usually didn't dwell on things, but he felt really odd right now. In fact, ever since he ate the candy, he felt odd. Then again, it had to be coincidence right? Surely, those candies weren't magical or anything. Still, Trevor couldn't quite dismiss the thought.

However, as he sat, he even felt a little queasy in his stomach. He clenched it a bit in discomfort, hoping that maybe it was just gas or something. Something really felt off in his spine too, like.....well he couldn't really describe it. It was like his spine was trying to stretch out or something, and his stomach was feeling flatter and flatter the more time went on.

"Oh....I don't feel so good...." he moaned.

He pulled his dress shirt up a bit, seeing his small waist remain small. He felt a little jolt in his lower back for a second, almost forcing it forward a bit as it made his back arch. He had no idea that he was already beginning to surpass 4'6 feet tall, hardly looking like the kid he was before. His limbs still seemed nice and small, though he had the feeling that he felt...softer somehow.

"This almost feels like Erin...." he said absentmindedly.

Eventually though, the discomfort subsided, allowing him to sit up straight and finish his work. He was actually sweating a bit, causing him to wipe his forehead. As he did though, he felt as if his bangs were more noticeable now. In fact, his whole head seemed a little shaggier. Well, after catching his breath, he stood up and flushed. He pulled his underwear back up, but he didn't notice something else. His underwear had softened, with even a couple bows on the sides and no opening in the front. Still, he pulled the fresh pair of panties up to his groin.

"Huh...when did my underwear feel this nice?"

Well, even with all those questions in his head, he exited the stall and washed his hands. Something in his head told him that he needed to be clean now, though he didn't know why. No one else came into the bathroom thankfully. He didn't want to explain to anyone what was going on. Maybe Erin would have some idea? Well, that was on his mind as he left the bathroom.

However, he wouldn't be going back to his table.
15523221111211121111.title: ...The restrooms.

155232211112112.content:
After handing Nate his lemonade, Mike next handed Nate his purse. Nate took it, knowing that it had his wallet with all his ID inside along with his keys, makeup and other knick-knacks which included his candies of course. Along with his appearance, his ID was also changing. The picture on his school ID had his new picture on it along with his new stats such as height, weight and hair color. He slung the purse over his shoulder. With its long strap crossing his body, the purse fell to his narrowing waist.

His right arm was bent at the elbow to hold his lemonade. Now with his purse over his shoulder it was perfectly natural for him to bend the other arm at the elbow too. His hand comfortably hung limply from his wrist as the bones in his wrist became smaller and more refined.

"You know Mike, I like walking with you," Nate said and he meant it. Of course even before all this started he had enjoyed his dad's company so it wasn't anything special for Nate to say it.

"Nat I like walking with you to," Mike said not realizing the slight change in Nate's name. Inside his purse Nate's ID proclaimed his name was now Natalie. It was also shifting from a school ID to an ID that was carried by people older than his previous fifteen years.

"We should do it more often," Nate said and gave Mike a quick peck on the cheek to establish their closeness. Nate thought that if he wasn't carrying his lemonade that he would get closer to Mike let him support him as they walked the halls of the mall. But since he was carrying the lemonade and it was a public place in the middle of the afternoon that probably wasn't a good idea.

"Yes, we should. We shouldn't argue anymore either. You know I don't even remember what we were arguing about." As the relationship between Mike and Nate changed the argument that Lynda and Mike had had was being attributed to Nate and Mike instead.

"It was something silly. No need to go into it. Just say your sorry and I can forget it too." Nate was now walking with the graceful gate of an adult woman. His shoes had even changed to flats that matched the rest of his outfit. The shoes were much more comfortable than a few seconds ago since his shoes now were designed to be worn without socks. His socks had vanished without Nate noticing before he had entered the bathroom.

"I'm...." said Mike.
155232211112112.title: Walking and Talking

1552322111121121.content:
"I'm.....sorry." Mike said, his head down a little bit. That seemed to be all Nate needed to hear as he smiled.

"Apology accepted." He said as he gave Mike another little peck on the check, both of them smiling. "We had both forgotten what it was about anyway."

"Well, all the same, how about I buy you something to make up for it?" offered Mike.

"Well, as long as you're offering..." Nate smiled again.

"Okay okay, I get where this is going." Mike shook his head. "So, where would you like to go?"

"Hmm...." Nate thought for a second, looking around for a bit. There were many shops to choose from. However, his thoughts soon landed on that clothing shop just a little walk away.

"How about that clothing shop over there?" Nate pointed.

"Okay." said Mike, though Nate could tell that he wasn't too thrilled about it. Still, he seemed to be willing to bear it for him, which was rather sweet in itself. The two of them began walking towards the shop, with Nate throwing his lemonade cup away once he was done with it. Overall, his body size was so much different, almost completely like a woman, not too different from what he saw in the mirror.

Though, as he walked, his top seemed to feel a little tighter as they did. The neckline was widening a bit, showing a little bit of his torso, though there were no breasts there yet. Part of Nate hoped that it would change, much like the mirror reflection showed him. The rest of his clothes were quite fitting so far. His new hips and butt felt nice in the new skirt, though Nate kept those thoughts to himself.

"Okay, here we are." said Mike as they walked in. It was mostly women's wear in the store, which seemed to be perfect for Nate.

"Wow, there's so much!" Nate nearly cried.

"Well, you gotta pick something." said Mike.

"Okay, how about I meet you in a bit. I want to look around." said Nate. Mike seemed to agree, looking at the section more towards men. That left Nate on his own to explore.
1552322111121121.title: Mike says he is sorry

choices: Nate kisses MIke on the lips
Nate and Mike walk hand in hand
15523221111211212.content:
Nate looked around the store. There was so many pretty things but he didn't want to be a pig about it. Mike was being nice in apologizing to him the least he could do was select something modest. Besides he had brought plenty of clothing on the vacation. In actually Lynda had packed his suitcase with the usual stuff a teen boy would need, mostly jeans and T-shirts. But since the wishes that isn't how he remembered it. Nate now remembered packing not only his suitcase but one for Mike and the children too. Except for Erin who had insisted on packing her own suitcase. Although Nate did inspect what Erin had packed to make sure it was appropriate.

Much like the clothing that Nate was wearing now, the clothing in his suitcase were changing by the minute. He knew he had packed some dresses and other outfits but he couldn't quite remember what they were. Although he knew they were all beautiful and could we worn no matter what activity that came his way during the vacation. The argument about not being able to afford this vacation was wiped from both Mike's and Nate's mind. There was the lingering rememberance of an argument but neither could pinpoint what they had been arguing about. Besides what did it matter since Mike did apologize and was buying Nate a gift.

Nate decided to buy some jewelry instead of clothing. He could get some pretty earrings at a reasonable price and wear them tonight. Any dress he bought that he wanted to wear dancing would be expensive. Nate knew that if he picked something too expensive that Mike would still buy it for him but it would hurt him. Nate knew how Mike thought in so many ways.

Arriving at the jewelry counter Nate struck up a conversation with the saleslady. The old Nate avoided the help from sales people, but because of the wish Nate was now much more friendly with everyone. The wish made several people back at home who had been acquaintences to Nate now his friends. Total strangers that Nate had only saw a few times and never talked to he could remember having conversations with and even sharing a laugh or a smile.

"Hello," Nate said to the saleslady with a smile, "my man wants to get me a present. Can you help me?"

"Surely, what are you looking for."

"I think a nice pair of earrings. But I don't want them to be too expensive." Nate's ears had become pierced while walking around the store although Nate didn't know it.

"Do you want hoops, studs or dangling earrings?"

"Something that I can show off while dancing tonight. My man is taking me out."

"Wow a gift and he is taking you out. He must be some guy."

"He definitely is. I LOVE HIM TO DEATH."

The conversation went on like this for a while as the saleslady showed Nate earring after earring. It took a while before Nate could find one that looked great but wasn't too expensive and would go with the dress he now remembered packing for the trip. Nate had the earrings on and was looking at them in the mirror when Mike finally returned.
15523221111211212.title: Nate selects a gift

choices: They find a place to rest
155232211112112122.content:
"Wow, those look great," Mike smiled as he looked at Nate.

"Thank you!" Nate smiled back.

Naturally assuming this was what Nate wanted, Mike paid for the earrings, which weren't too much thankfully. Not like Mike minded though. He was happy that things were making up now.

Smiling again, Mike took Nate's hand in his own, and they walked out of the store together. Nate seemed to enjoy this new closeness, as it seemed like he was understanding and learning about Mike much more now. How his body continued to look was further proof of that, as he clearly had the physique now of a more typical woman. He was still lacking assets though on the chest but everything would come in time.

"So, what now?" asked Nate.

"Well....I'm not sure. We've still got a lot of time," said Mike.

"Oh come on. Surely you have a better answer than that," Nate replied. What kind of answer was that when there were many things surrounding them. Did he have to spell things out for Mike? As he was pouting a bit, his shirt finished tightening against him as it became a top with a wide berth at the neck, fitting with the skirt he wore now.

"Okay..how about we explore the place a bit more?" offered Mike.

"That's fair,"

And so, with their hands still together, the two of them continued walking briskly through the mall. Nate was enjoying this time very much, a lot more than he thought he would when they first walked in. He really wondered just what they could do next. Though, he did kind of wish that Mike had a bit more initiative. He loved the guy of course, but looking back, he could really use a fire underneath him.

Well, that was a bridge to burn some other time.
155232211112112122.title: Nate and Mike walk hand in hand

choices: Nate wishes their hotel room would be empty
1552322111121121221.content:
"Mike, did you know there is a lower level to this mall?"

"No, I thought there was just this and the upper level." The upper level had less stores and a big food court than the main level. The lower level was much smaller than the two level's above it. The lower level. Had only three stores and a post office. Few people came to the lower level because there was only specialty items there who needed the extra space of a huge store. One of the stores sold mattresses and used the huge size of the store to show all the different types of mattresses in their individual glory. It also had a huge warehouse in back to store its wears. There was also a piano store and a furniture store in the lower level. as such the lower level was secluded, especially the hall to the restrooms which lied between the mattress store and piano store.

Once on the lower level, they saw it nearly deserted at least as compared to the other levels. There were people about but they were widely spaced. Seeing the long hallway to the restrooms, "Hey I have to 'wash my hands.'" Which was Nate's way of telling Mike he had to use the restroom. Just yesterday, Nate would have told him that he had to take a piss, but Mike expected his women to be less crass than a boy and so that was the phrase he now used.

"OK, I'll wait for you here."

Nate was starting to act not only as Mike's wife, but one that knew him very well and understood what he wanted. Looking down the long hallway, Nate knew that Mike wanted to get him alone, but he didn't want to seem too forward in public. Mike was a gentleman at heart and he liked his women demure and ladylike. Nate knew this and he knew he had to give Mike an excuse to do what Mike really wanted to do but thought he oughtn't.

"I think you should come with me. That hallway looks long and dark." Nate appealed to the Knight In Shining Armor persona that was part of Mike.

"At your command." and they both set down the hallway. On the way, walking hand in hand, Nate pretended to stumble which was as much a pretense as his need to use the restroom. Soon Nate was in Mike's arms looking up at him. Mike held Nate protectively and soon bent down to give Nate a kiss. Mike didn't consciously want to get romantic alone in this hallway. But because of Mike's inadvertent wish a while back, Nate knew Mike better than Mike knew himself. Nate's mouth was held slightly ajar and soon they were kissing like teenagers that Nate had been just a few hours ago.

Soon they were heading back to the room to have makeup sex. Nate used this opportunity to pop another candy in his mouth and wish....
1552322111121121221.title: They find a place to rest

15523221111211212212.content:
"You know, it would be nice if we just had time to ourselves. You know, just you and me alone," Nate smiled.

"I agree, though just not in a place like this," Mike replied as they were walking back.

"Hmm, I kind of wish that everyone was doing something else, leaving the hotel room empty," Nate ended up saying, though most of it was to himself so Mike didn't catch it.

"You say something?"

"Oh no, nothing." Nate beamed back.

Leaving the mall building, the two of them stepped back out into the sun and began making their way back to the hotel. Nate really hoped that they would finally get some alone time there. He knew that Mike wanted it just as much, even if he didn't think so. Nate slowly wrapped looped his around Mike's, while still keeping their hands together. To anyone watching, they looked like any romantic couple, and Nate liked that thought. It was just another sign of how close they were now. And hopefully, if they could get some alone time, they could get ever closer.

"What are you thinking about?" Mike smiled, seeing the smile on Nate's face.

"Oh nothing. Just thinking." Nate smiled back.

It was right as he said that that Nate felt the urge to use his free hand to move a strand of hair out of his face. He slowly began feeling it brushing against his neck and bare shoulders, as his hair seemed to be growing. Of course, that was something else Mike liked. He really liked a woman with long hair, even if he always said the right things like any style Nate wore was good for him.

Eventually, they finally reached the hotel, heading back up to their room. Mike retrieved the key he had, opening it up for the both of them. It was devoid of people when they did.

"Oh, did everyone else leave?" asked Mike, closing the door behind him.

"Maybe...." Nate said, though he still smiled. This just made things perfect.
15523221111211212212.title: Nate wishes their hotel room would be empty

155232211112112122122.content:
Nate thought his, (well her wish, she was much more like a woman than a teenaged boy by now and I'll stop referring to Nate as a he from now on) was totally harmless but it wasn't . It was the third wish all of which had to be followed. Everything had to be as normal seeming as a man and his wife returning to their hotel room.

If this was true then who was Lynda? Families didn't go on vacation with an extra woman around. But two families could go on vacation together and so the candy changed things to make this true. Lynda was now married to Trevor who was seven before the wish and now he was just a year younger than Mike and married to Lynda. Nicole was now their child not, Mike and Nate's. Erin was regressed to Nicole's age and made here best friend. Now the two families going on vacation each with a girl around five seemed perfectly normal.

Lynda announced to the girl, "Hey who want's to get ice cream?"

"Me!!!" the little girls said in unison.

"OK, put on your shoes and socks and we'll go." The little girls seemed to loathe wearing any type of footwear so they had to find and put on the hated items, but anything to get ice cream. Soon everyone was all ready to greet the out doors and they all left five minutes before Mike and Nate returned to the hotel room.
Nate could never know that such a small wish would have such big repercussions for so many.

Mike opened the door for Nate but let Nate enter the room first. Nate was overjoyed that the room was indeed vacant. Nate now had to decide to get changed or to just seduce her husband without any ado.
155232211112112122122.title: Another choice

1552322111121121221221.content:
Lynda led both girls out of the hotel before Mike and Nate returned. Nicole was really enjoying herself, perhaps more than others on this vacation. Erin was okay with it too, although she kind of felt odd about it.

Before they had left the hotel, she was playing dolls with Nicole, yet she honestly wondered why. She hadn't been into dolls for some time. There was also how she never seemed to have the kinds of clothes she wanted. She liked the kinds of clothes teenagers would like, yet she was stuck in clothes that better suited her age. It didn't quite seem fair to her.

Of course, as much as Erin thought this was weird, nothing was weirder than Nicole's dad, Trevor. She even had one or two choice words about him, to which she got scolded for when she spoke them. The guy kind of seemed lost at times, letting Lynda direct most matters.

"What's wrong Erin?" Nicole gave a look to her friend, getting Erin's attention.

"Oh nothing. I'm fine." Erin smiled back. At least being with her friend cheered her up when she felt odd. Perhaps that's how Trevor dealt with things. He at least had Lynda, even though it seemed like she mothered him too at times.

"Oh, I want ice cream too!" Trevor said, a bit too excited for a man his age.

"Yes yes, I know." smiled Lynda. "My goodness, everyone is excited today."

Luckily, a little ice cream stop wasn't too far from the hotel, so it was an easy walk there. Lynda tried keeping Trevor under control, which only sort of worked. At least it was enough to reduce the odd locks that got sent their way on occasion. The girls were just fine though, chatting while getting their snack for the day. Though, the kinds of topics Erin liked to talk about kind of went over Nicole's head at times.

"You know some weird things," said Nicole with a toothy smile.

"You know it." replied Erin.
1552322111121121221221.title: Follow Lynda's family

choices: Lynda scoulds Trevor for being so messy
15523221111211212212211.content:
When they got to the ice cream shop everyone got ice cream which included Lynda although she was the only one who felt guilty about it worrying how those few ounces of 'FAT' would look sitting on her hips forever.

"Go ahead," encouraged Lynda. "Pay the nice man."

"Do I have to?" Trevor whined.

"Your the man of the family, you have to pay for it."

"OH, alright." Trevor then moved closer to the counter. "How much is it?"

"$13.57, Sir," the counter man said.

Trevor reached into his pockets and pulled out a bunch of stray bills and then dumped it on the counter. Then one dollar at a time gave the money to the counterman. Trevor's intellect had grown with his age, just not many of his social skills.

Each person got their own flavor of ice cream. When Trevor got his he licked it with reckless abandon. he got it all over his face and clothes and even his hands. Even though the ice cream didn't have time to melt.

Nicole also got a bit messy on her face but not as much as Trevor. Erin kept much of her face clean although she did have to eat the ice cream like Nicole with the ice cream in one hand and her dolly in the other. She didn't know why she carried a dolly. It was just expected of her. When they left the house she was going to leave it back in the room, but Lynda found it and gave it to her before they left.

Erin didn't mind playing dollies with Nicole. She mostly let Nicole play and she sort of followed right along, much like a babysitter playing with a young girl. Carrying her own dolly didn't seem right to her, but she had had her for as long as she could remember and Nicole always carried one so she would to.

"Nicole," Erin asked, "would you like to play dress up with makeup when we get back?" Nicole liked to play dress up and Erin did too although for different reasons. Erin imaged herself in pretty clothes and makeup and starting to flirt with boys (older boys than herself.) Whereas Nicole just liked feeling silly in other people's clothes. To Nicole it was as much fun to wear her mom's clothes as to dress up like a princess.

"I don't know, maybe."

"Come on, it'll be fun, especially the makeup." The makeup is really what Erin wanted, the clothing wouldn't fit her five-year-old frame but the makeup could be put on to make her look pretty.

"You can play with makeup if I can be a princess."

"Great!!!"

But now they had to ask Lynda for permission. They had gone out now its time to get back.

When Erin asked her, Lynda told her that they weren't going to the room, that they were going to the pool instead. This suited Erin just fine, there would be cute guys at the pool. She could watch them while playing with Nicole.
15523221111211212212211.title: After the snack

155232212.content:
Nate realized that no one knew what his family was really like here. He could make changes to his family and everyone would not know anything was wrong and the candies wouldn't change them so it would be their true reaction. This got Nate to thinking. Nate went into the bathroom so he could make his wishes in peace. Nate put a candy in his mouth and set out to change his family and see how people reacted to them.

"I wish that mom (Lynda) wore the pants in the family and that dad was a cuckold husband who did everything that mom wanted." Nate thought it would be great to see his once proud father being bossed around by his formerly demure wife.

Next Nate wished, "I wished that Nicole and Trevor would swap, clothing, hair and names." Nicole who would still be a five-year-old girl would look like a boy since its really the hair and clothing that lets people know which are the boys and which are the girls. Would people treat them any different if they saw what looks like a five-year-old boy who was carrying a dolly and acting as girly as Nicole had been. Most people would probably think that Trevor was a tomboy. Nate was happy that Nicole usually wore swimsuits with ruffles at the waist so no one could see the outline of his penis.

For the final wish, Nate decided to be nasty at his sister Erin. They had been rivals for many years now since there was only two years difference in their ages. "I wish," Nate said. Nate had to word the wish right. "the whole family treated Erin as if she was a toddler under two years old and that Erin wouldn't complain." Then to make totally sure, "I wish that Erin talked like a toddler when strangers could hear her." "There that would do it," Nate thought.

Nate returned from the bathroom to look around. Mom was supervising dad as he was unpacking the suitcases. Trevor looked like a girl while wearing Nicole's clothes that had been resized to fit him. With her short hair cut and transformer's t-shirt, Nicole looked like a boy even though she was also carrying her dolly.

Nate saw the biggest change when he looked at Erin. Erin was dressed in a big bird t-shirt and was sitting in a stroller. She clearly wanted out of the stroller, but since Mike hadn't finished unpacking, Lynda stuck a pacifier into Erin's mouth instead to quiet her.

Nate smiled broadly as he thought about what fun he was going to have watching his family.
155232212.title: The vacation

1552322121.content:
Leaving the room, Nate trailed behind so he could watch what was happening. Lynda was leading the way with Mike pushing Erin who was in a large stroller which could accommodate her thirteen-year-old body. To Lynda's left was Nicole who thought her name was Trevor. She looked like a little boy because of her clothing and short hair but she was still carrying her dolly in her left hand. Her right hand was holding Lynda's. Trevor was walking next to his father. He wore a yellow girls top that had a kitten and teddybear on it. He wore girls jeans but they were in a style that could be worn by either sex. Of course there was little doubt that he was a girl to a stranger because of the length and style of his hair.

Since they were in the hall where people might be able to hear them Erin was saying "Wanna walk." to indicate that she wanted out of the stroller. But Lynda was having none of it, Lynda knew that it was easier to deal with a toddler in the stroller instead of letting them walk with the family. Mike would have agreed but he had no say in the matter.

Soon Erin's request to walk changed to, "Gonna potty." Which was Erin's way of saying I have to go to the lady's room. But to Mike and Lynda, Erin was too young to potty, which was why she was wearing a diaper. They ignored her and waited for her to use her diapers and then would change her. Of course, Mike would be the one taking Erin to the changing station at the men's room when the time was right. Either that or he would simply put down a changing mat and change her in public like any other toddler.
1552322121.title: Walking around the hotel

1552322122.content:
Lynda selected the spot in the pool area she wanted. She told Mike to get Erin out of the stroller while she marked her territory for her family. Mike did as he was told and pulled Erin out of the stroller. Mike carried Erin in his arms so that the little rugrat wouldn't scamper off.

Trevor and Nicole removed their outer clothing to get down to their bathingsuits. Trevor who thought his name was Nicole was wearing a one piece girls yellow swimsuit with Minnie Mouse on it. Minnie was also wearing a red and white dotted swimsuit and had a matching bow on her head. Trevor's swimsuit also had ruffles that formed a pseudo-skirt that hid the outline of his penis. With his long girlish hair and swimsuit he looked like a little girl even though he was occupying his time playing with his cars. His play included the VROOM, VROOM sounds and the sounds of the cars crashing into each other.

Nicole stood next to her mother waiting. She wore nothing but boys swim trunks which left her chest exposed not that anyone minded. Even though she was carrying her dolly she looked just like a little boy because of her clothes and short hair.

Erin was wearing the same swimsuit as Trevor although in a larger size. The toddler style swimsuit was not designed to highlight her developing cleavage which was probably a good thing. The only difference between what Trevor and Erin were wearing was the fact that Erin wore a swimdiaper. The pseudo-skirt that hid the outline of Trevor's penis did nothing to disguise the bulge of the diaper that Erin was wearing. Since Mike was carrying Erin she couldn't get away. She wanted to hide but there was nowhere to go anyway. As with any young toddler Mike or Lynda always kept an eye on her so she couldn't scamper away.

Lynda told Nate to help watch the kids while they were in the pool. That job used to fall to Erin but since everyone (in the family) thought that Erin was a toddler that new responsibility befell Nate. Nate didn't mind since he wanted to watch everything that happened anyway. When Lynda thought that the family was ready she led the family toward the pool.
1552322122.title: At the hotel's swimming pool

info.brief_description: A discovery of some candies changes all around your life. Now over 100,000 views!
info.description:
All right, my 6th interactive story! Basically, this story revolves around magical occurances in the world. The things that happen mostly include TG sequences. For example, body switching, magical items, revenge, etc. Please update! I don't want to do this by myself.

I will keep track of girf points and, when I can, distribute them accordingly. Big points for great chapters!

Edit (2/1/2012): This story has surpassed 40,000 views and over 1700 chapters! Thank you so much everyone for your help!

Edit (4/29/2013): This story has surpassed 78,000 views and over 2000 chapters! Thank you so much everyone for your help!

Note (2/27/2012): For anyone who is really interested in Candies of Change and enjoys it, please check out my new Candies of Change 2 story. I'm looking for anyone who would be interested in helping add to it. Thank you for your time.

In addition, I plan on possibly creating new stories. If you wish to help me with that, you may contact me regarding that as well.

Also, if there are any of you that enjoy Fire Emblem, I'd like to get my Fire Emblem story going again. If you like that series and would like to help, contact me as well.

Here are the rules:

1. Keep it PG-13!
2. You can have sex, but not descriptive and try not to have too much.
3. Keep language PG-13 and also keep it tame (like not cursing every sentence)
4. Keep the story going and no killing the characters.
5. Try to make it a good length if possible.


Here's the story:

Nate (you) just had your 15th birthday. However, you find some candies that aren't what they seem.

Here are the characters (I may add more):

1. Nate Wilson (You): Male, 15-years old, short brown hair, blue eyes, average height and weight, about 5'6, kind, likes to be around friends.

2. Kate Smith: Female, 15-years old, your crush, long dark hair, green eyes, about 5'3, kind of a tomboy. You have crushed on her since kindergarden.

3. Tommy Iverson: Male, 15-years old, short sandy hair, blue eyes, about 5'6, loves sports, your best friend since kindergarden.

4. Erin Wilson: Female, 13-years old, blue eyes, shouder-length brunette hair, your younger sister, about 4'11. typical younger sister.

5. Heather Yamamoto: Female, 15-years old, hazel eyes, short dark hair, japanese-american, friend of you and Sonia, likes to have fun.

6. Lynda Wilson: Female, 36-years old, long brown hair, blue eyes, your mother (who takes care of you and your sister alone because your father is gone). Despite being 36, you could probably mistake her for late 20's because of her rather young appearance.

7. Mike Wilson: Male 37-years old, short brown hair, blue eyes, your father, like your mother he looks rather young for his age, cares about his children equally,

8. Bethany Farmer: Female 33-years old, shoulder-length brown hair, blue eyes, sister of your mother, has a good relationship with you, has 2 kids,

9. Carly Goode: Female, 13-years old, waist-length blonde hair, blue eyes, friend of Sonia's, really a girly girl.

10. Josh Howards: Male 17-years old, really short brown hair, brown eyes, friends with you, likes to mess with you sometimes,

11. Janet Day: Female: 16-years old, long strawberry-blonde hair, green eyes, a head cheerleader, kind of arrogant but has a nice side

12. Nicole Wilson: Female, 5-years old, brown hair, blue eyes, your younger sister,

13. Trevor Wilson: Male, 7-years old, dark brown hair, blue eyes, your younger brother

14. Brandon Ryan: Male, 13-years old, 5'2, 113 lbs, short blonde hair, blue eyes, lives close to Nate's house.

If you add any new characters, please describe them so I can add them to the list.
